If so, this is your chance to work in the first IBM area to become agile and to create meaningful solutions that impact our technology and business transformation for a new business era - all in just one summer!Required Technical and Professional Expertise Experience with User Experience (UX) designMinimum of 1-year experience using problem solving skills such as: Analyze causes using existing techniques or tools, prepare and recommend solution alternativesAbility to absorb professional knowledge quickly and develop skillsAbility to draw upon professional concepts to collaborate with others to carry out assigned dutiesAbility to challenge the validity of given procedures and processes with the intent to enhance and improveEnrolled in a Bachelor of Science in Business Information Technology, Management Information Systems, or a similar degree programAbility to work in the United States without the need for current or future IBM sponsorship Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Experience using Agile and Design Thinking methodologiesExperience working with leaders of designExperience writing user stories and requirements documents using analytical skills EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: SR BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST
Description: SR BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST Below you will find the details for the position including any supplementary documentation and questions you should review before applying for the opening. To apply for the position, please click the Apply for this Job link/button.  If you would like to bookmark this position for later review, click on the Bookmark link. If you would like to print a copy of this position for your records, click on the Print Preview link.  Bookmark this Posting -  Print Preview -  Apply for this Job  Posting Details  Posting Details  Reference Number 91-29150 Posted Job Title SR BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST School Name  Information Systems and Computing  Org  ISC-Applications & Information Services  Posted to the Web 06/22/2018 Posted Job/Salary Grade E Employment Type  Exempt  Hours N/A Position Type  Full Time  Position Schedule 9-5 Months 12 Position Length  Ongoing  Position End Date  University Overview  The University of Pennsylvania, the largest private employer in Philadelphia, is a world-renowned leader in education, research, and innovation. This historic, Ivy League school consistently ranks among the top 10 universities in the annual U.S. News & World Report survey. Penn has 12 highly-regarded schools that provide opportunities for undergraduate, graduate and continuing education, all influenced by Penn?s distinctive interdisciplinary approach to scholarship and learning.  Penn offers a unique working environment within the city of Philadelphia. The University is situated on a beautiful urban campus, with easy access to a range of educational, cultural, and recreational activities. With its historical significance and landmarks, lively cultural offerings, and wide variety of atmospheres, Philadelphia is the perfect place to call home for work and play.  The University offers a competitive benefits package that includes excellent healthcare and tuition benefits for employees and their families, generous retirement benefits, a wide variety of professional development opportunities, supportive work and family benefits, a wealth of health and wellness programs and resources, and much more.  School/Center Overview  Information Systems & Computing (ISC) is the University of Pennsylvania?s central IT organization, providing infrastructure and services upon which Penn?s numerous Schools and Centers build their unique tools and capabilities. ISC?s 270-plus employees work closely with the University?s IT organizations in order to create, deliver and support products and services that help Schools and Centers operate efficiently and effectively. We strive to be easy to work with, and to serve as a trusted advisor to Penn?s IT community, faculty, staff and students in support of an environment of discovery and progress. ISC?s focus on customer service and the high-quality, cost-effective, reliable implementation of modern IT solutions advances the mission of the University, as well as that of each individual School and Center. At Penn, technological freedom and departmental autonomy represent dearly held core values. ISC supports those ideas by providing foundational services and cogent counsel, empowering individuals and departments to employ their distinct strengths in support of their goals. Over the course of nearly three decades, ISC has helped constituents connect and thrive in an ever-changing technology environment. This rich base of experience allows us to respond to client, marketplace and economic needs in order to improve and optimize delivery, ensure the satisfaction of those who depend on our services, and consistently deliver lasting value to the broader University community. https://www.isc.upenn.edu/  Duties  Applications and Information Services (AIS), a unit within Information Systems and Computing (ISC), works with University clients to plan, acquire, develop,and maintain the University?s core business and student support systems. AIS is currently seeking a Senior Business Systems Analyst to join the team responsible for the implementation and support of identity and access Management systems. Review, analyze, support, and evaluate information systems, processes and client needs; perform and participate in the analysis, design and implementation of systems following appropriate standards and requirement gathering; conduct tests or test planning sessions; provide input for feasibility and prepare user/technical documentation; evaluate information gathered from multiple sources; reconcile conflicts; decompose high-level information into details; interpret low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs. Translate business and user requests involving enhancements and improvement initiatives to software systems into business requirement specification documents. Design the solution, coordinate completion/development of the solution, and ensure delivery of tested solution to the user. Document and track issues, action items, user requirements, and deliverables. May manage small projects. Accomplish all work within established methodologies and standards. Qualifications Bachelor?s degree and a minimum of four years of experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Applied systems analysis experience within a large-scale administrative computing environment with emphasis in applications and systems architectural design and development. Demonstrated in-depth knowledge across multiple technical environments and business knowledge. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and demonstrated high level analytical, problem solving, and debugging skills. Ability to work as an effective team member in support of the team objectives; ability to interact and communicate effectively with non-technical personnel, administrative users, staff, faculty and students, as well as professional Information Technology staff. Must be self-motivated, and be able to multi-task and function in situations with changing priorities. Strong requirements elicitation, specification, and validation knowledge and experience. Demonstrated successful knowledge of major components of the Systems Development Lifecycle methodology in the context of major systems implementations, including requirements gathering and development of functional specifications. Fundamental understanding of business processes. Experience providing support, documentation, testing, and systems analysis for enterprise-level applications.  Affirmative Action Statement  Penn adheres to a policy that prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, creed, national or ethnic origin, citizenship status, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected class.  Special Requirements  Background check required after a conditional job offer is made. Consideration of the background check will be tailored to the requirements of the job. Name: Analyst, Business Information Systems
Description: Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.SummaryWorking within Finance's Billing Assurance group, this is a multi-facetted technical role focused on the Business product offerings to help ensure accurate billing. This role will learn product construct across a diverse suite of products by interfacing with various marketing, finance, operations, and engineering teams in the organization and build detailed data integrity reports to drive billing compliance.Core Responsibilities- Perform requirements gathering, build, validation, automated implementation, and support of data integrity reporting. Identify new reporting opportunities.- Extract and analyze critical and sensitive customer billing information from Comcast's data warehouse and enterprise data environments using ETL software. Integrate data from multiple sources into unified reports that support executive and divisional reporting needs.-Responsible for facilitating UAT testing of newly built reports. Work with division resources to identify data issues and root causes, and develop technical solutions accordingly.-Lead weekly calls with report users to present findings, support content questions, and drive enhancements to ensure reports are actionable.-Responsible for maintaining a self-service reporting application. Ensure reports are actionable and remain aligned to current business practices.-Support hardware and software upgrades, as necessary. Coordinate with System Administrators and software vendor and confirm successful implementation.-Troubleshoot technical issues resulting in job failures and coordinate solution across appropriate groups (system administrators, database administrators, engineering, etc).Required Skills and ExperienceTechnical:BA/BS degree in Computer Science. Minimum of 5-7 years relevant work experience-Demonstrated proficiency with SQL coding a must.-Minimum 5 years experience with end-user reporting tool such as BRIO, Hyperion, Cognos, SAS, Microsoft Reporting Services.-Proficiency with shell scripting.-Prior experience working in a Unix/Linux server environment a plus.-Prior experience working with Oracle or Teradata databases.-Prior experience with programming languages (JAVA, PYTHON) a plus.-Experience working in a data warehouse environment preferred.Soft skills:-Excellent written and verbal communications skills- Excellent data analysis skills- Organized, structured, methodical- Analytical with strong problem solving ability- Strong prioritization and time management  Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

Name: Business Analyst - Technical
Description: Position Summary: Develops business model, system, and functional analysis for new and emerging market solutions. Leads discovery efforts to develop business requirements and dependencies through interacting with product managers, domain specialists, partners, and potential or existing customers. Creates a business systems analysis model that includes business and system requirements, product and technical specifications, and analysis artifacts and designs that are used by Design, Development, Testing, Technical Writing, and Training as the basis for the design, construction, and implementation of business and software solutions (both internal and external). Duties may include but are not limited to: Provides consultancy support to all business stakeholders in defining and designing inter-related business processes. Works closely with product managers, customer groups, and domain specialists in the specification and analysis of integrated solutions using software process engineering, requirements engineering, product development methodologies, interface knowledge, and the techniques and tools necessary for producing quality analysis artifacts in multiple development environments.Provides consultation and/or acts as the business lead on high profile customer implementations that require complex rule configurations. Demonstrates an in-depth knowledge of ERP integrations related to vertical markets and specialized business processes.Key member in the development of feasibility studies for development and new venture projects. Provides factual content and participates in the writing, editing, and presentation.Develops and maintains relationships with key external customers by applying in-depth knowledge of multiple customer business processes to provide and manage the development and implementation of proactive product solutions. Leads planning meetings with multiple customers to improve complex business processes and applies this information to on-going system analysis projects. Resolves conflicts as needed.Applies multiple advanced business analysis techniques to completing assigned project tasks (i.e. structured, OOA, OOD). Participates in the implementation of complex project methodologies working as a lead project team member. Takes initiative in coordinating dependent tasks and completing un-planned work efforts as necessary.Decompose business models into functional and system requirements specified in an appropriate level of detail suitable for use by those must base their work on the requirements. Represents business goals and requirements using alternative views, such as analysis models (diagrams), prototypes, or scenarios where appropriate. Leads the requirements analysis and verification work efforts ensuring that requirement statements are complete, consistent, concise, comprehensible, traceable, feasible, unambiguous, and verifiable, and that they conform to standards. Leads in feature, process upgrade, and requirements prioritization efforts across the enterprise.Manages the peer reviews and inspections of requirements documents to ensure that the requirements were interpreted correctly. Applies their knowledge of business models, partner integrations, strategic initiatives, and systems to upgrade where appropriate.Gathers and analyzes the business and systems requirements for the project staff, and develops internal applications and database systems to support the identified requirements. Documents all system designs, and provides maintenance as needed.Acts as a subject matter expert to assist in developing and reviewing tests plans, scenarios, and cases. Works with Testing to develop quality test coverage. Assists in developing the data necessary to test the application.Proactively plans and provides enterprise support for newly implemented solutions and enhanced applications. Provides system configuration support to key customers enabling the implementation of key features. Supports the Sales and Practice leaders in promoting and demonstrating product solution to external customers and partners. Proactively researches technical trends and seeks ways to apply technology to support business processes. Makes their recommendations to segment management. Applies their financial understanding, knowledge of a market, and information extracted from external customers and partners to providing solution development and business process improvement recommendations.Serves as the project lead for business analysis tasks on highly complex mission critical projects with minimal supervision. Breaks downs business level models into work packages, and provides size and scheduling estimates as necessary. Provides an overall business analysis status to the project manager, and proactively communicates any scheduling, scope, or cost issues. Provides a task/project status to all stakeholders. Manages the work of other business analysts providing direction and performance feedback when necessary.Establishes and implements effective requirements practices, including use and continuous improvement of a requirements process. Assist with the development of the organization’s requirements engineering policies, procedures, and tools including the implementation requirements reuse across projects.Education & Experience: Bachelors Degree or Master’s Degree in related field, specialized training or equivalent work experience. 10 years of business system analysis experience in software development with 15 years relevant technical, systems analysis, and business work experience. Three (3) of the 10 years should be concentrated on the development of new ventures, markets, and/or products. Tax and/or financial industry experience required. At least 1 year of experience acting in the role of consultant servicing the product implementation and configuration needs of high profile customers. Requires experience/in-depth knowledge of several products (tax types), markets, requirements processing, advance business analysis and modeling concepts, information systems (multiple environments), software development lifecycle (several forms), facilitation, and influencing abilities and business process developmentThe Business Analyst must:Be recognized as an expert in implementing key product/process solutions (i.e. tax type, vertical, etc…) having the ability to meet the business goals a customer by applying a custom configuration or process.Ability to act as a consultant to interface with high priority customersBe an expert in several product lines and possess a strong working knowledge of the major integrations (i.e. ERP, G/L, Logistics) and their affect on system behavior.Have expert knowledge in several business analysis methods (Procedural, Object Oriented, Joint Application Development, and Rapid Prototyping). Demonstrate a working knowledge of relational database concepts and the related modeling and implementation tools.Be able to develop internal applications and/or database systems to meet project member needs.Demonstrate a full knowledge of the latest areas of new technology and how they could apply to internal and commercial business needs.Have the ability to communicate to all levels of management in all settings with all forms.Demonstrate the ability to structure and perform new market, product, and solution business modeling methodologiesHave a demonstrated ability in leading teams assigned to large complex development projects, and/or a demonstrated ability to perform highly complex technical tasks related to mission critical systems.Work independently with an ability of planning, prioritizing, and completing segment-level work assignments requiring only minimal direction. Some travel required

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: POSITION SUMMARY: This role will be solely responsible for the top level Technical and Admin support, during the Enhancement, Implementation and Integration process of the Rhoads Industries internal Business, Operations, and Financial Systems.  We are looking for more of a "mechanic than an engineer" (so to speak) someone that can "turn wrenches" and help Diagnose issues instead of "design a car."  Computer Proficiency/Working Knowledge in MSOffice Suites &SPECIFICALLY the following:  MS Dynamics SL (NOT GREAT PLAINS)  MS Excel  SQL. GENERAL FUNCTIONAL REQUIREMENTS: Support the design, development, testing, and implementation of new functionality and processes of financial, operations, and business support applications.  Actively support the development and maintenance of MS Dynamics SL system including a system upgrade.  Perform routine maintenance, audit, and review of system data.  Gather end-user requirements and translate to existing or new application features.  Identify and propose system solutions as well as recommend improvements to existing software programs as necessary.  Work with internal teams and external vendors on interfaces between third-party applications.  Design and create internal reports.  Troubleshoot and provide system support for internal customers as needed.  Develop process flow and corresponding documentation.  Assist the team in ensuring that users receive proper systems training and documentation. QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION:Bachelors degree in Computer Science, MIS, Accounting, Finance, or a related field.Min 3-5 years of experience working with and supporting financial applications and financial system interfaces - specifically MS Dynamics SL.Ability to analyze data, communicate with non-financial and non-technical internal end-users.Understanding of accounting processes, procedures and internal controls.Basic knowledge of budgeting and forecasting.Ability to work independently as well as to function effectively and collaboratively in a team environment.Great attention to detail and time-management skills.PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Must be able to work in a variety of physical positions, including sitting, standing, walking, and driving in an automobile, and may require walking and standing on irregular and uneven surfaces in an industrial setting. The performance of this position may occasionally involve exposure to construction or industrial areas where the use of personal protective equipment such as safety glasses, hard hats and hearing protection is required.  Job Type: Full-time  Experience: Accounting: 1 year (Preferred)Microsoft Office: 1 year (Preferred)Excel: 1 year (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Required)

Name: Jr-Business Analyst

Name: Consumer Trend Analyst
Description: Job Description Your Team  At Bresslergroup, we are a motivated lot of thinkers, makers, and problem solvers. We challenge and inspire each other every day. BGers are curious, clever, and confident, and we look for candidates who are all those things and more. Our firm is technically grounded, so that we can take any idea - no matter how complex - and make it a reality, while simultaneously keeping our design simple and clean. With five disciplines under one roof, we work in multidisciplinary teams whose combined research, creative, and technical expertise add value throughout a collaborative product-development process. This is how we remain reliably innovative.  Your Purpose  As a Consumer Trend Analyst, you develop in-depth, contextual understanding of the consumer and contribute to design strategies that impact our clients' business. You will join the growing Design Strategy team, and collaborate with our research, design and engineering teams to create elegant solutions to complex design challenges.  You are comfortable and fluent with leading consumer trend analysis across multiple industries using both primary and secondary research.  You are excited about the opportunity to help the Design Strategy team continue to grow and expand their capabilities and resources.  Key Responsibilities  Create well-considered, insightful reports that combine consumer and secondary research on social-cultural, business, and technology trends.  Develop quantitative and qualitative consumer research studies and translate the research data into actionable insights for our clients.  Conduct co-creation workshops with key stakeholders to develop insights and new perspectives about the future of their business.  Present research findings through data visualizations, storytelling, and written analysis for our clients and internal teams.  Work with design strategists to turn insights into forward-looking, evidence-based strategies that impact our clients' business models and product road maps  More About You  You have a degree in business, marketing, social science, design or a related discipline. You have at least 3 years in a relevant research, marketing, consumer insights, branding or consulting role. You have worked in a consulting environment for at least 1 year and are familiar with how they operate.  You are clever.  You have a true passion for Design Strategy and consumer trend analysis, as evidenced by your career and education choices. You have extensive experience developing consumer insights for the future, as well as with various qualitative and quantitative research methods. You have superior knowledge of consumer behavior and trends. You have a talent seeing patterns behind data. You are a strategic thinker with a deep understanding of how consumer behavior can impact business. You are a great story-teller with the ability to explain complicated concepts in a clear, concise way to our clients and internal teams. You demonstrate high standards of workmanship and attention to detail and can help improve departmental processes and best practices.  You are curious.  You like to explore new territories and learn from others. You have a deep understanding of quantitative and qualitative research methodologies, concepting processes, approaches, and tools and take the initiative to improve them. You're also comfortable with global travel (role may include up to 10% travel), either on your own or as part of a team. You are self-motivated and have a demonstrated ability to work effectively, both independently and as part of a team.  You are confident.  You are comfortable with ambiguity and complexity, because sometimes that leads to the most unique, unexpected design solutions. You possess a strong work ethic and are willing to 'do what it takes' to get the job done.  You have excellent writing, presentation, and interpersonal skills - all needed for research, facilitation, interviews, and client presentations. Your writing is concise, grammatically correct, and has the appropriate tone. You possess strong empathy and verbal communication skills that allow to you communicate with anyone and unlock what consumers are thinking and feeling.  You can work on-site in our Philadelphia office, and are willing to travel for client work.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: The Business Systems Analyst plays a critical role in helping integrate enterprise application systems for customers and supply chain vendors. The Business Systems Analyst would be experienced in preparing detailed requirements, and flowcharts for the development and implementation of interfaces. The use of understanding key business processes will be required to able to align with IT systems and support the integration life cycle for internal business functions, external customers and supply chain partners. He or she will also act as the primary contact for issues related to their domain. Name: Analyst
Description: THE JOBASG analysts have the opportunity to grow extraordinary businesses at three levels: with our clients, in our investments, and at ASG itself. Analysts are given project-critical responsibilities from day one and quickly take ownership of deliverables. We take great care in looking for analytical candidates who are rational, resilient, and innovative; this brings together strong team members who often get to work on unstructured problems and do so with a high degree of flexibility.  We build small, dedicated teams that have significant opportunity to directly engage with C-level leadership at our client and partner companies. In our work, analysts benefit from a healthy mix of strategy and project delivery; for example, an analyst would both create a sophisticate model and directly communicate it to our partners and adjust on the fly. We are seeking exceptional candidates to succeed with us on our exceptional team.THE COMPANYAt Archetype Solutions Group, we deploy our analytics and product development expertise with a unique strategy, divided into two arms: consulting and venture. Our consulting work specializes in bringing start-up like innovation to enterprises in the middle market. We identify opportunities to partner with clients and create products adjacent to their current offerings or those that reach across new industries. We invest directly in our venture partners and leverage our experience with analytics, product development, and business strategy to drive rapid growth.  Our team is made of former management consultants, financial and data analysts, and developers who advance a portfolio of companies through analytics expertise. We break the normal grind to rapidly develop innovative solutions and passionately pursue entrepreneurship across the healthcare, finance, and hospitality industries.RESPONSIBILITIES Scope out opportunities to incubate high impact business opportunities with existing partnersWork with our partners to refine existing client-facing service offerings, and look for new features and add-on servicesDesign efficient processes to help clients utilize solutions in a changing business environmentContribute to a dynamic and engaging work environmentKeep multiple projects on-track, while both structuring and executing tasksManage change in organizations through clear, concise communicationsIntegrate and analyze disparate data sets and design custom reportsResearch and select service providers to support and help execute initiativesSupport the development and testing of new technology tools and/or offeringsCreate client deliverables and sales materials (presentations, brochures, etc.)QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s degree in any discipline, although strong academic performance with analytical and quantitative coursework is preferred (e.g. engineering, business, economics, finance, marketing, etc.)GPA 3.5 or aboveRelevant internship experienceAbility to organize, analyze, and present dataStrong oral and written communication and skillsMust be a team player, self-motivated with a strong work ethicProficiency in MS Excel and PowerPointPreferred: knowledge of SQL, VBA, R, SAS, and business intelligence tools (e.g. QlikView, Tableau) We’re an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, age, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Name: Associate Business Process Analyst
Description: If you want to achieve more in your mission of health care, you have to be really smart about the business of health care. Challenge yourself, your peers and our industry by shaping what health care looks like and doing your life's best work.(sm) Primary Responsibilities: Responsible for end-to-end business process activities - creating, controlling and improving business processes around pharmacy benefits, eligibility, and the coordination of benefits  Ensure eligibility and other health information is loaded accurately and timely end-to-end to ensure accurate point of sale and/or retrospective handling of pharmacy claims  Ensure all errors are resolved timely and source system problems are escalated and supported through resolution  Diagnose process improvement opportunities through research and analysis of data  Advocate for new ideas and process improvements to close gaps, reduce manual efforts, and enhance the member experience  Document processes to reduce operational ambiguity and manage change  Collaborate within the organization to implement changes required due to process, product and/or annual changes  Review business requirements for system enhancements or changes; create and execute test scenarios in a timely manner  Focus on improving the member experience and increasing the quality/effectiveness of the Pharmacy Benefit Operations team  Apply a basic, structured, standard approach to work

Name: Project Analyst
Description: Title: Project Analyst Location: Philadelphia, PA Job Description: The primary purpose of the job is to: To support major existing client projects and new business implementations through coordinating and completing detailed documentation ensuring timely, accurate, and efficient requirements and deliverables for on-time execution. Supports the Regional Service Delivery model with activity tracking and documentation to improve overall operational understanding of customer requirements. Duties include: • Tracking the progress of the implementation through a project plan, managing calls with all stakeholders including maintaining all documentation ensuring the accuracy and timeliness of the project. • Develop a comprehensive project plan for Part D, Commercial, Medicare, and Medicaid New Business Implementations and other projects as necessary. • Control and implement a process of change when needed, document ant track issues, monitor assumptions and make decisions in a timely manner, understand and use problem solving techniques. • Understand IPNS (claims processing system) from a high-level. • Coordinate, implement, test and deliver a project in order to produce an effective working system/product. • Collaborate with internal customers to deliver agreed upon requirements, through the timely and accurate documentation and effective management of partners to meet key deliverables • Participates and leads client calls and kick off meetings • Manages the intake requests from internal departments; monitors the work to ensure critical milestones are met. Identify risks of missing anticipated target date and report and escalate to management appropriately. • Supports the Manager of New Business and Project Services Manager of the department with day to day responsibilities • Identify process improvement opportunities providing proactive, consultative strategic solutions • Supports the Regional Service Delivery team with the tracking of activity and escalates to the Regional Supervisor as necessary. • Travel as needed. Name: Business Analyst / Product Owner
Description: AgileTrailblazers is seeking a Business Analyst who is responsible for working with the business and technical SMEs in discovery, modeling, documentation and management of data and business systems requirements. The analyst will be the responsible for serving as the liaison between the business team and the technical team in translating complex business information needs to application software. Candidate must have excellent time management and communication skills as they will need to communicate with both a technical and non-technical audience. Candidate must have proven experience dealing directly and successfully with individuals outside of the technology organization. Candidate also must have willingness to work in a fast-paced environment and have significant Agile experience including writing user stories and acceptance criteria. Experience in the healthcare field and knowledge of Electronic Medical Records are desired, but not required. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESMinimum of 5-7 years’ experience as a Business Systems AnalystBS/BA Bachelor's Degree in Business, Computer Science or Equivalent.Proven track record in the analysis, implementation and support of technology and workflow solutions and project management accountability.Must possess excellent technical and interpersonal skills.Must have strong attention to detail and initiative to follow through to resolve customer issues.RequirementsExperience working with business stakeholders and decision makers to gather and define business and functional requirements.Review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and develop strategies for improving or further leveraging these systemsCollaborate in the planning and design of new applications, and enhancements to existing applicationsExperience working as part of an Agile team, writing user stories, creating acceptance criteria, and collaborating with developers and designers.Research the healthcare landscape and translate the changing regulatory requirements into an impact analysis and product specifications.Knowledge of core hospital clinical and business software applications, such as patient registration, scheduling, billing, clinical documentation and electronic medical recordsPrepare and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential trouble areas.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Financial Analyst, Investment Management Join our successful Asset Management division and play a key client facing role within the Investment Management team.  You will use your experience as a Financial Analyst to conduct regular calculations, analysis and reporting for assets under management and flows, as well as fee revenue for the portion of the Sydney based business for our Investment Management group, both internally and externally for our clients, consultants and regulators. A key element of your role will also include the setting up of new accounts and maintaining communication with Client Services and the investment accounting function as well as supporting the development of the annual earnings plan and budgeting process.  Working closely with the Senior Analyst, you will assist in the collation of data from the other business units of our Investment Management team as well as those of the wider Asset Management group to assist in producing a consolidated view of assets under management, as well as supporting the assets under management component of requests for proposal (RFP) responses and external market surveys on both the Investment Management and wider Asset Management teams behalf.  Your strong financial analysis background, quantitative and communications skills will be utilized in representing the team in dealings with clients, both internal and external to Macquarie. We require your proactive approach and your ability to not only follow procedures, but actively contribute to the development of the internal control environment and the efficiency of the group.  You will bring with you, a Bachelors degree in either Finance or Accounting, coupled with 2-3 years of experience in management reporting, finance or accounting. With a solid understanding of financial concepts and strong quantitative analysis skills, you will also possess a strong working knowledge of Mircrostrategy as well as an understanding of the key components of funds management.  If you are looking for a challenging and rewarding role in a global capacity, then apply today. Your background will include: * a Bachelors degree in Finance or Accounting required  * minimum 2-3 years of experience in management reporting, finance or accounting  * solid understanding of financial concepts and strong quantitative analysis skills  * working knowledge of Microstrategy  * an understanding of the key components of funds management.  Macquarie Asset Management (MAM; formerly known as Macquarie Funds Group) is a full-service asset manager, offering a diverse range of products including securities investment management, infrastructure and real asset management, and fund and equity-based structured products. MAM comprises the following three divisions:Macquarie Infrastructure and Real AssetsMacquarie Investment ManagementMacquarie Specialised Investment Solutions.

Name: Compensation Analyst
Description: The Compensation Analyst is primarily responsible for ensuring that employee compensation is equitable and competitive. Compensation Analysts conduct job evaluations, using appropriate surveys, to determine the salary range of a position based on the responsibilities of the job. The Compensation Analyst reviews current and predicts future compensation trends to assist the organization to make prudent decisions. Finally, the Compensation Analyst maintains the HRIS system and works with the HRIS staff to update and report key compensation data. Requirements: Requires a Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business, or other discipline directly related to the position.  Three to five years related compensation experience.  Strong PC skills are required including Access, Excel, and Word.  High-level familiarity with HRIS systems and reporting tools is required.  Hospital experience is a plus.  Ability to work with all levels of the organization to communicate compensation activity is needed.  Strong problem solving and communication skills necessary.  Well organized and confident to work independently.  Ability to apply judgment on compensation matters is critical.  Knowledge of the Fair Labor Standards Act and PA Labor Laws is required.  CCP (Certified Compensation Professional) preferred.

This role understands requirements in the context of business problems, opportunities and recommends solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals. The BA will help transform the business by identifying business objectives, evaluating existing processes and proposing future state designs. The Business Analyst (BA) position is responsible for a wide range of responsibilities working under the direction of the IT PMO. The BA will take on responsibility for complex tasks related to requirements design, client engagement, quality control, and data analysis for numerous IT projects. *This is a 3-month Contract position.**Evaluating, researching and analyzing business processes, anticipating requirements, and uncovering gaps and areas for improvementLeading ongoing reviews of business processes and documenting the results of your effortsReviewing and understanding business processes and business requirements of the customers and translating them to specific business and technical requirementsCapturing moderately complex requirements for solutions by working closely with the business and appropriate IT team membersManaging requirements by documenting, analyzing, tracing and prioritizing; as well as controlling changeDeveloping functional design documents breaking down business requirements into functional requirementsCreation of technical documentation as required for process changes and application modificationsConducting meetings and presentations to communicate key insights and findingsDeveloping and document acceptance criteria / test plans for both solution and UAT test plansResponsible for executing both solution test plans and UAT test plans with stakeholders and end usersInterface with vendors to conduct discovery sessions, define and document requirements for a named set of new and existing custom developed or vendor software productsCreation of documentation including detailed requirements, user stories, acceptance criteria, internal and customer-facing procedure guides, and process flow diagrams, wireframes and UI mock upsStay up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systemsAdhering to Project Management Lifecycle (PMLC) and/or Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) standards and governanceEDUCATION & TRAINING -Bachelor degree in business or related fieldBA/BS Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or Engineering5+ years of experience working as a Business Analyst in the I.T. fieldCBAP or IIBA certification desiredKEY EXPERIENCE -Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skillsExperience developing and publishing technical in nature documentationA proven record of professionalism coupled with flexibilityPreferably, experience in data warehouses such as Oracle 11g, MS SQL Server and Microsoft BI platformProject management experience a plus

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Exciting Opportunity with one of our client, We are currently looking for Business Systems Analyst for the location Radnor, PA. Please find the job description below. The ability to analyze, design, test and implement systems, which enable the business community to achieve their goals and objectives, is critical to the success of this role. Name: Jr Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThe Jr Business Analyst is entry-level position that will be working directly with the Sr BAs, developers and business stakeholders throughout the entire software development lifecycle. They will assist with collecting and analyzing business requirements, testing functionality and creating end user training materials. Lastly, assisting with the scheduling and implementation of new software releases.  Primary Responsibilities  · Will liaise between business stakeholders and developers  · Prepare and/or analyze reports and project documents  · Gather business requirements and help turn them into technical design documents the developers will be able to use  · Ability to document use cases and create process flows  · Perform product testing on software  · Help identify gaps or missing processes and recommend solutions  · Provide support to end users through training materials and training sessions Requirements · Must have a positive attitude  · Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills  · Good written & verbal communication skills  · Strong work ethic  · Ability to multi-task  · Must have at least an Associates degree (prefer business or IT related)  · Basic Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook proficiency  · Basic understanding of information technology and business concepts  Company DescriptionEMR's presence in America has increased over recent years with organic growth accelerated by strategic acquisitions in key locations. We have coverage in more than 20 states with almost 2,000 employees spread across these sites. Our American operations form a crucial part of EMR's international activities.  Our core business is the recycling of metal from a range of sources such as End-of-Life vehicles/consumer products, industry, construction and demolition. We have extensive ferrous and non-ferrous operations worldwide and produce over 100 grades of high quality recycled materials which are taken to market by our substantial road, rail and shipping network.  Supporting our core activities are a range of specialist divisions including industrial clearance, total waste management, ship breaking, servicing local government service providers and cable, copper and aluminum granulation facilities. Also, through our own and our joint venture activities we are working towards becoming a zero waste company.

Name: Business/Data Analyst Intern-Coop - Boston

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThe Business Analyst will be responsible for initiating and leading short-, medium-, and long-term feature/functionality business and technical requirements that support the business plans and strategic business initiatives of RouteOne Holdings. The Business Analyst will be required to work with business stakeholders to create initial requirement specifications as well as work with existing business specifications to determine the detailed needs of the Development Team.  The Business Analyst position requires a significant level of coordination and negotiation skills, including the need to simultaneously work with customers, the business (and business partners), and technology teams to identify, assess, define, document, and negotiate for the best product features and functionality to enable RouteOne Holdings to meet or exceed its business goals. This position requires exceptional verbal and written communication skills, a cool, calm demeanor that can help focus and direct solutions to problems, strong analytic abilities that allow clear, precise definition of the features and functionality required, and an exceptional attention to detail and follow-through. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION:Work with the Product Development team, customers, and others to identify, categorize and document high-level business requirements.Analyze high-level business requirements and develop lower-level functional and technical requirements. Various deliverables include: system requirement specifications, user interface specifications, screen mock-ups, report mockups, process, and navigational flows, etc.Determine the impact of functional requirements on various aspects of the existing system in collaboration with other feature team members.Examine integration with existing applications and lifecycle support implications.Support design team in the translation of requirements into structured systems design. Facilitate requirements and design sessions with both business and technical team members. Participate in issue investigation and resolution as appropriate.Maintain ownership of a feature or feature set throughout the systems development life cycle, supporting design, development, quality assurance, and production support efforts. Act as the go-to person for requirements questions and clarification. In many cases, become an expert on specific features and participate in any changes even after implementation to production.Support user acceptance of a release or feature including the development of test plans, test conditions, acceptance criteria, and test scripts, validation of the application through participation in the testing process, coordination of user acceptance testing and support of end users during execution of user acceptance testing.Participate in updating of training materials content in coordination with Sales & Marketing team.Organize and/or participate in system demos and presentations to various stakeholders as needed.Support system implementation/rollout activities, including all necessary pilots.Communicate with application and system end users to gather system feedback and improve functionality.Manipulate data with standard Microsoft Office tools to support business case and issue analysis.Perform all work in accordance with companys quality programs, standards and procedures.Maintain safety, security, and privacy standards throughout all areas of responsibility.Other duties, as assigned.ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS FOR THE POSITION:Bachelors degree in business or technical area, or suitable work experience.Prior experience in the Business Analyst/Systems Analyst realm, with proven experience in one or more significant, complex software development projects.2 (minimum) to 5 years of experience as a Business/Systems Analyst.Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.Ability to lead and facilitate meetings and other product design, development. and support sessions.Ability to think logically and document own ideas and those of others.Ability to comfortably meet with, interview, and support internal and external customers (both face-to-face and via phone/web-conference).OTHER REQUIREMENTS:Prior experience in automotive retail finance or other related consumer finance experience is a plus.Mobile (app and HTML5/web-based) product experience a plus.Familiarity with prototyping tools/software very helpful (e.g. Axshare).Software/design usability analysis and/or design experience a plus.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: OverviewThe NSM Insurance Group Business Intelligence (BI) Team’s goal is to provide analytical insights to business stakeholders to drive data driven decisions. The BI serves all departments across NSM Insurance Group, including but not limited to, Marketing, Finance, and Underwriting. The BI team is looking to add a new member to thier team loacted in Conshohocken, PA.  The primary role for the Business Intelligence Analyst is to query, analyze data and present findings/recommendations to business stakeholders. Analyst will be asked to compile data from disparate source systems and build interactive reports to help present findings as well as provide business with future self-service reporting. In addition, Analyst will be responsible for maintaining and enhancing current SSAS Tabular and Power BI models.ResponsibilitiesAnalyze internal/external data sets using SQL Management Studio and visualization toolsCompile and verify data utilized for periodic scheduled reportingDevelop an understanding of all data contained within multiple data marts and source systemsTranslate business requirements into technical requirements for enhancements and new custom reportsDevelop data extract, transfer and load (ETL) processes via Power Query and/or SSISPerform ad-hoc analysis to find solutions to business inquiriesPerform regular data analysis monitoring to provide prescriptive recommendations based on data QualificationsDegree in Mathematics, Economics, Finance or other quantitative degrees.3+ years of experience with SQL3+ years of experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Qlik or TableauAdvanced understanding of Data Warehousing conceptsAdvanced in ExcelExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAble to tell a story, using dataProactive and able to work in an autonomous work environmentAdvanced knowledge of DAX is a plusExperience with statistical programming languages such as R, Python or SAS is a plus

Name: Business Systems Analyst I -
Description: Job Summary: The Business Systems Analyst is responsible for assisting in the identification of business needs and solving problems by supporting the implementation of IT solutions that reflect the necessary functionality to address business goals and objectives. Duties and Responsibilities: Partners with the Business Application Owners (BAOs) and IT staff to identify, specify, develop, and implement technology solutions and applications that address specific business requirements.  May support or participate in the following Business Systems Analysis activities under close supervision and instruction. Works with the Business Application Owners (BAOs) to create detailed requirements related to system issues and change requests: Business Analysis Planning and Monitoring: Approach planning  Stakeholder Analysis  Activity planning  Communication standards  Requirements management process and performance Requirements Elicitation activities: Elicitation preparation  Elicitation activities  Document elicitation results  Confirm elicitation results Requirements Management and Communication: Manage solution scope and requirements (approvals, changes, conflicts)  Requirements traceability  Requirements package  Requirements communication Enterprise Analysis: Assess capability gaps  Determine solution approach  Define solution scope Requirements Analysis: Prioritize requirements  Organize requirements  Specify and model requirements  Define assumptions and constraints  Verify requirements  Validate requirements Solution Assessment and Validation: Assess Proposed Solution  Allocate Requirements  Define Transition Requirements  Validate Solution  Evaluate Solution Performance  Expectations for results is that work will require initially significant feedback to complete straightforward requirements. As experience continues to build, this should reduce to moderate guidance to complete straightforward requirements.  Work scope will be limited to smaller requirements or a small part of a larger project.  There will be a limited ability to resolve complex issues, difficulty determining priority of issues, and minimal capability to see alternative courses of action due to the lack of experience.  Will maintain responsibility for facilitating partnerships with both Systems & Development and Quality Assurance to ensure that customer requirements are translated to design specifications and address any ambiguities in functional requirements to support appropriate testing efforts.  May support in the preparation of Cost Benefit Analysis to assist management in decision-making process regarding system changes.  Supports a team oriented working environment that promotes open discussion on important issues, a high level of personal commitment and accountability to the business, and a continued focus on quality and customer service.  All other duties as assigned. Education, Qualifications and Experience: Understanding of the BABOK© Guide (Business Analysis Body of Knowledge) and its applicability to the position.  Some working experience or practice with Business Systems Analysis as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) or Business Application Owner (BAO) or similar work experience required.  Degree or college diploma/certificate in business or information technology, or similar work experience required.  Insurance experience in operational area preferred.  Strong verbal, written, interpersonal and consultative communication skills.  Analytical thinking and problem solving.  Must be results-oriented, with attention to detail and committed to a high level of accuracy with ability to multi-task.  Must possess strong organization skills and the flexibility to manage changing business priorities.  Able to learn new skills and apply them in a thorough and thoughtful manner.  Ethical and honest behavior with all customers.  Able to work with various Microsoft Office programs such as Excel, Word, Access, Project Manager, Power Point, and Visio.SDL2017

Name: Senior Manager, MVNO Project Manager and Business Analyst
Description: Senior Manager - MVNO Project Manager and Business Analyst Communications, Media and Entertainment PracticeAbout Hitachi Consulting CorporationHitachi Consulting is the digital solutions and management consulting business of Hitachi Ltd., a global technology and social innovation leader. Hitachi Consulting is a catalyst for positive business change, propelling organizations to accelerate disruptive innovation and drive digital transformation. We help our clients innovate faster, develop new revenue streams, and respond to global dynamics with insight and agility. We collaborate with clients to create solutions that help maximize operational efficiency and deliver measurable, sustainable business results. For more information, visit www.hitachiconsulting.com. About Hitachi, Ltd.Hitachi, Ltd., (TSE: 6501), headquartered in Tokyo, Japan, is a leading global solutions company with approximately 320,000 employees worldwide. Fiscal 2015 (ended March 31, 2016) consolidated revenues totaled 9,762 billion yen ($118 billion USD). Hitachi continues to focus on its Social Innovation Business, which includes information and telecommunication systems, power systems, environmental, industrial and transportation systems, and social and urban systems, as well as the sophisticated materials and key devices that support them. For more information on Hitachi, please visit the company's website at http://www.hitachi.com/Purpose of Position: To work as a member of an enterprise wide program that will provide functional, operational, and product knowledge to Wireless MVNO integrations for Cable MSO’s. Will be responsible for the product requirements gathering through implementation of solutions. The Senior Manager will also apply functional expertise and client interaction skills in order to ensure engagement productivity, increase efficiencies for clients, resolve issues, and ensure overall client satisfaction. The Senior Manager will work under minimal supervision and will be required to exhibit leadership ability and mentorship to team members.Industry Skills: Telecommunications/Cable MSO industry expertise to include MVNO relationships and integrationsSkills:Strong Program/Project Management – experience and success on delivering complex projects for communication providersKnowledge of the Industry (communications) including trends, challenges, opportunities that are unique to the industryCommunication customer acquisition, ordering, activation, and customer support process knowledgeManagement experience (leading a team, managing resources, staffing related actions)Proven experience on core consulting capabilities like: requirements, testing, implementations, deployments, change management, etc.We are seeking individuals with the following experience:7 years of business analysis experience in an BSS functional operation at a communications service provider (e.g., Cable MSO, Telco, Cellular, Satellite)7 years of experience participating in cross-functional large scale operational projects, operational processes and/or systems implementationExperience with requirements gathering, testing, business process re-engineering and/or project management required Excellent technical and analytical skills and demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environmentExceptional communication skills; must be a self-starter and able to learn quicklyIntermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project and word Knowledge of billing, network element, and/or customer equipment data requirements and associated data migration dependencies, including potential operational process dependencies and data availability timing impacts.4 year degreeTravelRegular and expeditious travel throughout the United States may be required to meet client needs and timetablesLocation Philadelphia/Greater Philadelphia area .

Name: Actuarial Associate/Business Analyst - Retirement Software Team
Description: Actuarial Associate/Business Analyst ? Retirement Software Team *Date Posted:** November 6, 2018 Apply  Not ready to Apply? *JOB DESCRIPTION** While the preference is to have this role based in the Philadelphia or White Plains office, we will consider qualified candidates from any of our Northeast based offices. *The Role** The Retirement Systems Group (RSG) facilitates system development needs, product management/software governance and builds and delivers quality software, and support. This includes Valuation Systems, Client Portal and Client Facing Systems, Benefits Broking and Management, Benchmarking and other systems, most of which are used globally.  As an Actuarial Associate/Business Systems Analyst within the RSG Benefit Data Source software development team, you will be working with the business product owner as well as the product manager/lead developer to understand, manage and test requirements and software for global benefit benchmarking. As you learn, you will grow to manage some of those functions on your own for the team. In addition, can gain experience via interacting in global scope supporting and debugging actual client use-cases with Willis Towers Watson colleagues from around the globe. You will significantly grow your understanding of diverse global benefit plans, diverse valuation tools, and data structures, as they apply around the world, as well as your technical and problem solving skills. *About the Product** Benefits Data Source (BDS) is Willis Towers Watson?s global benefit database. BDS captures detailed information on employer-sponsored benefit plan design practices in areas such as retirement, health, wellness, death and disability, meals, paid time off and flexible benefits. The BDS suite (Benefits Online, BenVal) provides employers with benefit plan benchmark globally. Both applications are data intensive which requires major data collection efforts, data refining, etc. While Benefits Online is a subscription-based global benchmark analysis tool, BenVal provides an objective approach to compare the design of benefit plans for a group of companies through actuarial valuations. *The Role?s Activities** ? Understand, manipulate, and construct complex data structures  Use the product to assist in debug support requests and for new feature modeling, work with the developers to insure full understanding (for coding and unit testing), test execution and regression testing for both enhancements and bugs  ? Test the requirements and the software, execute testing and work closely with others on the team  ? Requirements review and possibly some requirements elaboration to detail in writing; for example, test cases or storyboards  ? Relate the requirements to developers and improve, revise them in review and in-step with change  ? calculation engine. Use Swift and grow to become an expert with the product  ? Support product quality and development process conventions  ?3+ years of experience as an Analyst, working with various software and documenting related processes and results in an organized fashion  ?Experience with Retirement Pension Plans and/or other benefits plans needed for this role. Actuarial background a plus, ASA/EA credentials a considerable plus  ?Quality focus related to software usage, inputs and output  ?Strong oral and written communication skills; team player Self-sufficient creative problem solver capable of indirect solutions  ?A passion to improve the product as well as the data analysis  ?Desire to learn, accept new challenges and have fun  ?Knowledge of projections of pension plan accounting/funding results a significant plus  ?Good with Microsoft Excel and have an understanding of SQL.  ?Bachelor?s Degree required *The Company** Willis Towers Watson is a leading global advisory, broking and solutions company that helps clients around the world turn risk into a path for growth. With roots dating to 1828, Willis Towers Watson has 40,000 employees serving more than 140 countries. We design and deliver solutions that manage risk, optimize benefits, cultivate talent, and expand the power of capital to protect and strengthen institutions and individuals. Our unique perspective allows us to see the critical intersections between talent, assets and ideas ? the dynamic formula that drives business performance. Together, we unlock potential. Learn more at willistowerswatson.com. *Equal Employment Opportunity** All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability.  Equal Employment Opportunity: https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf *Unsolicited Contact:** Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our web site or to personal e-mail accounts of employees of Willis Towers Watson are considered property of Willis Towers Watson and are not subject to payment of agency fees. In order to be an authorized Recruitment Agency/Search Firm for Willis Towers Watson, any such agency must have an existing formal written agreement signed by an authorized Willis Towers Watson recruiter and an active working relationship with the organization. Resumes must be submitted according to our candidate submission process, which includes being actively engaged on the particular search. Likewise, for our authorized Recruitment Agencies/Search Firms, if the candidate submission process is not followed, no agency fees will be paid by Willis Towers Watson. Willis Towers Watson is an equal opportunity employer. Apply  Not ready to Apply? at https://willistowerswatson.avature.net/WTWTalentNetwork *SHARE WITH:** + Share on Facebook  + Share on Twitter  + Share on Google+ Share on Pinterest  + Share on Linkedin  + Share by Mail *JOB SNAPSHOT** + Location:Philadelphia, PA, US  + Date Posted:November 6, 2018

Name: Senior Healthcare Data Analyst
Description: Req ID: 21904  Shift: Days  Employment Status: AF - Active - Regular - Full TimeJob Summary The senior data analyst is passionate about healthcare delivery in a patient care setting. A successful candidate is articulate, analytical, and a team player who understands the power of data in clinical settings. The analyst enjoys coordinating with interdisciplinary teams to create end to end solutions for quality improvement. S/he learns quickly, works independently, and is relentless in overcoming technical, process, and organizational obstacles.  The senior data analyst will join the Clinical Data & Analytics team and will be responsible for empowering users with data across the institution, providing a unique blend of clinical, technical, and analytical expertise. The team works with multiple groups within the organization to improve patient safety and quality, streamline operations, and contribute to clinical research. The team combines clinical knowledge with technology to empower decision makers and believes that analytics and data can improve outcomes, optimize processes, and reduce costs. The team is looking for creative problem solvers who are excited about joining a growing, collaborative team with a big impact.  The senior data analyst will function as an internal consultant for high-profile quality improvement projects. The analyst will be a reliable expert in translating clinical and business requirements into meaningful analysis. The candidate will need to build relationships with key stakeholders, be an expert in multiple data sources, and implement sustainable solutions. S/he will be counted on to bring project management experience and share best practices with the team. The analyst must be comfortable with mentorship and leading team development and skill development efforts. Name: Sr Financial Analyst Revenue
Description: Req ID: 18452Shift: DaysEmployment Status: AF - Active - Regular - Full Time Job SummaryThe Senior Financial Analyst will assist with the operational activities of the Corporate Revenue and Reimbursement Department to ensure appropriate reporting of operating revenue for the Hospital and Hospital owned Primary Care Network. The Senior Financial Analyst, under general supervision:Calculates and analyzes the expected Net Revenue and makes appropriate journal entries.Manages the completion of mandatory Federal and State Cost Reports.Prepares Monthly Financial Documentation for Internal Customers, and external auditors.Works collaboratively with other Revenue and Reimbursement Staff, Financial Partners, Revenue Integrity Specialists, and Clinical Department Personnel.Provides in-depth, ad-hoc revenue analysis, as requested by management.Oversees the completion of Financial Surveys for external agencies.Job ResponsibilitiesOperating RevenueParticipate in routine analysis of posted gross revenue for the Hospital, Ambulatory Care, & Home Care.Maintain systems & files utilized to calculate the Net Revenue, A/R Reserves, Liquidity, & Bad Debt.Calculate & analyze expected net revenue for the Hospital, Home Care, & Ambulatory Care Network.Analyze accounts with special contractual arrangements to ensure accurate calculation of expected net revenue.Maintain and analyze monthly Bonus payments, capitation payments.Record and reconcile third party receivables and maintain monthly capitation and bonus payment schedules to ensure appropriate recognition.Support Finance Partners and leaders of the revenue team in the development of gross and net revenue budgets for hospital and hospital owned entities.Perform analyses of accounts receivable, credit balances, and bad debt each month.Partner with Patient Financial Services to review Primary Payor changes, Denied Days, and other Patient Accounting System actions that impact Net Revenue.Summarize and provide data on applicable changes to patient accounts to support Case Management Leaders.Produce in-depth schedules to support the Reimbursement Manager and the Director of Revenue and Reimbursement in reporting to the CFO on a monthly basis.Cost ReportMaintain all activities related to the completion of the Transplant worksheets in the Medicare Cost Report including:Transplant LogCollection and analysis of physician and staff time studiesGift of Life receivablesPartner with team with all aspects of the collection, analysis, and input of information necessary to complete annual Medicare and Medicaid cost reports. Complete all financial schedules related to Gross and Net Revenue, as well as schedules related to Home Care and Dialysis.Job Responsibilities (Continued)Other Assigned DutiesAssist with completion of annual audits by governmental agencies as it relates to revenue.Complete collection analyses as requested for specific services.Maintain Research Fee Schedules.Assist the Reimbursement Manager, the Director of Revenue and Reimbursement, and colleagues with any special analyses or specific project plans as needed, such as Payor mix analyses, and proactive revenue maximization.Assist Revenue Integrity Specialists with analyses related to their Assessments to provide meaningful information to clinical departments.Provide quarterly data to the Bureau of Labor Statistics.Complete and submit the Quarterly Services Survey to the US Census Bureau.Prepare and submit annually the information required for the Pennsylvania Health Care Cost Containment Counsel (PHC4) submission.Job Responsibilities (Continued)Required Licenses, Certifications, RegistrationsNone Required Education and ExperienceB.S. in Accounting, Finance or Healthcare ManagementMinimum of 5 years prior experience in Healthcare Finance Position requires the ability to quickly comprehend facts, identify trends, and alert the respective line of authority. It is essential that this position have good communication skills due to interaction with various outside and inside entities. Working knowledge of computer programs, and analytical ability to identify and correct problems.
