Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: You can use your mobile device to email jobs to yourself or others. You can apply to roles at KIPP from a laptop or desktop. Business Systems Analyst APPLYKIPP New Jersey Newark & Camden, NJType: Leadership & Support StaffFull Time/Part Time: Full-TimeStart Date: ImmediatelySubject:Grade:Organization: KIPP New JerseyPreferred Locations:Contact: Leadership RecruiterEmail: prodrigues@kippnj.orgEMAIL JOBHere’s what you need to know:  We’re looking for a Business Systems Analyst to support our quickly growing network of public schools in Newark and Camden, New Jersey and Miami, Florida. We need you to masterfully maintain and continuously improve our financial and HR systems - to play a critical role in keeping those systems running seamlessly and implementing enhancements to help us scale.  You will be a member of our Technology team, and will be deeply engaged within our Finance, Accounting, and Human Resources functions. You’ll also partner with key stakeholders across the organization, including from within our Data and Operations teams.  Here’s what you’ll do: Ensure business requirements are properly configured in all financial and HR systems.Ensure that our financial and HR systems reflect our internal controls and compliance requirements.Perform daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all systems.Implement and maintain any integrations between our financial and HR systems and other business systems.Establish and maintain user access, roles and permissions across all financial and HR systems.Provide end-user training and support, including onboarding new users.Create ad-hoc reports for core group of about 30 stakeholders and validate new and existing reports for accuracy.Identify, evaluate, and recommend technologies to improve the finance and HR business processes.Drive the full life-cycle for any financial and HR system upgrades or new implementations, including gathering of new or updated business requirements, technical analysis and design, oversight of system/feature selection process, testing, and implementation of customizations.Maintain documentation of key operational processes, system improvements and their revisions.Lead regression and new feature testing efforts in anticipation of new releases for existing systems.Work across several closely related teams, collaborating constantly and contributing ideas.Must have:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS, or related field3-6 years of System Analyst experience – analyzing requirements, designing solutions, implementing business systems/SaaS applications, coordinating integrations, providing routine maintenance and troubleshooting, etc.Ability to effectively gather and prioritize user requirements from disparate sources, going beyond user requests to get to key user needsStrong relationship- and consensus-building skills, with experience marshalling input and resources across different functions of an organizationDemonstrated ability to improve processes and procedures in a complex business environmentImpeccable attention to detailStrong communication skills, including ability to “translate” to non-IT teammatesProactive inclination, positive attitude, zero ego, and ability to problem-solve under minimal supervisionNice to have:Knowledge of GAAP accounting and experience with internal controls complianceExperience designing and implementing solutions in medium- or large-scale financial and HR systems, managing product rollouts, and working on integrations with other business systemsExperience working with any financial system and/or HRIS, especially one of the following: Ceridian DayforceAbila/Sage MIP Fund AccountingCoupaConcur or other travel and expense management programStrong understanding of database management systems, database structures, theories, principals, and practices; Highly proficient at writing SQL queries Need more reasons to work here?  In addition to a competitive salary, we offer a comprehensive benefits plan, a subsidized wireless plan through Verizon, and a laptop (Woot! Woot!), as well as subsidized travel for teammates commuting from New York. And 100% of KIPP New Jersey employees agree we have the best kids in the nation. So there’s that.  About KIPP New Jersey and KIPP Miami  KIPP New Jersey and KIPP Miami schools are part of the nationally recognized “Knowledge Is Power Program” non-profit network of college-preparatory, public charter schools educating elementary, middle, and high school students. In 2002, KIPP New Jersey first opened its doors in Newark’s South Ward as a single class of 80 fifth graders and has since grown to teach over 5,700 students in grades K-12 in Newark and Camden. 92% of KIPP New Jersey students currently qualify for free or reduced-price meals. KIPP Miami’s first school opened in the Poinciana Park neighborhood of Miami, Florida in summer 2018.  KIPP New Jersey alumni earn college degrees at more than 3.5 times the national average for students from low-income families. By offering highly effective educators with strong bonds to families, more time in school learning, services that support a variety of student needs, and a culture focused on achievement, our students are on the path to and through college. Visit KIPPNJ.org to learn more.APPLYEMAIL JOB

Name: Sr. Analyst, Business Process, Mobile
Description: Sr. Analyst, Business Process, Mobile Philadelphia, PA Requisition #: 186620Job Type: Full TimeLocation: Philadelphia, PATeam: OtherPub Date: 11/19/18Job Summary:Will have the primary responsibility for leading projects related to analysis, monitoring, and reporting of mission-critical applications and associated interfaces. Will work with end users, business and technical teams in the initial analysis and provide recommendations to drive the resolution of issues and to improve user satisfaction, policy compliance, and business efficiency. This role will require a technical understanding of data setup in different systems and technologies, data flows, transformation logic, and troubleshooting of various system/customer issues. The Analyst will gather, analyze, interpret and report on data collected from multiple sources and will be responsible for developing polished, high-impact, persuasive reports, presentations or dashboards that enable strategic decision making. The types of analysis will include identifying trends, root cause analysis and detecting anomalous data patterns. The Analyst will need to be comfortable utilizing a variety of technologies when sourcing and analyzing data.Major Duties:- Evaluates policy documentation and create business requirements for monitoring compliance.- Become an SME (Subject Matter Expert) in key areas of acquired knowledge and advise technical and business partners when required.- Trend policy compliance and identify policies that deviate from normal or accepted tolerances.- Work with end users to get their feedback, understand their needs, and recommendations to improve their product experience.- Analyze and monitor production server logs for anomalies.- Prepare charts, reports, white papers, and presentations for senior leadership.- Communicate effectively with users, management and external teams.- May join bridges during outages or deployments.- Develop and improve documentation to enhance and support problem analysis and resolution.- Must be able to multi-task and prioritize based upon the situation.- Must have regular, consistent and punctual attendance. - Ensure adequate cross-training to provide high quality coverage at all times.- Help maximize team productivity by taking personal responsibility for customer satisfaction and leading the team to do the same.- Perform other duties as assigned.Minimum Qualifications:- Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related field.- More than 5 years of related experience.- Ability to write and analyze SQL- Ability to analyze unstructured data i.e. application logs.- Ability to generate reports from the data located in disparate systems. - Should have excellent writing and presentation skills.- Should have excellent communication and problem solving skills.- Must be a team player.Familiarity with the following is a plus:- Linux/Solaris/Unix OS- No-SQL, Hadoop, Splunk, Kibana etc- Kafka, Spark, SSIS etc- Agile methodology- REST or SOAP APIs- Python, R or other scripting languages- ETL processes and technologyKey Words [SSIS, Kafka, Splunk, Kibana, Hadoop, Agile, ETL, Rest, Soap, Restful, Python, R, SQL, MsSQL, Elastic Search, Spark, Analysis, Compliance, Policy, BPM]Employees at all levels are expect to:- Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for howyou do your job.- Own the customer experience-think and act in ways that put ourcustomers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint,and make them promoters of our products and services.- Know your stuff-be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of ourgame-changing technology, products and services, especially our digitaltools and experiences.- Win as a team-make big things happen by working together and beingopen to new ideas.- Be an active part of the Net Promoter System-a way of working thatbrings more employee and customer feedback into the company-by joininghuddles, making callbacks and helping us elevate opportunities to dobetter for our customers.- Drive results and growth.- Respect and promote inclusion and diversity.- Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors, and ourcommunities.Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: A systems expert with great leadership skills is needed for a Direct-Hire Business Systems Analyst position in Radnor, PA!Our client company is a leading supplier in their industry. With over 10,000 employees, they provide services to several industries, including manufacturing, healthcare, government, and aerospace.  As the Business Systems Analyst, you will be responsible for the development and maintenance of company computer systems and business process solutions utilizing SAP functionality and various e-business solutions. The BSA will make an annual salary that ranges between $110 and $135K (dependent on experience and skill) as well as a bonus!  Responsibilities of the Business Systems Analyst include:  Configuring, analyzing, and designing systems.  Identifying gaps and working with the technical team to develop functional specs.  Testing and evaluating new Order Management computer system functionality.  Production support of existing Order Management computer system functionality.  Business process analysis, documentation, and presentation.  Collaborating with associates from various functional areas (such as sales, order processing, shipping, logistics, credit, A/R, finance).  Translating end-user requirements into detailed specifications.  Re-engineering business processes if necessary.  Developing functional requirements specification including business impact and ROI.  Coordinating and assisting in the development and execution of system conversions.  Developing efficient procedures, processes, and guidelines.  Perks of Working with Our Client Company:  Our client company’s top priority is their employees. They understand how important it is to plan for the future and have a good work/life balance, so they offer excellent perks to benefit their employees’ lives. Full-time employees receive benefits that include:  Medical and Dental insurance options  401(k) retirement plan  Prescription and vision plans  Vacation (with accrual based on time at the company)  Paid sick leave  Paid holidays  Training and career development opportunities  Scholarship programs  And more!  Bachelor’s degree in management information systems, computer science, and/or business, or equivalent work experience  Minimum 5 years of SAP experience in an IT systems analysis role working with end-users to translate business requirements into systems specifications  Minimum of 2 full life cycles of SAP Implementations  Extensive expertise of SD configuration and knowledge of the integration with Materials Management (MM) and Finance/Controlling (FI/CO)  Experienced with writing functional specifications for FRICEW objects  Knowledge of SAP Sales and Distribution solutions (SAP ABAP a plus!)  Excellent interpersonal, public speaking, and communications skills  Experienced in leading pieces of work, people, or deliverables  Proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite  Solid organization, time management, analytical, and project estimating skills  Willingness and ability to travel as required  Make sure to include this on your resume!  Your SAP configuration skill set.  Which SAP business processes you have implemented.  Functional specifications experience.  How many SAP implementations you have worked on.  Meet Your Recruiter!  Christa joined the CSS-Tec team in 2018 as a Technical Recruiter. She primarily works on Direct Hire opportunities and is passionate about finding the best new career move for the candidates in her network. Christa works hard to build lasting relationships with everyone she connects with! Fun Fact: Christa has a super energetic pup who has earned the nickname, Crazy Daisy!  Since 1994, CSS has been a National Staffing & Recruitment provider specializing in niche recruitment, placing professional talent in Accounting & Finance, Human Resources, Sales & Marketing, Call Center & Office, & Technical positions. At CSS, we consistently strive to meet the needs of our clients and candidates by understanding their expectations to produce the right match. We focus on the business growth plan, company culture, and the skill set of the candidate to make a highly effective match. CSS is paid by our unique and exclusive client base and candidates are prioritized based on client’s skill preferences. To our job seekers: we offer the highest level of free customer service and teamwork and the chance to become fully vetted so we can present you to our clients for possible temporary, contract, or direct-hire employment!

Name: Branch Analyst Program
Description: POSITION SUMMARY:The Branch Analyst Diversity Program is available to students from diverse backgrounds, ethnicities, gender and sexual orientation. Individuals are placed in one of our branches located throughout the United States. The placement in Branch Administration includes rotations throughout Operations / Service, Risk / Compliance and Business Development. Analysts are then placed in a separate rotation, working alongside Financial Advisor teams. Branch Analysts will participate in a week-long orientation in our Westchester and New York offices where they will learn about the organization, products and strategic initiatives. They will also hear from senior leaders within the Firm as well as have the opportunity to meet their program peers.DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES:Processing and analyzing financial data for client portfoliosCreating asset allocation reviews and financial plansDeveloping proposals and presentations for prospects and clientsAnalyzing the Financial Advisors’ books of business and identifying new business opportunitiesIdentifying opportunities to promote the development of client relationshipsAnalysts will obtain training for and are required to pass the Series 7 and Series 66 licensing examsEDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE, and SKILLS:Education and/or ExperienceBachelor’s Degree in Administration, Management, or Finance preferredMinimum GPA of 3.2A strong desire and commitment to understand the global wealth management business.An ability to understand and interpret numeric data, especially as it relates to financial services.Effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills.Demonstrated leadership skills.Knowledge/SkillsStrong desire to gain further understanding of the global wealth management businessDemonstrated leadership skillsEffective written and verbal communication skillsStrong interpersonal skillsStrong team playerExceptional time management and organizational skillsStrong attention to detailExcellent judgment and ability to be discreet in all mannersOutstanding interpersonal skillsStrong work ethicREPORTS TO:Complex Business Service OfficerMorgan StanleyEOE committed to diversifying its workforce.M/F/D/V

Name: Business Analyst - Service Operations
Description: Quench USA, Inc. is a provider of filtered water systems, including bottleless water coolers, ice machines, sparkling water dispensers, and coffee brewers to approximately 40,000 institutional and commercial customers, including more than half of the Fortune 500. Headquartered in King of Prussia, PA, Quench has sales and service operations across the U.S. Quench is a subsidiary of AquaVenture Holdings (NYSE:WAAS), a multi-national provider of Water-as-a-Service solutions that provide reliable, cost-effective, and sustainable clean drinking and process water.  We are seeking a Business Analyst. The role requires strong analytical and communication skills. A successful candidate understands basic business KPIs, is able to learn service metrics, and has awareness of relational databases and SQL. A strong working knowledge of Excel (including Power Pivot, VBA, and Macros) is a must. This allows a successful Business Analyst to publish deliverables on time, and within design guidelines. Essential FunctionsQuickly and effectively create useful data deliverables as directed on a daily basisRetain data in an organized fashionDocument parameters, data tool purposes, potential opportunities for improvement and next steps as neededCompile large amounts of data in preparation for analysis.Provide reliable, clear and concise reporting as needed.Troubleshoot reporting inquiriesEstablish and monitor standards for all reports, included update by request from audience and routine auditEstablish and evaluate goals for all field service operations employeesManage and direct activities in order to meet goals and deadlinesCommunicate clearly and effectively at all levelsMaintain daily focus on organizationTake thorough and detailed notes during meetings (planned or impromptu)Maintain regular and reliable attendanceQualificationsEducation / Experience:1-3 Years of data manipulation in a professional environmentStrong business acumenRoutine reporting experienceBA in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Intelligence, or Business LogisticsWorking knowledge of data related applications (Excel a must)General:Strong organizational skills,Strong analytical skills can translate complex problems into work-able solutionsWorking knowledge of relational databases (SQL basics a plus)Visual design skillsAbility to both work independently and to work as part of a teamCommitment to meet deadlinesAbility to organize, analyze, and present dataAble to quickly grasp business terms and capture in a form that gains user acceptance and be translated into testable technical solutionSalesforce reporting a plus At Quench, there are plenty of opportunities for people who: Communicate; collaborate; share ideas, successes and failures equallyAre dependable, committed, energetic and up-beatLook to solve problems, go the extra mile, are team playersWe call this Quenchiness -- its rewarded openly and tangibly. We work hard while having fun every chance we get. Quench offers competitive salary and benefits, performance bonuses, and incentive awards. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Actuarial Associate/Business Analyst – Retirement Software Team
Description: While the preference is to have this role based in the Philadelphia or White Plains office, we will consider qualified candidates from any of our Northeast based offices.The Role The Retirement Systems Group (RSG) facilitates system development needs, product management/software governance and builds and delivers quality software, and support. This includes Valuation Systems, Client Portal and Client Facing Systems, Benefits Broking and Management, Benchmarking and other systems, most of which are used globally.  As an Actuarial Associate/Business Systems Analyst within the RSG Benefit Data Source software development team, you will be working with the business product owner as well as the product manager/lead developer to understand, manage and test requirements and software for global benefit benchmarking. As you learn, you will grow to manage some of those functions on your own for the team. In addition, can gain experience via interacting in global scope supporting and debugging actual client use-cases with Willis Towers Watson colleagues from around the globe. You will significantly grow your understanding of diverse global benefit plans, diverse valuation tools, and data structures, as they apply around the world, as well as your technical and problem solving skills. About the Product Benefits Data Source (BDS) is Willis Towers Watson's global benefit database. BDS captures detailed information on employer-sponsored benefit plan design practices in areas such as retirement, health, wellness, death and disability, meals, paid time off and flexible benefits. The BDS suite (Benefits Online, BenVal) provides employers with benefit plan benchmark globally. Both applications are data intensive which requires major data collection efforts, data refining, etc. While Benefits Online is a subscription-based global benchmark analysis tool, BenVal provides an objective approach to compare the design of benefit plans for a group of companies through actuarial valuations. The Role’s ActivitiesUnderstand, manipulate, and construct complex data structures Use the product to assist in debug support requests and for new feature modeling, work with the developers to insure full understanding (for coding and unit testing), test execution and regression testing for both enhancements and bugs Test the requirements and the software, execute testing and work closely with others on the teamRequirements review and possibly some requirements elaboration to detail in writing; for example, test cases or storyboardsRelate the requirements to developers and improve, revise them in review and in-step with changecalculation engine. Use Swift and grow to become an expert with the productSupport product quality and development process conventions  •3 years of experience as an Analyst, working with various software and documenting related processes and results in an organized fashionExperience with Retirement Pension Plans and/or other benefits plans needed for this role. Actuarial background a plus, ASA/EA credentials a considerable plusQuality focus related to software usage, inputs and outputStrong oral and written communication skills; team player Self-sufficient creative problem solver capable of indirect solutionsA passion to improve the product as well as the data analysisDesire to learn, accept new challenges and have funKnowledge of projections of pension plan accounting/funding results a significant plusGood with Microsoft Excel and have an understanding of SQL.Bachelor’s Degree required The Company Willis Towers Watson is a leading global advisory, broking and solutions company that helps clients around the world turn risk into a path for growth. With roots dating to 1828, Willis Towers Watson has 40,000 employees serving more than 140 countries. We design and deliver solutions that manage risk, optimize benefits, cultivate talent, and expand the power of capital to protect and strengthen institutions and individuals. Our unique perspective allows us to see the critical intersections between talent, assets and ideas – the dynamic formula that drives business performance. Together, we unlock potential. Learn more at willistowerswatson.com. Equal Employment Opportunity All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability.  Equal Employment Opportunity: https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf Unsolicited Contact: Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our web site or to personal e-mail accounts of employees of Willis Towers Watson are considered property of Willis Towers Watson and are not subject to payment of agency fees. In order to be an authorized Recruitment Agency/Search Firm for Willis Towers Watson, any such agency must have an existing formal written agreement signed by an authorized Willis Towers Watson recruiter and an active working relationship with the organization. Resumes must be submitted according to our candidate submission process, which includes being actively engaged on the particular search. Likewise, for our authorized Recruitment Agencies/Search Firms, if the candidate submission process is not followed, no agency fees will be paid by Willis Towers Watson. Willis Towers Watson is an equal opportunity employer.

Name: Manager, Business Analyst
Description: This Business Analyst will work in partnership with Business Partners supporting the Global Product Development organization to deliver key Business Technology solutions. The Business Analyst is responsible for understanding, elaborating, and communicating requirements to ensure technology solutions and strategy initiatives meet the needs of its intended audience.This role will independently:Establish relationships with customers and members of the project team and liaises between the business and technical members of the project team, ensuring that the project team understands the customer needsUtilize specific techniques to elicit requirements from stakeholders, analyzes, organizes, documents, and validates the resulting requirements, and communicates and secures agreement on the requirements across stakeholdersBuild, validate and update diagrams, models and other artifacts to describe business processes, conceptual information models , organizational structure, business area context and/or system requirementsEstablish the requirements baseline and traces requirements throughout the project lifecycleManage change in requirements over the project lifecycleProvide input on design to ensure that the design meets the requirementsSupport the development of the testing plan and scripts, supports the execution of UAT testing and ensures that all requirements are met in the final solutionPlan and communicate the requirements management approach and change management plan to be used for the project. Provide input to the project work breakdown structure and the overall project planIdentify areas of risk due to requirements and surface to the project managerPartner with the project manager to assess the impact of changes in requirements on the project scope and timelinesFor larger projects and programs, define BA staffing profile for vendor contracted BA resourcesFor smaller projects, oversee vendor contracted resources and/or provide coaching to more junior BAsIn partnership with Senior Business Partner, this role will:Contribute to pre-project business case developmentContribute to strategic planningAct as an advocate for customers while simultaneously identifying areas like business process that need to be changed within the business to ensure project success.QualificationsEducation:Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in a scientific discipline or computer sciencePrior Experience:6+ years’ experience in project level business analysis using standard requirements business analysis techniques including brainstorming, interviewing, requirements sessions, activity diagrams, process modeling, conceptual data modeling, use case and wireframes Name: IT Service Desk Analyst
Description: Be Human. Be Accountable. Be Better.Our Approach Lloyd is a fast-growing, fun to work for, technology services firm founded to create opportunities to earn, learn and live better. Our commitment to our clients is to humanize their technology experience, freeing them to build their businesses by taking the headaches out of technology. If you love interacting with people, thrive on learning new things, and are up for the challenge, we offer the opportunity of a lifetime, with salary and benefits too! Who We Need The essence of the Lloyd brand is the extraordinary individual, the Lloydian. Today we are seeking a Level 2 Help Desk Analyst with financial services experience. You'll be part of a team that provides best-in-class support for over 6,800 people across over 150 successful organizations. Our service delivery values garnered us a spot in the top 100 managed services providers, globally and made us a 6 time Inc. 500 | 5000 honoree. People dont join Lloyd to play it safe. They join Lloyd to be challenged and embark on a career that offers unbelievable opportunity. ResponsibilitiesUse expertise to research and resolve level 1 and 2 technical issues via incident management procedures (ITIL based) with proper communication and documentationCommunicate features and facilitate improvements to maximize productivityPerform proactive network health evaluationsEnsure Lloyd has updated network documentation needed to provide best-in-class supportParticipate in rotating on-call schedules so that our clients can depend on us 24/7 to meet their business needsComplete hardware rebuilds as deemed necessary by troubleshooting proceduresHelp with implementation of new network components as part of project assignments (network and workstation)Communicate with the team and client, ensuring accountability is clear and expectations are always setCriteria for SuccessBachelors degree, preferably in Computer Science, CIS, MIS, or IT2-4 years of experience in desk side support, junior systems administration, and/or junior network administrationExperience using ConnectWise or a similar ticketing systemAll-star verbal and written communication skillsA desire to be a Lloydian & develop lasting relationships in our communityClient focus with an ability to maintain relationships and resolve client conflictsDetail oriented; follow established policies and proceduresTechnical ExpertiseMicrosoft Windows Server 2003, 2008, 2012VMware and Hyper V in multiple host environmentsBloomberg Terminal, REdi Plus, GoldmanMicrosoft Active DirectoryBlackberry Enterprise ServerExperience with Compellent (Dell) SAN or equivalentKaseya and ConnectWise experience a plusWindows XP, Vista, 7, 8Microsoft Exchange 2003, 2007, 2010Microsoft SQL 2005, 2008Microsoft Office 2003,2007, 2010Hardware: Printers, Workstations, Servers, Routers, Switches, and FirewallsStrong understanding of networking and routingSoftware: Antivirus and Antimalware SoftwareTCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, WAN, LAN, VoIP, WLANMac experience preferredChanging the Game Lloyd gives small and mid-sized businesses something theyve never had before: personalized enterprise level IT strategy and support. Unlike typical IT outsourcing firms who provide cookie-cutter, anonymous tech support for any business at a monthly fee, Lloyd Group delivers fully customized lifecycle IT strategy and support with professionals who become de facto members of your organization. And we dont stop at just managing your technology we show you how to compete more effectively in your particular marketplace. We create harmony between your technology and your business. Nobody serves outsourced IT and consulting services to small and mid-sized companies better than we do.

Our employees are passionate about what they do and make it happen. Can define Non-Functional requirements important for Cloud technologies, component requirements for services, or data requirements for interfaces, reporting and data analytics.Engages business customers and technical systems analysts as active and co-creating participants in the Requirements Process; leads through relevant iterations, sprints, and/or phase(s) throughout initiatives Experience with Agile methodologies and fast pace environment requiredA sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on the company’s successCritical thinker and problem-solving skillsTeam playerGood time-management skillsGreat interpersonal and communication skills5 years experience Information Technology or Relevant Business Domain3 years experience, Business and/or Systems Analysis, using modern techniques and visual modelsKnowledge in application development and IT processes such as SDLC, ITIL, CMMi, Agile and iterativeBachelors Degree or equivalent experience, with background in Analysis, Business or IT Knowledgeable of, and experience with, tools such as HP Application Lifecycle Management, Blueprint, Modern Requirements, or other Requirements Engineering/Management tool Ability to translate technical concepts into business terms, considers applicability of next generation technologiesAbility to partner and influence internal business partners; takes ownership and accountability for work.Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills; ability to organize concepts and requirementsClear, professional communications (listening, oral and written communications) and presentation skillsStrong relationship building and collaboration skills, resilient and driven to succeedDemonstrated track record as a team player and collaborator

Name: Actuarial Associate/Business Analyst Retirement Software Team
Description: While the preference is to have this role based in the Philadelphia or White Plains office, we will consider qualified candidates from any of our Northeast based offices.  The Role  The Retirement Systems Group (RSG) facilitates system development needs, product management/software governance and builds and delivers quality software, and support. This includes Valuation Systems, Client Portal and Client Facing Systems, Benefits Broking and Management, Benchmarking and other systems, most of which are used globally.  As an Actuarial Associate/Business Systems Analyst within the RSG Benefit Data Source software development team, you will be working with the business product owner as well as the product manager/lead developer to understand, manage and test requirements and software for global benefit benchmarking. As you learn, you will grow to manage some of those functions on your own for the team. In addition, can gain experience via interacting in global scope supporting and debugging actual client use-cases with Willis Towers Watson colleagues from around the globe. You will significantly grow your understanding of diverse global benefit plans, diverse valuation tools, and data structures, as they apply around the world, as well as your technical and problem solving skills.  About the Product  Benefits Data Source (BDS) is Willis Towers Watson's global benefit database. BDS captures detailed information on employer-sponsored benefit plan design practices in areas such as retirement, health, wellness, death and disability, meals, paid time off and flexible benefits. The BDS suite (Benefits Online, BenVal) provides employers with benefit plan benchmark globally. Both applications are data intensive which requires major data collection efforts, data refining, etc. While Benefits Online is a subscription-based global benchmark analysis tool, BenVal provides an objective approach to compare the design of benefit plans for a group of companies through actuarial valuations.  The Role's Activities Understand, manipulate, and construct complex data structures Use the product to assist in debug support requests and for new feature modeling, work with the developers to insure full understanding (for coding and unit testing), test execution and regression testing for both enhancements and bugs Test the requirements and the software, execute testing and work closely with others on the teamRequirements review and possibly some requirements elaboration to detail in writing; for example, test cases or storyboardsRelate the requirements to developers and improve, revise them in review and in-step with changecalculation engine. Use Swift and grow to become an expert with the productSupport product quality and development process conventions3+ years of experience as an Analyst, working with various software and documenting related processes and results in an organized fashionExperience with Retirement Pension Plans and/or other benefits plans needed for this role. Actuarial background a plus, ASA/EA credentials a considerable plusQuality focus related to software usage, inputs and outputStrong oral and written communication skills; team player Self-sufficient creative problem solver capable of indirect solutionsA passion to improve the product as well as the data analysisDesire to learn, accept new challenges and have funKnowledge of projections of pension plan accounting/funding results a significant plusGood with Microsoft Excel and have an understanding of SQL.Bachelor's Degree required The Company  Willis Towers Watson is a leading global advisory, broking and solutions company that helps clients around the world turn risk into a path for growth. With roots dating to 1828, Willis Towers Watson has 40,000 employees serving more than 140 countries. We design and deliver solutions that manage risk, optimize benefits, cultivate talent, and expand the power of capital to protect and strengthen institutions and individuals. Our unique perspective allows us to see the critical intersections between talent, assets and ideas the dynamic formula that drives business performance. Together, we unlock potential. Learn more at willistowerswatson.com.  Equal Employment Opportunity  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability.  Equal Employment Opportunity: https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf  Unsolicited Contact: Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our web site or to personal e-mail accounts of employees of Willis Towers Watson are considered property of Willis Towers Watson and are not subject to payment of agency fees. In order to be an authorized Recruitment Agency/Search Firm for Willis Towers Watson, any such agency must have an existing formal written agreement signed by an authorized Willis Towers Watson recruiter and an active working relationship with the organization. Resumes must be submitted according to our candidate submission process, which includes being actively engaged on the particular search. Likewise, for our authorized Recruitment Agencies/Search Firms, if the candidate submission process is not followed, no agency fees will be paid by Willis Towers Watson. Willis Towers Watson is an equal opportunity employer.

Name: Senior Solutions Analyst
Description: ZS is a global leader in sales and marketing consulting, outsourcing, technology and software. Together, we design and implement strategies that lead to greater market share, more competitive operations and better utilization of today's latest technologies. From our worldwide offices, ZS experts use analytics and deep expertise to help companies make smarter decisions quickly and cost effectively. We are particularly known for our strong presence in the pharmaceutical and health care sectors, yet work across a range of industries.ZS' Integrated Solutions Group supports ZS clients and local client teams on their ongoing sales and marketing business analytics and operations needs. The group typically operates from a local client location.SENIOR SOLUTIONS ANALYSTSenior Solutions Analysts work directly with our clients at their facilities to assist them with their sales, marketing and general business analytics and operations questions, as well as reporting needs. Senior Solutions Analysts leverage their quantitative skills to gather necessary client data sets, then formulate and conduct analyses with that data to provide our clients with key insights on sales and marketing business analytics and business operations support. Senior Solutions Analysts also create specific communications to convey analysis results to our clients.Responsibilities:Leverage quantitative skills to develop answers to clients' ongoing business analytics and reporting questions;Work collaboratively with clients to ascertain the client’s specific business information needs;Formulate and propose a specific plan for analyzing the data necessary to secure solutions to clients’ particular business information need(s);Discuss and recommend to clients which specific data may be best utilized in order to perform the necessary analysis;Evaluate, assess and analyze the data necessary to provide solutions to the client’s particular business information needs;Coach Solutions Analysts on analytics and reporting methodologies;Communicate the data results to the client, with an emphasis on answering the business question as opposed to the analytical and reporting processes used;Work closely and in collaboration with teams in remote locations to support client’s analytics needsGain immediate familiarity with client’s internal processes;Develop extensive expertise within several client analytics areas.Qualifications:Bachelor's degrees in Engineering, Information Technology/Systems, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Finance, Accounting or a related field with a record of academic success;4+ years of relevant post-collegiate work experience;Experience in a previous business analytics (financial, marketing, sales, pharmaceutical, industry, etc.) role strongly preferredMinimum one year of people coaching experience;Good work ethic, maturity and personal initiative;Attention to detail, with a methodical approach to workSelf-discipline for planning and organizing tasks;Accuracy in executing tasks efficiently;Strong communication skills that enable clear explanation and resolution of client's information needs;Strong client service orientation.ZS is a global consulting firm; fluency in English and the local office language is required. Candidates must possess work authorization for their intended country of employment. An on-line application, including a cover letter expressing interest and a full set of transcripts (official or unofficial), is required to be considered. ZS offers a competitive compensation package with salary and bonus incentives, plus an attractive benefits package.NO AGENCY CALLS, PLEASE.Connect with ZS on social media:Like ZS Careers on FacebookFollow ZS Careers on Twitter and InstagramFollow ZS on LinkedIn for more job opportunitiesSubscribe to the ZS YouTube ChannelZS has been recognized globally for its expertise in consulting and its flexible work environment. View ZS’s accolades.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Terrific Contract Opportunity!  Position: Business Systems Analyst  Location: Chesterbrook, Pennsylvania 19087  Term: 9 Months Contract Day-to-Day Responsibilities: Manages and streamlines the support process by providing Level 2 support, triaging support tickets, managing and analyzing issues, and recommending fixes and solutions to enhance the quality of our products and services to our customers  Manages minor releases and hot fixes for the solution at hand, acting as liaison with internal/external technical teams, vendors, consultants and customers as necessary  Assists with the phased global deployment of the solution by creating and completing readiness checklists and coordinating overall deployment activities  Collects application usage and performance metrics, analyzes and summarizes them, and publishes reports for stakeholder consumption  Documents and outlines business processes, application workflows, system components, high-level architectures and integrations points as necessary  Assists with developing and executing software application test plans and scripts  Actively participates in defining processes, best practices, tools and standards for the DX/Mobility team  Contributes to the achievement of Client organizational goals and objectives Is this a good fit? (Requirements): 5+ years of proven application support experience in a complex, highly-integrated environment  2+ years of direct or indirect experience with enterprise mobile application support  2+ years of experience with problem/incident and change management, including ticket creation, management and escalation to resolution  Experience in supporting an international, distributed solution is strongly preferred  Proven experience with working in a custom software development environment; Agile methodology preferred  Experience working with a Transportation Management System (TMS) or within a logistics environment is a plus  Hands-on experience with technical tasks such as API/integration testing, writing/running SQL queries, data extraction and advanced Excel capabilities  A 4-year degree in computer science, information systems or related field is preferred. A 2-year degree with proven experience will be considered  Passion and enthusiasm for mobility and related emerging solutions  Must operate as an integral part of a team with appropriate transparency and commitment  Ability to self-direct is essential  Very strong communication skills, both verbal and written; Able to adjust and meet communication requirements depending on the audience and situation  Natural inclination towards good customer service including proactive engagement, "can-do" attitude and diligence in engagement and follow-up  Strong organizational skills with natural attention to detail  Intellectually curious, yet practical and focused;  Ability to reconcile conflicting objectives, finding acceptable compromises within given constraints  Comfortable working in a fluid, nimble, agile-based environment  If this sounds like the perfect fit, Apply Today! Name: Application Analyst
Description: Application Analyst  + **Job ID** :76150  + **Job Category:** Information Services/Technology/Service Desk/Telecom  + **Specialty Area:** Information Services/Technology/Service Desk/Telec  + **Primary Shift:** Day  + **Work Schedule:** Full Time On Site  + **Penn Medicine Entity:** Corporate Services  + **Location:** Philadelphia, PA  + **Address:** 1500 Market Street  + **Education Required:** Per Position Description  + **Experience Required:** Per Position Description  + **Employment Type:** Full-Time Regular  Penn Medicine is dedicated to our tripartite mission of providing the highest level of care to patients, conducting innovative research, and educating future leaders in the field of medicine. Working for this leading academic medical center means collaboration with top clinical, technical and business professionals across all disciplines.  Today at Penn Medicine, someone will make a breakthrough. Someone will heal a heart, deliver hopeful news, and give comfort and reassurance. Our employees shape our future each day. Are you living your life's work? *Position Description** :*Penn Medicine is hiring an Application Analyst in the Information Services department!** Responsible for enhancing, supporting, and maintaining an application within the UPHS health system. Responsibilities include optimization of the application through development of new functionality, testing and implementing scheduled vendor releases and system upgrades, and fixing system defects. Provide technical and functional application analysis, define system requirements, and develop logical date models using best practices for build and configuration, maintenance and data integrity. Works with cross functional application teams and UPHS clients by providing education on system functionality, and configuration of new tools to increase end user productivity within the application. Ensure system changes follow change management procedures and protocols, create and maintain all documentation for all assigned applications, and develop, plan and execute testing for supported applications. Communicates all necessary application changes, enhancements, and procedures to all necessary internal department teams. *Key areas of responsibility include:** ? Develop a thorough understanding of UPHS EMR applications  ? Understands their role in the process  ? Ensures all regulatory requirements are met  ? Comply with all applicable guidelines, policies and procedures of IS and UPHS to ensure necessary controls, documentation and audit trails  ? Interprets and analyzes workflow/system requirements in order to design, configure, test and implement application solutions  ? Assists in defining system requirements, and develops logical data models using best practices for build and configuration, maintenance and data integrity.  ? Create and maintains all documentation for assigned applications in order to establish standards for configuration and enhancements within the application  ? Executes test plans that are comprehensive and inclusive of application functionality changes and/or enhancements to ensure successful outcomes  ? Participates in system upgrades and scheduled vendor releases as requested to enhance the application and meet project objectives.  ? Collaborates with management to develop departmental standards regarding change control to ensure accurate data tracking and monitors change process by maintaining current protocols and reporting any problems to appropriate personnel  ? Works independently on complex projects completing within the designated timeframe and under minimal guidance  ? Provides ongoing support and maintenance as assigned  ? Delivers customer service to IS clients seamlessly across system boundaries  ? Ensures safety, confidentiality & security of employee and Patient data  ? Assists/Trains internal team members, physicians, clinical and practice staff in the utilization of functionality within the application  ? Promptly identifies, documents, and resolves problems with system functionality  ? Consults with the key client stakeholders and cross-functional team members to gather and interpret documented build requirements for implementation projects  ? Coordinates and adheres to strict implementation project schedules, and handle multiple assignments  ? Communicates clearly problems, issues and potential solutions to team members, clients and organizational administration  ? Researches and analyze new functionality, and releases within the EMR to enhance practice productivity and operational processes  ? Performs duties in accordance with Penn Medicine and entity values, policies, and procedures  ? Other duties as assigned to support the unit, department, entity, and health system organization *Minimum Requirements** :*Minimum Degree Requirements and Experience Required:** ? Bachelor?s Degree  ? Current Internal Penn Medicine Information Services division employees may be considered with proof of active and continued enrollment in an approved bachelor degree program  ? Minimum of 2 years related experience of an equivalent combination or education and/or related experience  ? Experience in healthcare IT, preferred *Skill Requirements:** ? Knowledge of basic hardware configurations, database management tools and query language  ? Strong communication skills with all levels of staff and personnel  ? Ability to implement process improvements  ? Demonstrated project management skills  ? Ability to troubleshoot, research and solve technically challenging problems  ? Must be attentive to detail  ? Demonstrated problem solving skills *Preferred Skills:** ? Ability to work as part of a team  ? Knowledge of healthcare operations and data structures and the use of information system applications in the practicing healthcare environment  ? Thorough knowledge of all technical and clinical aspects of position functions  ? Demonstrated customer service skills *Additional Information** :*Be a part of the exciting and ground-breaking upcoming years for the Penn Medicine Information Services department!***Because growth is essential to continuing to meet the current and future needs of patients, Penn Medicine continues to expand its capabilities.***Penn Medicine's Information Services (IS) Department** focuses its efforts on the clinical and financial systems that support the day-to-day operations of four hospitals, several satellite practices, and more than 2,000 physicians. Learn more about Information Services at http://www.pennmedicine.org/information-services  We believe that the best care for our patients starts with the best care for our employees. Our employee benefits programs help our employees get healthy and stay healthy. We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits program that includes one of the finest prepaid tuition assistance programs in the region. Penn Medicine employees are actively engaged and committed to our mission. Together we will continue to make medical advances that help people live longer, healthier lives.  Penn Medicine http://www.pennmedicine.org/careers/  Live Your Life's Work  EOE/AA, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran  We are an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Candidates are considered for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, marital status, familial status, genetic information, domestic or sexual violence victim status, citizenship status, military status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.

Name: Teaching & Learning Project Data Analyst
Description: Reporting to the Executive Director of Analytics and Accreditation this position supports the coordination of Analytics and Accreditation activities with a focus on Curriculum Management and Assessment (CMA) activities. The primary position responsibility is data collection and analysis for all academic programs in the Fox School of Business in accordance with AACSB AoL accreditation guidelines and Fox School and Temple University data integrity policies. The Teaching and Learning Project Data Analyst will provide timely, in-depth analyses for all CMA activities and ensure this highly confidential information is maintained in a secure environment. The incumbent will support all Center for Innovation in Teaching and Learning initiatives and provide administrative support for Analytics and Accreditation.The incumbent will maintain communications and updates for all Analytics and Accreditation stakeholders. Performs other duties as assigned. Required Education & Experience: Bachelor's Degree and two years directly related experience that includes assessment or assurance, managing and analyzing data from large data sets, preparing reports, creating presentations based on data analyses, analyzing qualitative data, using a Learning Management System, maintaining websites and working with faculty in an academic setting. An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered. Required Skills & Abilities:Ability to work with KPI dashboards.Demonstrated interpersonal skills along with the ability to effectively interact with diverse groups of individuals.Ability to work independently and in a team environment.Demonstrate high emotional intelligence.Strong organizational and analytical skills and creative problem-solving skills.Excellent verbal, written and visual communication skills.Demonstrated ability to simultaneously manage multiple projects.Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint).Ability to operate all standard office equipment and software.Preferred:Microsoft Office Suite (Advanced)QualtricsSome desktop publishing Temple University values diversity and is committed to equal opportunity for all persons regardless of age, color, disability, ethnicity, marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status protected by law.  Compliance Statement: In the performance of their functions as detailed in the position description employees have an obligation to avoid ethical, legal, financial and other conflicts of interest to ensure that their actions and outside activities do not conflict with their primary employment responsibilities at the institution. Employees are also expected to understand and be in compliance with applicable laws, University and. employment policies and regulations, including NCAA regulations for areas and departments which their essential functions cause them to interact.  To obtain additional information about Temple University please visit our website at www.temple.edu.  Temple University's Annual Security and Fire Safety Report contains statistics, policies, and procedures related to campus safety and can be found at: http://www.temple.edu/safety/asfr/  You may request a copy of the report by calling Temple University's Campus Safety Services at 215-204-7900.SDL2017

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Senior Business Analyst – (Berwyn, PA) Our client, a leader in their field, is seeking a tech savvy and creative Senior Business Analyst to join their team in the Philadelphia Metro area. As a Senior Business Analyst, the ideal candidate will utilize their experience to provide expert analytical support in development of enterprise, client group, and journey lab metrics in support of the newly formed Customer Experience pillar. In addition, this role will include partnering with Finance in development of business cases & with analytical functions across the enterprise to evaluate tools in order to enhance our journey analytics capabilities. Please review the responsibilities and requirements listed below and apply if you are interested and qualified. If you are not interested, please send us a referral and take advantage of our $500 referral bonus program. Responsibilities of the Senior Business Analyst:Leads and executes the largest and most complex data projects and data consulting engagements. Provides recommended course of action that guide clients toward the execution of effective plan events administration. Delegates tasks and provides guidance and support to peers based on tactical and strategic recommendationsEnsures the most effective techniques and tools are utilized to ensure quality execution of ongoing feeds and batch managementLeads and executes the delivery of the most complex ad hoc reports, as well as the development of repeatable reporting solutions as requested by internal and external clients. Provides guidance and leadership to peers to ensure the most effective techniques and tools are utilized in report and recommendation developmentTakes a leadership role with other data resources. Engages in regular knowledge transfer in order to establish procedures that leverage effective and efficient data storage and retrieval. Shares advanced analytical tools and techniques across the team and broader departmentRepresents the business in client meetings and develops strategy for conversions and special projects; anticipates and assesses client data needs and objectives through planning and consultation. Aligns client requirements with organizations existing functionalities and suggests enhancements as necessaryPartners with internal and external clients. Acts as a technical expert and competitively influences decisions and outcomes concerning data. Provides strategic direction for data resources and integrated teamsContributes to the identification of data needs across platforms and collaborates with data leadership team and IT to ensure technology enhancements meet expected results and standardsSupports cross functional strategic priorities as requested by internal clientsDevelops and implements data and reporting training Collaborates closely with data leadership and provides insight on resourcing, budgetary, and technology needs. Fosters a team-oriented environment; provides coaching and feedback as necessary.Attention to detail and sensitivity to deadlines; effectively manages time.About Profiles: An award-winning Marketing and Creative Technology staffing agency, Profiles places the highest caliber candidates in Fortune 500 companies and successful organizations across the country. Name: Analyst Intern
Description: Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.Program Overview:As a part of the Comcast Technology Internship Program, you will have an opportunity to work on innovative, thought-provoking projects alongside a team of supportive, full-time employees. The 11-week, summer program will also provide you with a chance to gain new technical and professional development skills, participate in a wide range of mentorship and networking opportunities and have a lot of fun along the way!Your experience will include:- Engagement: Opportunities to cultivating meaningful relationships, working side by side with innovative and talent Comcast employees on impactful projects.- Exposure: An inside look into the day-to-day operations of an organization at the cutting edge of media and technology.- Professional Development: Exposure to a variety of professional development sessions and networking opportunities, giving you an opportunity to develop strong interpersonal and business skills that will set you apart from your peers.- Mentorship: Mentoring from fellow colleagues through the Empowering Future Leaders Program (EFLP) to help you navigate your experience, provide coaching, and expand your professional network.- Fun: Continuously develop relationships with fellow interns through social activities, community building, and networking.Department and Role Overview:This team provides end-to-end production support for Enterprise Applications. Our customer-facing employees depend for their daily work activities on these critical applications to provide the best possible experience to our customers.The intern will be working closely with the development team, developing technical knowledge of applications and creatingtrouble shooting guidelines for these applicationsEmployees at all levels are expected to:- Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job- Own the customer experience-think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services- Know your stuff-be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences- Win as a team-make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas- Be an active part of the Net Promoter System-a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company-by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers- Drive results and growth- Respect and promote inclusion and diversity- Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communitiesCore Responsibilities: - Perform effective Incident Management from incident start through resolution, partnering with Engineering and Deployment to determine root causes, and driving rigorous Problem Management to follow through on actions- Foster and encourage a culture of clear and precise communication, continuous improvement, and employee engagement- Focus on best-in-class reliability engineering and operations methodologies- Development of toolsJob Requirements:- Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree from a United States based college or university- Graduation date between Dec 2019 and June 2021, preference on rising seniors- Major: Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or a related field- 3.0 GPA or higher- Able to define and document business processes- Highly collaborative with a strong work ethic- Able to embrace challenges and displays a strong creative flexibility- Demonstrates solid decision-making skills- Proven analytical, organizational and problem-solving ability- Exceptional written and oral communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex emergent situations clearly and plainly- Ability to work independently and in group settings- Strong interest in the technology, telecommunications and media industries- Current and future authorization to work in the United States of America  Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

Name: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Designs and/or develops program logic for new applications or analyzes and modifies logic in existing applications. Codes, tests, debugs, documents, implements and maintains software applications. Analyzes requirements, and maintains, tests and integrates application components. Ensures that system improvements are successfully implemented.  CSL Behring is looking for a Senior Application Developer with a focus on Big Data / Hadoop, responsible for the full systems lifecycle maintenance / implementation of Big Data applications under the guidance of BT Management as it relates to BT Functional area.  While supporting the implementation, adoption, and use of Big Data systems, this role has a primary focus on application development as it relates to Big Data / Hadoop. Responsible for maintaining a competent understanding of business process, knowledge and acumen.  Main Responsibilities and Accountabilities Responsible for the development / operational execution / maintenance of applications with a focus on Big Data / Hadoop. Ensures effective problem analysis for issues of diverse scope and resolution in a timely fashion. Escalates issues when needed to appropriate levels of BT / Business.Effectively leads in soliciting and gathering requirements (user requirements, business process requirements, and performance requirements) from business users and/or data scientists using appropriate mechanisms and following CSL standards. Able to translate these requirements into coding and configuration solutions.Effectively follow global BT procedures and policies are followed consistently as defined by our Quality Management System (QMS). Follow the appropriate global regulatory guidelines and current Good Manufacturing Practice (cGMP).Leads in translating business requirements of moderate to diverse scope and designs effective Big Data / Hadoop solutions. Configure and unit test solutions using good judgment with CSL standards and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).Collaboratively works with internal employees, vendors, consultants to effectively implement Big Data / Hadoop solutions. Develops mutually productive relationships in the workplace and contributes to the team. Cooperates and acts as a team player and gains trust of peers.Performs matrix roles as assigned for local and global projects.Collaborates with key business users and/or data scientists to proactively communicate the status of ongoing and daily support and problem resolution. Builds productive relationships with peers and business partners. Networks effectively in areas of proficiency.Conducts research and analysis on new and innovative solutions, releases, enhancements and consider their applicability to CSL. Presents results / recommendations to BT / Business management.Initiates and leads in identifying and implementing means to improve the qualities and efficiencies of BT processes, systems, and results. Resolves a wide range of issues in creative ways.Provides off-hours support as it relates to BT functional area. Qualification and Experience Requirements 5+ years of experience in analytics with a focus on Big Data and Java Application development.Excellent skills in HortonWorks Hadoop Platform technologies such as HDFS, Hive, MapReduce, Pig Latin and Spark.Expert level knowledge in the HortonWorks Hadoop Platform Administration as well as Security with a focus on Ambari, Ranger and Active Directory/LDAP Security.Outstanding expertise in HortonWorks Hadoop Data Flow data integration methodologies utilizing Nifi.Strong skills in SQL, NoSQL and Key-Value-Databases(JSON).Provide design and development expertise for large-scale, clustered data processing Big Data systems while loading from disparate data sets.Experience in supporting RStudio and Jupytr would be a plusProgramming/scripting skills in Java or a relevant language preferred.Some knowledge of the Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) preferred.Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience; educational concentration in a computer- or mathematical based discipline (e.g. Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science) or a technical discipline (e.g. Engineering, Mathematics) is preferred.Pharma/Biotech or similarly regulated environment experience preferred.Ability to understand complex business process dependencies and to translate them into analytical solutions.Excellent communication skills; this is a significant customer facing role.Worker Type: Employee Worker Sub Type: Regular

Name: Business Analyst Level-1
Description: Job Summary:Looking for high powered and quantitatively oriented IT Business Analyst to support the Projects in IT Domain. Analyst will be required to analyze specific business problems and drive value in strategic areas of business. What you will get to do:Typically the customers would be Senior Managers / Directors from different Domains located in US, Latin America, and Asia Pacific.The analyst would typically handle a high impact project at any time which should result in bottom line impact.Most of the work would be around business understanding, data understanding, guiding junior analysts in data preparation, working with the statistical team to create models if required and result presentation. Must have completed Masters Degree in Computer Science.Experience in preparing basic flow diagrams, swim-lane diagrams.

Name: Business Development Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionBusiness Development Analyst  Sun IP's mission is simple: to create a world where industry-leading IP translation and foreign filing services help clients protect their innovation around the globe. Backed by Metro Global Ventures, Sun IP is growing quickly with teams located in Philadelphia, New York, New Jersey, and Toronto.  Sun IP is seeking entry-level candidates and recent graduates for the Business Development Analyst position at our Philadelphia/Bala Cynwyd office. Name: Business Analyst, Clinical Software
Description: Almac is an exceptional, award winning, drug development solutions provider at the forefront of the pharmaceutical industry. We are a privately owned organization that has organically grown over 50 years now employing almost 5,000 highly skilled personnel worldwide. Our Global headquarters is located in Craigavon, Northern Ireland with additional operations throughout Europe (UK, Ireland), across the US (Pennsylvania, North Carolina and California) andin Asia (Singapore and Japan).Our drive and passion for the values championed by our Founder, and enshrined in the ethos of Almac, ensures that Partnering to Advance Human Health is more than just a tagline it is our way of life.We are currently looking for a Design Manager for our Lansdale, PA location. The Design Manager's primary function includes the gathering and documentation of user requirements and facilitating with the internal Almac team to ensure successful and on time delivery of quality Almac software systems.Responsibilities include but is not limited to:Requirements gathering: Collect, analyze, organize, and write system requirements for both initial and subsequent builds. Ensure proper and clear understanding of requirements by client and internal team members. Lead requirements review meetings. Elicit requirements through use of interviews, document analysis review (protocol / supporting documents), requirement meetings with client teams (teleconference and in person as needed), business analysis, and client need.Identify key stakeholders and define their responsibilities related to requirements definition, assessment, and approval. Communicate with the client and other stakeholders to understand their project objectives.Critically evaluate requirements gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, act as consultant by providing best practices and lessoned learned, and separate user wants from the true needs.Write clear, concise, and detailed system requirements to meet the clients needs while supporting Almac goals.Systems Build: Ensure the internal team has a full understanding of the project requirements. Ensures the internal team delivers a quality system that meets the requirements documentation. This will be done by the Business Analyst by leading requirements review meetings, attending functional and test case reviews, and participating in regular status meetings.Systems Implementation: Perform and support client user acceptance testing. Participate in any other required implementation activities on a project specific basis.Project Scope Assessment: Understand initial project scope and initiate conversations about scope during requirements gathering with Project Manager and client. Provides estimates for level of effort for requested changes to scope during initial and subsequent builds.Risk Management: Actively participates in identifying, mitigating and managing risk and raises concerns to client and internal team as appropriate.Qualifications:Education:Associates degree and two (2) years of industry related experience or Bachelors Degree requiredBachelors degree preferredRequired:1-3 years supporting or writing technical requirements1-3 years of experience communicating directly with clientsExperience managing multiple projects or tasks simultaneouslyExperience understanding and writing client requirementsProficient knowledge of Microsoft Office products, especially Word, Excel and PowerPointPreferred:Supporting or writing technical requirements an Interactive Response Technology productUse of Requirements Management Tools and Processes, e.g. Microsoft Team Foundation Server (TFS), SharePoint, Wireframing Tools, etc.Experience within the clinical technology, life sciences or software industries settingUnderstanding of use of IXRS in Clinical TrialsExperience gathering and writing technical requirementsKnowledge of the clinical trial processKnowledge of system development life cycle (SDLC)Advancing human health requires exceptional people - your talent, experience and passion will be the perfect match. Together we will make an exceptional difference to the health of countless patients all over the world and this is just the beginning.Lets be exceptional togetherAlmac Group, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled - Proudly embracing diversity in all of its expressions.EEO is the LawEEO is the Law GINA SupplementAlmac provides reasonable accommodations to people with disabilities who need assistance completing the application process. Please email us at ADARequest@almacgroup.com to request assistance.
