Name: Analyst 2, Customer Svc Strategy
Description: Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.Employees at all levels are expected to: *Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job *Own the customer experience-think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services *Know your stuff-be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences *Win as a team-make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas *Be an active part of the Net Promoter System-a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company-by joining huddles, making callbacks and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers *Drive results and growth *Respect and promote inclusion and diversity *Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communitiesWe are looking to hire an Analyst to be the next valued member of our customer service strategy team! The ideal candidate is naturally curious, hard-working and can easily translate data into actionable insights. The Analyst will measure performance, analyze agent/customer behaviors and trends, build dashboards and transform raw data into concise intelligence that will help drive business decisions. The Analyst will work cross-functionally with other teams including Customer Service, Business Intelligence, Operations and Marketing. The ideal candidate is passionate about data-driven decision making and able to do analysis on large unstructured data sets and quickly grasp new technologies. Combination of education and experience will be considered.Core Responsibilities: *Designs and implements reporting solutions enabling stakeholders to make effective decisions. *Conducts ad hoc data analysis and data quality investigations *Implements training and documentation solutions that enable business stakeholders to get the most out of our self-serve reporting tools *Reporting on sales incentive performance *Analyze granular data for segment and trend analysis *Evaluate the effectiveness of software/product releases and conduct readouts on results *Monitor current KPIs *Analyzing and mining data to identify patterns and correlations among various data points *Mapping and tracing data from system to system in order to solve a given business or system problem *Partner with Sr. Analyst and Channel Leads to effectively present findings in weekly, monthly and ad-hoc executive summaries *Identifies issues, analyzes available data and information, and recommends changes to management. *Creates and maintains multiple operational reporting tools. *Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary. *Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.Job Specification: *Bachelors of Science in any related fields *Minimum of 2 years of experience in analytics *Understanding of programming logic, although no experience with a specific programming language is required. *Adaptable, proactive and willing to take ownership *Good communication skills, ability to analyze and clearly articulate complex issues and technologies *Strong attention to detail *Must be able to function independently *Tableau (or any similar tool) Proficiency *Strong MS Office (Word, Excel, PPT, Outlook) is required *Wave Analytics or SQL experience is a plusComcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

Name: Analyst, Trading Strategies, Market Risk
Description: Alternate Locations: Philadelphia, PA (Pennsylvania)  Relocation assistance is not available for this opportunity.  Requisition #55807 About the Company Lincoln Financial Group provides advice and solutions that help empower Americans to take charge of their financial lives with confidence and optimism. Today, more than 17 million customers trust our retirement, insurance and wealth protection expertise to help address their lifestyle, savings and income goals, as well as to guard against long-term care expenses. Headquartered in Radnor, Pennsylvania, Lincoln Financial Group is the marketing name for Lincoln National Corporation (NYSE:LNC) and its affiliates. The company had $222 billion in assets under management as of March 31, 2015.  Click here to Register to Chat with an LFG Recruiter!  The Role  The Analyst, Risk Management is responsible for mitigating market risks for Lincoln Financial by devising risk management solutions for variable annuities and other insurance products. This position develops trading solutions to minimize P/L volatility and manage statutory & rating agency capital requirements.  Responsibilities  Technical Knowledge Onboard new funds on the variable annuity platform by developing automated tools for data preparation and seamless running of back-testing algorithms to quantify hedge effectiveness.Analyzes daily / weekly P/L and creates tools for generating performance attribution.Improve standard derivatives hedging strategy and implements efficient solutions(under guidance) to mitigate risks embedded in Lincoln’s variable annuity guarantees. These risks include, but not restricted to, equity risk, interest rate risk, volatility risk, tracking error risk, dividend risk.Research and implement libraries for valuing and back-testing vanilla and exotic derivatives[Baskets/Asians/Hybrids].Ensure consistent modeling/ calibration of assets in trading system and liability hedge models.Works with hedging operations team to measure and understand P/L attribution. Organizational Effectiveness Provides support on the implementation of process improvements that improve quality across the team, department and/or business unit for his/her assigned area(s) of responsibility.Change ManagementIdentifies and directs the implementation of process improvements that significantly reduce workloads or improve quality across the department for his/her assigned area(s) of responsibility Collaboration Collaborate with colleagues in the risk management department [Modeling & Analytics and Risk System team] and build good relationships. Requirements  Education Undergraduate degree or 4+ years of comparable work experience; educational concentration in Actuarial Science, Statistics, Mathematics or Hard Science/engineering is required.Masters level or Advanced degree preferred. Experience At least 1-3 yrs years of experience in quantitative capital markets modeling role including derivatives valuation, risk management and data analysis.Strong knowledge of capital markets instruments and hedging strategies.Expert level knowledge of Matlab, VBA.Advanced knowledge of R, MySQL, C++, Python.Sound understanding of econometrics based modeling and research.Apply concepts such as probability, statistics, modeling, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical solutions.Knowledge of linear algebra and optimization techniques.Sound knowledge of derivatives; and credit, interest rate, foreign exchange and credit risks, and hedging strategies.Ability to read, analyze and interpret both internal and external documents such as general media/publications, professional journals, technical procedures, governmental regulations, policies, proposals, and standard operating proceduresProficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).This position may be subject to Lincoln’s Political Contribution Policy. An offer of employment may be contingent upon disclosing to Lincoln the details of certain political contributions. Lincoln may decline to extend an offer or terminate employment for this role if it determines political contributions made could have an adverse impact on Lincoln’s current or future business interests, misrepresentations were made, or for failure to fully disclose applicable political contributions and or fundraising activities. This position may be subject to Lincoln’s Political Contribution Policy. An offer of employment may be contingent upon disclosing to Lincoln the details of certain political contributions. Lincoln may decline to extend an offer or terminate employment for this role if it determines political contributions made could have an adverse impact on Lincoln’s current or future business interests, misrepresentations were made, or for failure to fully disclose applicable political contributions and or fundraising activities.

Name: Business Analyst- Product Owner
Description: Job DescriptionOnly W2 rates available  Email kayo@css-tec.com  Long Term Contract  Our client in Malvern, PA is looking to add a Business Analyst to work with Product Owners and Project Managers.  The Business Analyst (BA) acts as an intermediary between the business community and the technical community, working with IT project teams and business stakeholders to collect, clarify, and document business requirements (using appropriate tools and models) from which applications and solutions are developed. Essential Responsibilities:Work with product owners and project managers to support assigned projects, as well as daily hot-fixes, system maintenance, and change management requests. Convert Service Desk tickets to User Stories and assist in managing the software development backlog.Elicit needs from stakeholders. Develop a clear set of requirements that are complete and understood by development resources and business stakeholders. Document the solution scope in User Stories that include objectives, business value and detailed acceptance criteria.Consult with subject matter experts and technical resources to understand feasibility of requests and solutions, add technical detail to stories, and communicate level-of-effort.Create business process diagrams and prototype mockups to communicate and gain consensus on proposed future state, workflows and user experience.Collaborate with stakeholders to consider both technical and non-technical solutions. Recommend and negotiate solutions that are in alignment with enterprise constraints such as time, budget, level-of-effort, resource availability, and project priorities.Develop expertise and understanding of the client's systems and capabilities to effectively communicate business requirements to any audience within the enterprise.Act as a day-to-day partner with the development teams. Unblock developers by obtaining clarification and approval from stakeholders. Ensure the team understands and delivers the requested business value.Develop user documentation and conduct demos, walkthroughs and training as needed.Proactively communicate with stakeholders and business units, both verbally and in formal written communications, to maintain transparency and keep stakeholders informed.Perform other duties as assigned. Required Competencies  Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication, as well as listening, presentation and interpersonal skills. Team-oriented: Ability to collaborate with stakeholders to manage backlogs and achieve business goals.Time Management and Prioritization: Ability to work multiple simultaneous projects, and change priorities as directed.Ability to quickly learn new business domains, processes and terminology.Strive to reflect our five cultural values in all efforts: Put the Customer First, Do What You Say, Work Together, Be Innovative and Do the Right Thing.Education, Experience, and Technical Skills Required:Minimum two years in a Business Analyst role.Four-year college diploma or university degree.Agile/Scrum Experience a plus.Project leadership and/or Scrum Master experience a plus.Organizational Relationships: This position will report to the Senior Business Analyst.

Name: Financial Analyst I - JUP Administration
Description: PRIMARY FUNCTION:  This position provides administrative and analytical support to the Decision Support program of Sidney Kimmel Medical College (SKMC), Jefferson Community Physicians (JCP) and Jefferson University Physicians (JUP) and Thomas Jefferson + Philadelphia University (TJU) as well as the faculty contracting and recruiting processes of SKMC, JCP, JUP and TJU. Specific emphasis of the position will be administering the Salaried Faculty Recruitment Authorization Request process, proper tracking of this process and the development and issuance of routine and ad-hoc analytical reports to JUP Leadership. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Updates and maintains the faculty databaseDevelops and maintains tracking logs used in the faculty contracting and recruiting processesThoroughly reviews faculty recruiting pro-forma (SFRAR) before routing to stakeholders for approval. This includes vetting compensation and effort using benchmarks and internal policies/practices.Produces monthly, quarterly and yearly reports for SKMC and JUP leadership including faculty effort, compensation and recruiting metrics.Collects and organizes JUP/SKMC compensation and productivity data, for submission to third party benchmark organizationsWorks with JUP leadership to assess current reporting efficiencies and lend insight on areas for improvement (Compensation plan, contracts, recruitment process)Modifies standard faculty contract language as policies change.Reviews all faculty contracts and language prior to issuance to departments.Demonstrate strong problem solving skills on a daily basis, including a proactive approach to solving issues as quickly as possible.Interacts with co-workers, visitors, and other staff consistent with the core values of Jefferson.OTHER FUNCTIONS AND COMPETENCIES:Enter data from institutional contracts into tracking log, route for approval and maintain repositoryRoute contract and recruitment paperwork to all involved Jefferson officesWork with university counsel and JUP leadership to create contract language for high level/unique faculty contracts.Develop analysis plans, perform data analyses and prepare findings for internal reports and presentation as appropriateEDUCATIONAL/TRAINING REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s Degree required. EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS: Three years or more experience preferred.  Must be technically proficient in most business software applications (excel, word, powerpoint, etc). Jefferson Health delivers state of the art healthcare services to patients throughout the Delaware Valley and southern New Jersey. Jefferson (Philadelphia University + Thomas Jefferson University) provides more than 7,800 students from nearly 40 states and 40 countries with 21st century professional education. Combined, we have 30,000 employees. Jefferson Health, with 14 hospitals (seven are Magnet designated by the ANCC for nursing excellence) and 40+ outpatient and urgent care locations, offers a broad range of primary and complex, highly specialized care that touches the lives of more than four million patients annually. U.S. News & World Report has ranked Thomas Jefferson University Hospital among the nation’s best in 10 specialties. Jefferson Health also includes the NCI designated Sidney Kimmel Cancer Center; it is one of only 70 such centers in the nation. Jefferson (Philadelphia University + Thomas Jefferson University) has ten colleges and three schools that offer more than 160 undergraduate and graduate programs. Our University is dedicated to inter-professional and transdisciplinary approaches to learning that offer a vibrant and expandable platform for professional education. Through this unique model, we are preparing our students for current and yet to be imagined careers.  As an employer, the Jefferson Enterprise maintains a commitment to provide equal access to employment. Jefferson values diversity and encourages applications from women, members of minority groups, LGBTQ individuals, disabled individuals, and veterans.

Name: Epic Senior Business Intelligence Analyst - Healthy Planet
Description: Jefferson Health is seeking a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (BIA) to support Epic’s Healthy Planet Application. This role provides the depth of expertise and knowledge within the Epic System and Healthy Planet program. The Senior BIA is responsible for developing and administering build, architecture and maintenance of the Healthy Planet Program within Epic. This would include developing my panel metrics, registries and mapping external data from payor claims to the internal framework for quality metrics and population health initiatives within the Epic software. EDUCATIONAL/TRAINING REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree in the field of business administration, computer science, and finance, engineering, or information systems required EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:Three + years related work experience, preferred.Two + years of experience in a Health Care environment, preferredADDITIONAL INFORMATION:Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification and methodology development.Experience across multiple applications and platforms including Oracle and SQLExperience developing data structures for consumption by BI applications such as Qlik, Tableau or Endeca.Experience creating dashboards for executive audiencesOperates from a perspective of truly caring about our clients and creating value for themDetail-oriented, inquisitive, problem-solving natureProject management experience preferred.Able to function in a dynamic environment subject to impromptu changes in schedules and Priorities.Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure.Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail. Highly self-motivated and directed.Jefferson Health delivers state-of-the-art healthcare services to patients throughout the Delaware Valley and southern New Jersey. Jefferson (Philadelphia University + Thomas Jefferson University) provides more than 7,800 students from nearly 40 states and 40 countries with 21 st century professional education. We have 30,000 employees. Jefferson Health , with 14 hospitals (three are Magnet-designated by the ANCC for nursing excellence) and 50+ outpatient and urgent care locations, offers a broad range of primary and complex, highly specialized care that touches the lives of more than four million patients annually . This year, U.S. News & World Report has ranked Thomas Jefferson University Hospital as the 16 th best hospital in the nation, and among the nation’s best in 11 specialties. Jefferson Health also includes the NCI-designated Sidney Kimmel Cancer Center; it is one of only 69 such centers in the nation.  Thomas Jefferson University, nationally recognized for advancing groundbreaking developments in healthcare education and research, recently combined with Philadelphia University, internationally known for architecture, design, engineering, textiles and more. Jefferson (Philadelphia University + Thomas Jefferson University) has nine colleges and three schools dedicated to interprofessional and transdisciplinary approaches to learning that offer a vibrant and expandable platform for professional education. Through this unique model, we are preparing our students for current and yet-to-be-imagined careers.  As an employer, the Jefferson Enterprise maintains a commitment to provide equal access to employment. Jefferson values diversity and encourages applications from women, members of minority groups, LGBTQ individuals, disabled individuals, and veterans. as well as controlling change  Developing functional design documents breaking down business requirements into functional requirements  Creation of technical documentation as required for process changes and application modifications  Conducting meetings and presentations to communicate key insights and findings  Developing and document acceptance criteria / test plans for both solution and UAT test plans  Responsible for executing both solution test plans and UAT test plans with stakeholders and end users  Interface with vendors to conduct discovery sessions, define and document requirements for a named set of new and existing custom developed or vendor software products  Creation of documentation including detailed requirements, user stories, acceptance criteria, internal and customer-facing procedure guides, and process flow diagrams, wireframes and UI mock ups  Stay up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems  Adhering to Project Management Lifecycle (PMLC) and/or Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) standards and governance Requirements: Bachelors degree in business or related field  BA/BS Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or Engineering  5+ years of experience working as a Business Analyst in the I.T. field  CBAP or IIBA certification desired  Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills  Experience developing and publishing technical in nature documentation  A proven record of professionalism coupled with flexibility  Preferably, experience in data warehouses such as Oracle 11g, MS SQL Server and Microsoft BI platform  Experience with enterprise DW [Data Warehouse] and BI [Business Intelligence]  Manufacturing / Supply Chain experience  Chemical management experience  Project management experience a plus  Duration: 6 months; Name: Sr. JDE Systems / Programmer Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionSummary of Objective: Design, write, program, analyze, implement and trouble shoot a wide variety of global enterprise systems, with a primary focus on the JDE (J.D. Edwards) ERP software system. Provides software development, programming, configuration, setup, business application and technical support for the company’s global enterprise systems and solutions, with a primary focus on JDE (J.D. Edwards) Enterprise One Platform. Serves in a wide variety of technical and functional roles including, but not limited to programmer, developer, systems analyst, business analyst, IT-Business liaison, JDE SME (Subject Matter Expert).  Works within the Global IT Team to insure high quality – high availability systems and solutions are maintained across the global landscape and platforms. This includes but not limited to: ERP Systems (JDE), Middleware, Software / Data Communications, Reporting, Barcoding Solutions, ASRS (Automated Storage Recovery Systems), Databases, EDI, and connected sub-systems. Performs work under the guiding principles of cGMP (Current Good Manufacturing Practices), Change Management guidelines and SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) best practices. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The essential duties and responsibilities include the following but other duties may be assigned.  1. Write / Create / Modify / Maintain / Support applications with applicable JDE development tools – JDE E1 OMW (Object Management Workbench).  2. Research / Diagnose / Fix / Repair issues and software bugs within custom applications.  3. Troubleshoot technical issues and challenges within Global Enterprise Systems.  4. Design and test new business practices in JDE and other enterprise systems.  5. Organize system implementation projects – perform project management functions as needed.  6. Facilitate process mapping exercises.  7. Lead application design and training sessions.  8. Educate end-users on change specifications and JDE workflows / processes.  9. Write / Create / Modify / Maintain / Support program interfaces and connections between systems.  10. Support and Maintain EDI systems as needed to communicate with ERP systems.  11. Support PCI’s system validation and change management process.  12. Write / Create / Modify / Maintain appropriate documentation, diagrams, and flowcharts.  13. Communicate with vendors on trouble tickets and escalations.  14. Accept & Troubleshoot assigned help desk tickets.  15. Partner with business end-users on JAD (Joint Application Development) and UAT (User Acceptance Testing) and Production post go-live support.  16. Provide technical assistance as needed and wherever possible within the IT Department.  17. Knowledge of SDLC best practices (Software Development Life Cycle)  18. Setup of appropriate testing environments and data modeling.  19. Training of end-users as needed and appropriate.  20. This position may require overtime and/or weekend work.  21. Ability to work non-standard business hours (evenings / weekends) on occasion and off-hours support.  22. Knowledge of and adherence to all PCI, cGMP, and GCP policies, procedures, rules.  23. Attendance to work is an essential function of this position  24. Performs other duties as assigned by Manager/Supervisor. Special Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. The employee must be physically capable to perform the duties listed below with or without reasonable accommodations which may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions  - Stationary Position: From 1/2 to 3/4 of the day.  - Move, Traverse: Up to 1/4 of the day.  - Operate, activate, use, prepare, inspect, or place: From 1/4 to 1/2 of the day.  - Install, place, adjust, apply, measure, use, or signal: Up to 1/4 of the day.  - Ascend/Descend or Work Atop: None.  - Position self (to) or Move (about or to): None.  - Communicate or exchange information: 3/4 of the day and up.  - Detect, distinguish, or determine: Up to 1/4 of the day. Work is primarily performed at a desk and/or in an office environment. for 3/4 of the day and up.  The noise level in the work environment is typically, moderate. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Required: - Bachelor's Degree in a related field and/or 5-10 years related experience and/or training.  - College Level Mathematical Skills  - Advanced Computer Skills: Ability to perform the most complex computer tasks and operate various computer programs.  - Full Professional Proficiency: Ability to speak, read, and write fluently and accurately on all levels pertinent to professional needs.  - Very High Reasoning: Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Name: Web Analyst-Technical Lead
Description: Company DescriptionPDDN is a provider of end-to-end software solutions and IT consulting Services and software development Company. is headquartered in Fremont, California with clients across the Silicon Valley and other Information technology Hubs in different states. With integrated solutions, software development, technical services, training and staffing support, we help customers achieve their technology goals allowing them to focus on their business.Job DescriptionRole: Web Analyst-Technical LeadLocation: Philadelphia, PAInterview : Phone/SkypeEmp Type: Permanent JobJob Description Responsible for maintaining broad/complex computer systems. Applies analysis and design techniques to complex computer systems. Position will typically support a broad functional area such as the web portals and various web applications. Works independently under overall project objectives and requirements. Primary constraints are those imposed by the need for compatibility with existing systems and programs. Responsible for recognizing probable conflicts and integrating diverse data elements and sources. Produces innovative solutions for a variety of complex problems. Should be able to handle clients on a daily basis. Typical Duties and Responsibilities · Maintains and modifies complex systems and/or designs and develops integrated subsystems. Recommends optimum approach, advises on alternatives and on the implications of new or revised data processing systems.  · Manages application software, application infrastructure and third party application environments in the assigned field. This includes installation, upgrades and patches, tuning, creating links and interfaces between systems, developing application-specific security, performance monitoring and troubleshooting. Tests, maintains, and monitors system processes using in-house and third party tools. Work must be coordinated with other analysts to ensure integration between systems.  · Performs problem analysis to resolve system or application issues. Performs complex diagnosis of problems, providing solutions within area of responsibility, and/or through consulting with ITS team members; coordinates implementation of fixes and enhancements. Provides backup for other analysts as required. Responds to critical issues during off hours when necessary.  · Designs, produces, documents, tests, implements, and maintains Web applications and utilities developed in a variety of languages including ColdFusion, Java, Perl, SQL, HTML, JavaScript and interfacing with numerous data sources such as Access, MS SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle databases.  · Provides project leadership, coordinating and integrating the work of other analysts, technical personnel and other project participants. Develops project plans, organizes and leads project teams, monitors progress, and evaluates effectiveness.  · Develops and manages internal procedures, tools, and documents to provide a high level of application integrity and availability and to ensure timely, effective support. This includes writing scope documents, managing source code, and developing technical support standards and procedures.  · Coordinates work of Programmer Analyst(s) who support PCC district-wide systems and applications. Responsibilities include assignment and review of work, mentoring and training.  · Coordinates work with systems, database, and network administrators, ITS Client Support, Training Team and Helpdesk. Supports users through technical support of the applications, developing procedures and reporting tools, facilitating and coordinating training and other technical support. Creates an environment that promotes end-user self-sufficiency.  · Plans work in response to planned changes in infrastructure and vendor application support.  · Maintains on-going relationships with vendors.  · Stays current with technological developments in software development, systems and application support, as well as management and user support practices. This includes reading publications, participating in mail lists and online communities, attending conferences and workshops, and maintaining relationships with colleagues at other colleges and universities. Minimum Qualifications · Associates degree in a computer-related discipline required. Relevant experience may substitute for the degree requirement on a year-for-year basis. Two years of Web Analyst experience to include lead responsibilities.  · Knowledge of: Web development and/or relational database management including multiple operating systems, compilers, security procedures, and disaster recovery methodologies; all phases of systems analysis techniques, concepts and methods; available system software, hardware and the regulations, structure, techniques and management practices of one or more subject matter areas.  · Ability to: Configure systems to be consistent with institutional policies/procedures and State/Federal guidelines; communicate technical and complex information both orally and in writing, and to influence others toward a stated objective; to effectively train and present materials and coordinate the work of others.  · Work Environment and Physical Requirements  · Work is performed in an office environment; regular exposure to video screen, electrical and electronic equipment. Requires the need to be continually aware of changing events, situations and technologies and to upgrade skills accordingly. Interruptions and distractions, plus the need to shift attention, occur on a regular basis. Learned physical skill is required for keyboarding and use of peripheral equipment. Minimal physical exertion required.

Name: Surveillance Analyst
Description: The NASDAQ surveillance department monitors compliance with rules and policies to assist Market Regulation in detecting potential violations of Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and exchange rules. The Department investigates matters and evaluates the need for disciplinary action. The Department’s main goal is to maintain an orderly marketplace and a level playing field for all markets participants including the general public.  Monitors real-time trading and reviews account transactions to ensure appropriateness. Reviews all aspects of orders, quotations and transactions, typically having a specific focus on potential market manipulation, transaction appropriateness, and rule compliance. Completes basic surveillance of real time trading and post trade analysis.Performs basic, preliminary surveillance of trading in specified company products, and specific order types.Completes basic interventions in trading, e.g. trade breaks and suspensions, with guidance and oversight by supervisor.Assists with monitoring markets to detect anomalies, review electronically generated alerts, and address market participant inquires.Helps keep the markets fair, orderly, and efficient through implementation of a comprehensive web of regulatory surveillance scrutiny and action.Expertise with Microsoft Excel, proficiency with Word and PowerPointExcellent oral and written communication skillsExcellent conflict management and customer service skillsEducation Required: Degree in Business/Finance or related discipline, or equivalent work experienceExperience Required: At least 1 yearNasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law.

Job Title: Technical Business Analyst (Finance Domain expert, Cable/Telecom Billing) Location: Philadelphia, PA Duration: Long Term/Fulltime Interview: F2F/Video interview (Not 100% sure) Job Description:Generate functional and technical business requirements for some of the following finance sub-domains: Payments and Cash Management, GL & Revenue Management, Financial reporting, Customer Reporting, billing operations, bill rendering, collections, Finance related Customer Care.Collaborate on requirements, architecting, designing, building, configuring, and implementing finance related solutions for all Xfinity lines of businessesParticipate in creation of simplified solutions for Payments, Cash Management, GL, Revenue Management, Tax & Regulatory, Customer Reporting, and Financial Reporting within the NextGen ecosystemFacilitate collaboration among Corporate Finance, Divisions, Product, and Marketing teams to ensure clarity of direction and proper implementation of solutions through Next Gen.Responsible for the identification and resolution of information flow, content issues and issue resolution.Participate in facilitation of team meetings, creation of status reports, and preparation of executive presentations to communicate Next Gen accomplishments, challenges, opportunities, and recommended courses of action.Demonstrates excellent project management skills, with a proven track record of successful delivery of projects on time, in line with budget expectations and to strategy.Consistently exercise independent and appropriate judgment and discretion in matters of significance.Influence and lead to implement transformation.Education:Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or other related Business discipline, Company DescriptionXavient Digital - powered by Telus International. is a global IT engineering company. Working together with such partners as Oracle and Microsoft, Xavient is able to provide comprehensive solutions to customers with a commitment to industry standards and proven technologies in development and support. Strengths include Datawarehousing Middleware, Java, Microsoft Technologies, ERP, TQA, etc. Xavient offers IT Services and innovative practices that enable business process improvement. We provide world-class software solutions to both Fortune 500 companies and smaller companies that need to better leverage their technology investments.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: The Business Systems Analyst plays a critical role in helping integrate enterprise application systems for customers and supply chain vendors. The Business Systems Analyst would be experienced in preparing detailed requirements, and flowcharts for the development and implementation of interfaces. The use of understanding key business processes will be required to able to align with IT systems and support the integration life cycle for internal business functions, external customers and supply chain partners. He or she will also act as the primary contact for issues related to their domain. A strong understanding of data mapping and attention to detail is needed to be successful along with excellent communication and writing skills. The Integration Analyst will work closely with the customer IT and business personnel, and Synovos business personnel. Will be part of the escalation path; mid-level for various business/technical problems escalated from customers related to system integration. Essential Functions:Facilitate business process discussions including requirements gathering with the end users, document and confirm the user requirements.Coordinate the developmental activities with the development team and manage project time lines and business expectationsDevelop the testing activities with the end users to ensure that the delivered solution to business is aligned with the established user requirementsNeed to be “hands on” with various technical tasks– Data mapping, Web Services/SFTP configuration, Application Deployment etc.Provides references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation; providing help desk support; training usersOther duties as assignedRequired SkillsStrong understanding of relational database technologies; and able to write SQL queriesExperience with all phases of project life cycle and knowledge of process managementSignificant experience with facilitating requirements gathering and testing sessions with respective customers and business stakeholdersStrong experience with creating business, functional and technical requirement specifications including process flows, use cases, and high-level design diagrams and subsequently crafting it so it’s suited for its intended audience; Thorough knowledge of working in Microsoft Visio is preferred.Prior experience leveraging integration-related technologies such as Web Services/SFTP, XML/XSLT/XQuery, and SOA, in a transaction intensive environment.Solid understanding of key integration concepts such as asynchronous messaging, data transformation, routing and batch processing.Experience working with Systems Integration Platforms such as Mule/Active MQ environments, Biz Talk, Dell Boomi (Mule Soft is preferred)Familiarity with Enterprise applications such as SAP, Maximo, JDE, Infor or Oracle software programsExperience in facilitating software project implementations with developersExperience working with CRM and Contract Management software is preferredRequired ExperienceBachelors in Computer Science or MIS disciplines7 + years, non-managerialStrong multi-tasking skills to be able to juggle wide range of challenges that will encompasses the roleExcellent interpersonal, verbal, and written skills to effectively establish/maintain positive working relationship with customers and stakeholdersEffectively communicate with both technical and non-technical personnelKnowledge of Procurement, Supply Chain (MRO Material Purchasing)/ LogisticsStrategic thinking, an aggressive drive, and an aptitude for engineering simple but effective integration solutions #CBJob Location  Radnor, US-PA

Name: BI Analyst (Virtual)
Description: We are currently seeking a seeking a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our BI analytics team. You will work closely with the BI manager to study formal and informal data to help better understand performance. This is a great opportunity for an analytically minded individual willing to learn multiple service lines to use information to influence the decision making process. This is a virtual role.What does this job involve?Having the know-howYou’ll need to have a great knowledge in Business Intelligence and be fluent in Technology. In this role, you will assess the current technical environment and develop technology requirements and conceptual solutions to meet business objective. You will partner with data owners to understand business requirements and common reporting/analysis use cases and work with technical and business teams to define appropriate technical solutions which includes BI solutions & Data Warehouse implementation, data access and dashboard creation. You will also be assisting with some reporting- drafting and distributing reports weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annually.Being a trailblazer and breaking new groundTo be successful in this role, you should be a confident professional with broad skills in analyzing and solving complex business problems, writing and presenting, facilitating and influencing. This includes being able to extrapolates data and be able to forecast and trending of performance data as well as analyze trends of monthly Key Performance Indicator results for performance improvement concepts. Also, you should be able to provide hands-on support to provision data from a variety of internal sources, build reporting and meta-data models to support strategic data initiatives and design complex reports and dashboards based on requirements.Sound like you? Before you apply, it’s also worth knowing what we’re looking for:SmartA Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Finance, Information Technology or related field is required; also along with 0- 2 years of experience in Corporate Real Estate environment. Previous experience with other data and statistical applications are a plus (PowerPivot, Tableau, SAS, Access, MiniTab, Sigma Excel, SQL)Dynamic and Highly SkilledYou’ll need to be dynamic and technologically savvy and utilize software to support planning solutions and communicate ideas clearly with planning team and lines of businesses. You will be successful if you have advanced skills in Microsoft Excel (pivot table, vlook-up, and cell calculations) and Sharepoint. Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite and ability to consolidate data into Power Point for presentations to client and lines of business is highly valued. You’ll be effective in you role by learning to ask the right questions to understand the underlying needs of our clients. You’ll discover how to be proactive and innovative with solutions your stakeholders.Organized, Open and FlexibleExcellent communication skills are important – both written and spoken – and we’ll expect you to work independently, multi-task, and manage your time to meet deadlines. You keep on top of things as you’ll often need to reorganize your time day to day, to deal with your team’s changing necessities and requests. An individual with strong interpersonal skills with an ability to interact with all level external and internal clients will successful in the role. Most importantly, you’ll want to work as part of a diverse supportive and talented team.What you can expect from us You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things. Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, well-being, benefits and pay. We’ll offer you a competitive salary and benefits package.With us, you’ll develop your strengths and enjoy a career full of varied experiences. We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL.Apply today!#LIJLL Privacy StatementWhen you visit JLL websites, JLL may collect information related to those visits, without you actively sending that information. This information may include, for example, the internet browser you are using, your access device’s operating system, the language in which that system presents information to you, your IP (Internet Protocol) address, the web search that took you to the JLL website, the web pages and advertisements displayed to you, and the links you click on.For additional details please see JLL's Global Privacy Statement or our career site pages for each country.For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here.

Name: CRM Business Analyst
Description: #LifeIsSweet The people. The passion. The success. You will frequently see Sugas huddled around a desk or whiteboard collaborating, cranking out ideas, or solving the latest industry problem. Are you ready to play a key role in influencing how companies create extraordinary relationships with their customers? We’d love to hear your ideas! We’re going places… join us for the ride, experience sweet success and show us your passion.Where do you fit? The Business Analyst is a CRM subject matter expert, with the ability to lead discussions and draw functional requirements out of business subject matter experts. As a member of SugarCRM's Professional Services organization, you will be responsible for identifying and organizing customer needs into requirements and working with the project team to successfully implement those requirements. Impact you will make in the role:Collaboratively work with customers, project team members and partners in the definition of business requirementsLead CRM functional discussions and leverage your knowledge of CRM best practicesWork with the project team to translate requirements into project deliverablesPerform as the product owner during scrum meetingsWork with customer to prioritize project requirementsActively work with customers and the project team to resolve issuesCommunicate customer priorities to Core product management for inclusion in Core product roadmapCoordinate requirements work with Solution Architect, Project Manager and Engagement Director at SugarExpertise you will bring in:BA/BS degree, MS/MBA preferred5+ years of experience in a software professional services organization or consulting firm (Accenture, Deloitte, E&Y, etc.) with Business Analysis responsibilityAttention to detail and key and deadlinesStrong background of career achievementExcellent communicator (written and verbal) with ability to maintain open communication with all levels of the organization. Comfortable leading discussionsMust be goal-driven, a self-starter able to thrive in a fast-paced environmentMust have the ability to cut through the ambiguity and identify the core issuesStrong understanding of enterprise software and enterprise software implementation/projects. CRM or ERPExperience with Agile methodologyExperience implementing cloud/SaaS software solutionsMust develop a good understanding of SugarCRM product capabilities and best practices. Become Sugar certifiedExperience facilitating requirements sessions with business users, IT and senior managementStrong experience with business process definition and designExperience estimating work effortExperience creating detailed project documents – project plan, functional design, use cases, test plans, etc.Experience managing projects – timeline, resources and financialsExperience in end user trainingHistory of successful project completion (on time, on budget) for projects where you have worked on the requirementsGeneral office skills are required. Familiarity with project management and/or other tracking tools is requiredProject management cert. (e.g. PMP) desired but not essentialAbility to travel to customer locations and work from customer offices as requiredRespect and expect accountabilityLocation: Cupertino, CA, Raleigh, NC or Remote-U.S. We are an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. Minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.Benefits and Perks: Beyond a stellar work environment, friendly people, and inspiring work, we have some great benefits and perks: Competitive salariesExcellent medical, dental and vision coverage for you and your family, along with other benefit plans like 401(k) matchGenerous paid time off policyWeekly catered lunch & learns, fully stocked kitchens, and nearby access to Cupertino’s newest restaurants and stores at Main Street CupertinoHealth/Wellness: Quarterly chair massages, Wellness Reimbursement, and Workforce Fitness ProgramOnsite Programs such as Dry Cleaning, Car Washes, Massage, Yoga, and moreCareer & Personal Development Program – multi-platformNew Hire Onboarding for all new employees worldwide – at Corporate Headquarters in Cupertino, CaliforniaRegular social events and birthday celebrations (yes, sweet treats are a big deal at SugarCRM)Ownership is the greatest self-identity at SugarCRM - you are making an impact nowWe are a merit-based company - many opportunities to learn, excel and grow your careerLearn more on LinkedIn and Twitter @LifeAtSugarNote to Recruiters and Placement Agencies: SugarCRM does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our website or to any SugarCRM employee. SugarCRM will not pay fees to any third-party agency or firm and will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes received will be considered property of SugarCRM and will be processed accordingly.

Name: Lead Business Analyst
Description: As a Chase employee, you’ll be part of a company that makes a real difference every day for our customers, our communities and ourselves. With a focus on customer service, you’ll put others first, do what’s right and create solutions that make lives better. We invite you to build your career on our strong foundation and help shape what’s next – for you and for us.Consumer & Community Banking consists of the following lines of business:Consumer Banking serves 23 million households at 5,613 branches in 23 states, 20,513 ATMs, online, via mobile and by phone.Mortgage Banking serves customers primarily through the branches, as well as by telephone and online. Services 7 million mortgage loans with combined balances of $1 trillion and offers purchase and refinance solutions to first-time and experienced home buyers.Chase Card Services is the No.1 credit card issuer in the United States (based on outstanding), with $126 billion in average loans and 66 million credit cards in circulation.Chase Wealth Management consists of two distinct but integrated businesses, Chase Private Client and Chase Investments. More than 3,000 advisors oversee $208 billion in investment assets in more than 2,461 branches.Business Banking serves businesses with annual revenue up to $20 million in 23 states.Auto Finance provides auto loans and leases to consumers through a national network of automotive dealers and on behalf of our manufacturer clients. Chase Commerce Solutions is a global leader in payment processing, partnering with merchants to enable them to accept multiple secure, easy-to-use payment methods such as credit and debit cards, gift cards, international payments and electronic check processing.Across our CCB lines of business we are proud of the following leadership positions:#1 ATM network #1 SBA lender #1 credit card issuer in the U.S. #1 U.S. co-brand credit card issuer #1 global Visa issuer #1 wholly-owned merchant acquirer #2 branch network #2 in mortgage originations #3 in deposit market share #2 in mortgage servicing #3 non-captive auto lender in terms of new/used vehicles sold at franchised dealersAs a Business Analyst Lead for the Payment Networks Vendor Management Office, you are given the responsibility of being a key lead in the effective management of the IT relationship supporting Chase’s Card and Digital Wallet processing with Visa, MasterCard, and other Vendors as needed. This role requires disciplines such as data analysis, financial management, payment network oversight (Visa/MasterCard), business systems analysis, performance metrics, and reporting. It also requires working with multiple lines of business to analyze business requirements and review/produce specifications for any changes to technology payment applications impacting Payments Processing and/or the Digital platform. Key Responsibilities:Operations and Compliance Management:Provide oversight for Third Party Risk Management and Audit Reviews to include the implementation of changes required from audit reviews alongside managing the remediation of any issues raised. Manage all Chase required Application Risk Assessments and for the Visa and MasterCard application portfolio. Ensure Visa and MasterCard services are accurately reflected in Chase’s application repository. Partner with the Payment Network Office to analyze and/or prepare variances and waivers granted to Chase by Visa and MasterCard. Serve as a Level 3 Escalation Point to assist in resolving issues involving either Visa or MasterCard in a timely manner.Communicate industry updates, Payment Network changes, product updates, and processing changes impacting Card, Retail, Digital, and Merchant Services as it relates to Payments processing and Digital wallets. Perform validation of Visa and MasterCard settings supporting Card and Digital processing (e.g. Token Service Enrollment Setup variables, Card Art settings, etc.).Ensure department documentation (data library) remains evergreen. Project Execution:Serve as primary point of contact for interaction/coordination with Visa and/or MasterCard related to Digital activities.Serve as a single point of contact for disseminating changes to interface specifications for Digital Wallet activities and collect/gather feedback from internal Chase teams. Coordinate meetings to review and discuss changes and/or obtain answers and clarifications across multiple technology and business teams.Coordinate and schedule testing needs for all major projects.Coordinate configuration of new file transfers between Visa and/or MasterCard and Chase. Coordinate infrastructure upgrades and connectivity projects between Payment Networks and Chase. Coordinate defect review meetings with Payment Networks during projects and for BAU issues. Skills:Exceptional verbal and written communication skillsExceptional negotiation skills Strong relationship management skills Strong JPMC institutional knowledge and experiences with specific emphasis in both the acquiring and issuing side of paymentsStrong understanding of the controls environment and its requirements across the FirmRelentless drive to understand the details and the ability to rapidly distill and retain key factsExceptional analytical thinking skills with the ability to anticipate and prepare for the next step/phaseExceptional leadership skills with the proven ability to influence without authority and leads by example through strong teamwork as well as setting high expectations for themselves and othersComfortable operating in a self-sufficient and entrepreneurial mannerDemonstrated experience operating in a matrix organization and leading through ambiguityCreates a culture of partnership and collaborationDemonstrates superior judgment and urgency to mitigate risk that could impact the Firm’s reputationQualifications:3-5 years of professional work experience in Information Technology within a large enterprise organization IT Project Management or Business Systems Analyst experience preferredExperience with all stages of the PDLC (Project Development Life Cycle) and Agile developmentUnderstanding of Payment Processing for Credit and Debit cardsEmerging Payments experience to include Digital Wallets, Mobile Payments, and eCommerceExperience in debit and/or credit card payments processing/technology preferredBachelor’s Degree in Management Information Systems or related field of study or equivalent experience in systems or software development

Name: Chubb Associate – CAT Analyst
Description: Chubb Associate- CAT Analyst  About the Chubb Associate Program  Chubb is looking for an aspiring insurance professional with a Bachelor’s Degree to join our Chubb Associate Program. This Chubb Associate role will work in the Retail Commercial and Specialty Lines Cat Modeling Unit.  As the industry leader in Property & Casualty insurance, Chubb is an employer of choice for a student aspiring to develop a meaningful career in a fast-paced, diverse company. This is a full-time position and a compelling opportunity to join a global, growing, financially stable and successful company.  We have designed our Chubb Associate Program to hone your skills and talents and help you reach your career goals. By joining the Chubb Associate Program, you will be part of an experience that supports the well-rounded development of critical business skills which in turn contributes to the future success of our company. Our blended program is designed to include hands-on business assignments in a variety of disciplines, interactive classroom instruction, team assignments and direct interaction with other early career professionals as well as with many of our senior executives. As part of this program you will receive:   Challenging assignments and the opportunity to contribute to the result of a team;   Business training unique to a career at Chubb;   Technical training to deepen your skill level within your chosen discipline; and an understanding of our broader industry;   Interpersonal effectiveness training to help you gain strong communication and interactive skills;   Access to additional training to compliment your professional development.  We are excited about and committed to the Chubb Associate Program because we believe that we are developing talented professionals with the potential to become Chubb’s leaders of the future.  Who are we looking for?  Successful professionals at Chubb come from many backgrounds and experiences and bring that rich diversity with them to our company. They also have some things in common and these attributes will lead to your success at Chubb:   Results orientation: a demonstrated ability to meet commitments under pressure   Practical intellectual agility: capable and confident in absorbing new information   Personal capacity: accepting and welcoming of additional responsibility over time   Communication skills: an ability to communicate successfully in various settings   Interpersonal/team skills: works effectively with all colleagues and collaborates within and across departments   Initiative: an ability to take full ownership of work and show initiative as needed   Customer focused: service oriented, recognizing the importance of understanding client needs   Integrity and work ethic: a commitment to hard work and a high ethical conduct   Successful academic record: Minimum GPA of 3.0 Successful candidates will be:  Curious; passionate about learning   Flexible and adaptable; a change agent   Resilient and resourceful   Collaborative; able to lead and follow Desired Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree; many majors will be considered; slight preference to Risk Management, Business, or Computer Science   Prior work experience (including summer or part time roles) or internships preferred   Demonstrated active engagement in extracurricular activities   Some knowledge of insurance concepts, practice, and procedures is desirable   MS Office experience, including Word, Excel, and Outlook   Oral and written communication skills  Demonstrated skills in: o Critical thinking  o Influencing both formally and informally  o Articulating a message / point of view in presentation and in writing   Familiarity with RMS and/or AIR catastrophe models a plus.   Knowledge of Excel and an ability to manipulate and format large data sets in a timely manner.   Experience with SQL a plus.

Name: Business Analyst with ServiceNow
Description: Business Analyst with ServiceNow Requisition Number 1532 Targeted Start Date 8/6/18 Location  Philadelphia, PAApply NowBusiness AnalystpureIntegration is looking for a Business Analyst to join our team of consultants. You will play an important role in helping implement ServiceNow for a fortune 500 company. In addition, you will be documenting processes and helping keep the project on task. This is a high visibility project with a clear expectation of success. Problem-solving and deadline management are critical success factors for the right candidate to demonstrate. Name: Lead Application Coord/Analyst
Description: The Lead Application Coordinator/Analyst, in the Lewis Katz School of Medicine's IT Department, will participate in the development and design of the Ambulatory application in EPIC. The incumbent will serve as the subject matter expert assisting the Applications Coordinators in problem solving and/or build issues, and will be knowledgeable about organizational policies, procedures and business operations as well as the functionality of the ambulatory application. Under the supervision of the Assistant Director, the Lead Coordinator/Analyst will be responsible for reviewing the software, analyzing business operations, establishing relationships with the vendor and end users, and tailoring the system to the organization.  Responsibilities include: leading a team responsible for managing issues, building new data sets, and testing new functionality and upgrades; overseeing day-to-day operations of the Application Coordinators/Analysts and ensuring appropriate prioritization of issues and assignments; managing application design and development; coordinating testing applications; integrating applications within Help Desk staff and application coordinators assigned to the Command Center; troubleshooting problems or questions from end users; implementing changes requested for the system; and providing status reports to the Assistant Director and Director(s). Performs other duties as assigned. Required Education and Experience: Bachelor's degree in a related field and at least four years of directly related experience to include EMR software application implementation. Experience with all phases of Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and/or project life cycle (PLC). At least three years' EPIC experience. Epic certification in EpicCare Ambulatory. An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered. Required Skills and Abilities:Demonstrated ability to utilize EpicCare Ambulatory to analyze information, develop and apply system solutions.Demonstrated understanding of how workflow decisions translate to application configurations.Demonstrated skills in leadership, conflict management, and end-user customer service.Effective organizational, time management and prioritization skills.Demonstrated verbal and written communication skills.Strong interpersonal skills, along with the ability to interact with a diverse constituent population.Demonstrated computer skills in MS office and related software.Ability to participate in off-hours support rotation schedule.Ability to travel to off-site office locations not easily accessible by public transportation.Preferred:Demonstrated success in implementing application project plans.Experience in end-user training.Experience with MyChart, CareEverywhere, Security/Break the Glass, Orders Transmittal.GE Centricity experience. Compliance Statement: In the performance of their functions as detailed in the position description employees have an obligation to avoid ethical, legal, financial and other conflicts of interest to ensure that their actions and outside activities do not conflict with their primary employment responsibilities at the institution. Employees are also expected to understand and be in compliance with applicable laws, University and. employment policies and regulations, including NCAA regulations for areas and departments which their essential functions cause them to interact.  To obtain additional information about Temple University please visit our website at www.temple.edu.  Temple University's Annual Security and Fire Safety Report contains statistics, policies, and procedures related to campus safety and can be found at: http://www.temple.edu/safety/asfr/  You may request a copy of the report by calling Temple University's Campus Safety Services at 215-204-7900.SDL2017

Name: Clinical Business Analyst
Description: ProgenyHealth is a leading provider of care management solutions for premature and medically complex newborns. We partner with health plans and their neonatal providers to work collaboratively in developing a plan of care specific to the needs of each child - from admission to the intensive care nursery until they are safely transitioned from the hospital, through the first year of life. Our program promotes appropriate utilization, improves access, educates family members, reduces costs, and improves outcomes. Job Role The Clinical Business Analyst will support the clinical, software development, and client services staff with leading requirements definition, process improvement analysis, and quality assurance activities. Responsibilities Include:Lead the identification, definition and documentation of requirements for BabyTrax® through thorough analysis of business processes.Serve as a liaison between clinical, software development, and training teams to review, identify, clarify and resolve system needsRecognize inconsistencies and gaps in complex business processesWork across business functions (Clinical, IT, Client Services, etc.) and build effective relationships across the organization.Participate in the following business rhythms: Project Planning & Estimation meetings, reviewing impact of proposed changes to timelines, budgets, resources and project scope  Manage, review and elicit requirements  Test Planning and Execution  Quality Assurance  Client Services interactions  Coordinate with Training Lead with inputs to training activitiesManage and produce effective, detailed documentation, including:  Functional/Non-functional Requirements  Use Cases  Process workflows and modeling  Wireframes/Graphical User Interface markups in support of custom proprietary web and mobile applications  Test Cases  Electronic Data Interchange and web interfaces with external sourcesQualificationsBachelor's degree in a related field of study required; BSN and/or RN preferred.3+ years of experience managing and producing business requirements in clinical care management environment required.2+ years of experience interfacing with users and IT/software development teams to identify, clarify and enhance system requirements.Utilization Management workflow experience preferred.Experience working in a managed care/health plan environment preferred.Thorough understanding of best practices, project lifecycle, and processes to facilitate discussions around clinical software requirements.Strong communication skills.Strong Project Management and Business Analytics skills.Proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio and related tools for building detailed documentation.Ability to work independently and within a team environment.Able to multi-task and prioritize work to meet deadlines.Benefits/Culture Our team is our most important asset. some of the benefits we offer our team are: 401K with company matchMedical and dental benefitsLong Term DisabilityPaid Time OffBusiness Casual Work environmentTeam orientated events throughout the yearRole specific - partial or full telecommuting (after training period)

Name: SAP Analyst
Description: Robert Half Technology is looking to fill a long term SAP Analyst role in the Philadelphia area. Please forward your resume to david.bernard@rht.com if you are interested in this SAP Analyst role. Responsibilities: - Team member to work on a new S4 Hana 1709 implementation responsible for configuration review, functional specification development, data mapping and documentation - Support on translating business requirements into detailed functional specifications and work with project team to implement functionality. - Responsible for documenting business procedures, functional designs, test scenarios, test plan, test results and end user training materials Please forward your resume to david.bernard@rht.com if you are interested in this SAP Analyst role. Job Requirements Specific Knowledge Requirements and Tasks: - Solid understanding of FP A processes and management reporting systems - Advanced SAP user or SAP developer with proven experience in FICO and COPA configuration in relation to Cost Center-Controlling, Profitability Analysis, Internal Orders and Projects. - Demonstrated ability to understand business reporting requirements and to translate them into the right design decisions and configuration in SAP. - BPC Planning experience preferred but not required. - Good knowledge of basic FI modules and processes, new G/L for S4 HANA is a plus. - Design, configuration and validation of management reporting rules and allocations for Cost Centers, Profit Centers and Business Area reporting. - Other tasks will include to assist with presentations to leadership, training materials, system data loads, creation of cross reference mapping files among others. - General accounting knowledge/experience - Agile methodology and Solman experience is a plus Required Skills: - Strong team player capable to work with other workstreams (Make to Deploy, Order to Cash, etc.) understanding other configuration designs impacting Cost Center, Profit Center and Business Area. - Excellent oral and written communication skills - Solid understanding of accounting systems, processes and standards - Strong organization skills and attention to detail - Exposure to large-scale enterprise transformation projects is a plus - Proven ability to work in a team environment, managing competing priorities with tight deadlines - Motivated and strong drive for results Required Education / Experience: - 6-8 years of experience as FP A solution specialist or COPA Analyst - Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering or related field with minor in Business Administration. Please forward your resume to david.bernard@rht.com if you are interested in this SAP Analyst role. - provided by DiceAccounting, Agile, Analysis, Analyst, Business Requirements, Developer, Development, Management, Materials, Project, SAP, Specification, Test Plan, Validation

Name: Product Support Analyst
Description: Company DescriptionCustomized Energy Solutions (CES), a privately-held company, is a leading service provider of market intelligence and operational support services to companies participating in the retail and wholesale electric and natural gas markets. Utilizing deep know-how developed since the inception of the deregulated energy markets, CES provides accurate & timely analysis on regulatory changes, market opportunities, and operational efficiencies for electricity and natural gas commodities.  Join a rapidly growing company in an exciting and dynamic work environment. As one of the top 100 fastest growing companies in the Philadelphia region, Customized Energy Solutions offers an opportunity for significant professional growth. Our team of associates at CES is highly motivated, innovative, and passionate about providing excellent Services to our clients. We look for individuals interested in growing with our company, and working in an exciting, open and collegial work environment. Our main office is in Philadelphia, with satellite offices in various U.S. states, Canada, Japan and in India.Job DescriptionCustomized Energy Solutions is looking for an Analyst with experience in retail energy operations to join its Retail Services team. In this role the successful candidate will support the Companys Retail Energy practice by providing support to the retail operations group in production support and issue investigation by researching system issues using business and technical expertise, participating in user acceptance testing for new development items and bug fixes, and other related tasks. The candidate also support technical escalations and manage client communication through external ticketing systems and phone calls as required. In order to support these functions, the candidate will also need to become familiar with operational processes required to support clients business. This position will suit a candidate comfortable working under deadlines and with competing priorities. Scope of work will include operational investigation support for billing and EDI functions, development of a technical understanding of CES retail platforms and other related activity as required.  The successful candidate will be a high energy self-starter, a positive team player, possess strong analytical skills, and have excellent oral and written communication skills. Must be able to work independently and as part of a team. Being detail oriented and a person of integrity are essential qualities, as is an ability to handle new tasks and manage multiple projects and competing priorities. Representative Duties:Investigate client tickets by researching in SQL Database and via external and internal software portalsDaily billing and EDI operations, including quality audits, controls and exception managementPrepare development items where technical escalation is required to resolve ticketsReview reporting output and participate in trouble shooting to help ensure data integrity and accuracyProvide escalation support for client issuesParticipate in the development of business specs for software and reports, and work with developers to create and validate new features that impact supported functionsIdentify and recommend process improvements, including workflow changes and/or system enhancements that will drive efficiency in the daily operational proceduresWrite and deliver client communicationsAssist in completion of ad hoc projects as requiredAbility to understand and articulate the services and functionality of the BLUE platformAbility to operate with autonomyQualificationsOne to three (1-3) years relevant retail electric and/or natural gas operational experience (retail billing and EDI exception management, natural gas experience is a plus) strongly preferredRelevant college degree or equivalent experience requiredRelevant graduate degree or advanced industry training a plusExcellent analytic processing skills (Excel, SQL required)Ability to analyze information, solve problems and make quick, fact-based decisionsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAbility to work well in a deadline-driven, self-managed environmentDemonstrated ability to work well with others at all levels of the organizationDemonstrated ability to think outside the box by developing and implementing improvements to processes and tools Additional InformationCustomized Energy Solutions offers competitive salary commensurate with experience. Benefits include performance bonus and profit sharing Medical Savings Account, comprehensive health Insurance, disability insurance, life insurance, and 401K matching and tuition reimbursement. Excellent opportunities for advancement.
