Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Qurate Inc., the world’s leading video commerce and curated shopping experience retailer, seeks dynamic people to join our team. We are currently looking for a Sr. Business Analyst to join our energetic Operations Business Planning & Analysis team in Finance & Strategy.  Are you passionate about using data and analytics tools to tell compelling story and insights?  Excited about uncovering insights and value through your love for data mining?  Naturally curious and won’t stop until you get to the root-causes of the business performance?  These are some of what we are looking for in this Sr. Business Analyst role. Under the supervision of Director of Analytics & Insights, the Sr. Business Analyst will perform deep analytics to create standard dashboards, scorecards, and perform root cause analysis to solve complex supply chain and customer service problems and opportunities. The Sr. Business Analyst is a very strong individual contributor supervising 0-2 analysts in the team. The position is based outside of Philadelphia at our Studio Park headquarters in West Chester, PA.Job Description Details Some responsibilities include: Partners with Operations, Operations BPA team, and IT to develop business requirements for the key operations financial/performance metrics and dashboards.Independently designs, develops, and distributes reports, scorecards, and dashboards.Analyzes reports, dashboards, and scorecards to identify trends and key drivers (drill down to point out variances).Design and program efficient and accurate data sets based on the business requirements using SQL and corresponding SQL tools;Provide root-cause analysis for the financial and non-financial performance metrics for the operations business as needed;Understand the structure, integrity and usability of the data maintained in various databases throughout the company and learn to determine when to use which data for which analysis;Be naturally curious and perform proactive analysis to answers one’s own questions and hypotheses regarding the business;Execute ad-hoc data queries, analyses and presentation slides for senior leadership.Present the analysis using presentations, graphs, and charts to best illustrate the story.Partner with the business teams / leaders and immediate manager to understand the requests/projects, collaboratively develop the analysis, present the findings, and solicit feedback;Keep track of follow-up action items/questions from the business and perform deeper level analysis to answer the questions;Keep the manager updated on the progress on all active projects / analyses and next steps.Other business related duties as assigned.Required Qualifications:MS/BS in Business Analytics, Operations research, Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Econometrics or similarly related business field.Masters with 8+ years or BS with 12+ years of experience in analytic problem solving and reporting.Supply chain experience highly preferred.Expert knowledge in one of the following areas: SQL, Tableau, or programming.Strategic thinking and advanced analytical problem solving ability.Naturally curious, drive to think like a business owner and incorporate that thinking in the modeling and analysis.Strong analytical modeling skills using: SQL queries in Oracle, SQL server, SAS, Python or R, Tableau, Excel and Teradata.Basic computer programming knowledge in any language desired; (VB, C, C++, C# etc.)High attention to detail and accuracy in reporting of numbers and results.Operates independently with limited direction.Ability to work with different IT reporting systems / tools or the ability to learn them relatively quickly.Passion for supply chain and customer service.Strong verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills.Ability to work under pressure to meet strict deadlines.Ability to work collaboratively and harmoniously with other analysts in Operations & Operations BP&A teams. Senior Business AnalystQVC, Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of Liberty Interactive Corporation (NASDAQ: QVCA, QVCB), is the world’s leading video and ecommerce retailer. QVC is committed to providing its customers with thousands of the most innovative and contemporary beauty, fashion, jewelry and home products. Its programming is distributed to approximately 300 million homes worldwide through operations in the U.S., Japan, Germany, United Kingdom, Italy and a joint venture in China. Based in West Chester, Pa. and founded in 1986, QVC has evolved from a TV shopping company to a leading ecommerce and mobile commerce retailer. The company’s website, QVC.com, is ranked among the top general merchant Internet sites.  QVC, Q, and the Q Ribbon Logo are registered service marks of ER Marks, Inc.  As an equal opportunity employer, QVC is committed to a diverse workforce and is also committed to a barrier-free employment process. In order to ensure reasonable accommodations for individuals pursuant to applicable law, individuals that require accommodation in the job application process for a posted position may contact us at CareersUS@QVC.comfor assistance.

Name: Principal Business Analyst
Description: Job Description The Principal Business Analyst is responsible for leading the solution design phase of a startup project. The solution design process includes the discovery of requirements and begins at the first draft of a proposal in response to a RFP and continues through the finalization and approval of a solution for implementation. The Principal Business Analyst role continues throughout the project as needed to make modifications as requested and approved, and to support the implementation team as it relates to the solution designed. This position reports to a Director level role. Essential Duties & Responsibilities:Lead the IT team and coordinate with Operations, Engineering, and Sales in the design of a solution that meets the defined requirements in the services agreement for a customer. Ensure that final solution design is properly transitioned to the implementation team. Facilitate all design activities to include; definition, design, validation and quality assurance.Responsible for adhering to timelines, insuring the highest quality, moving the project team forward with urgency, and delivering frequent, timely, crisp communication to all stakeholders during the design process.Lead and own the process of establishing best practices for solution design and ensuring that these practices are adhered to. Including best in class configurations for key functions, not limited to receiving, put-away, picking and shipping.Develop a deep understanding of system capabilities and be the subject matter expert for the WMS applications.Oversee the documentation, preparation, presentation, review and signoff process for solution design.Support Engineering, Operations and Sales in the RFP process to include; discovery, customer sales and pre sales meetings, solution design, and pricing.Obtain agreement and sign-offs of solution designs from project stakeholders; Operations, Engineering, Sales, Customer.Provide feedback to the Manager for performance reviews and goal setting for senior business analysts and business analysts.Utilize project management methodologies, maintain and update documentation consistent with the NFI common framework.Provide guidance and direction to help develop Business Analysts.Continuously find ways to improve processes, execution, and delivery by staying informed on system enhancements, product road maps and market developments.Track and manage all assigned tasks and collaborate with the assigned PMO resource.Ability to identify and resolve system issues including root cause analysis.Other project related roles as assigned including assuming the project lead for the implementation of a startup.Competencies:Ability to work seamlessly as part of a team, demonstrate a strong Team commitmentOutstanding problem solving abilitiesEffective communication skillsSelf-motivated with the ability to be a proactive problem solverAbility to learn new systems, processes and tools quickly and thoroughlyTeam DevelopmentOutstanding decision making skills and the ability to take measured risksAbility to lead and champion changeStrong negotiation and collaboration skillsRequirements:Degree - BA / BS strongly preferred7+ years industry experience 3rd party logistics, warehousing and/or transportation5+ years' software solution design and implementation experience on relevant warehouse management systems.Outstanding communication skills with the ability to communicate with all levels of the organization and with external customers, both written and oralExpert level experience with WMS configuration and testingStrong MS Office Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio, Project, AccessBasic relational database knowledge and SQL query experience for data miningStrong interpersonal skillsExperience with formal project management methodologiesHands on production support experienceOutstanding writing skills for both business and technical documentationAbility to manage issues through completionFamiliarity with data integration formats (e.g. EDI, HTML, XML, SAP iDocs, MA txml, delimited files, and positional data files).SDL2017

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Reporting directly to the executive director/ vice president of MPN and indirectly to the director of professional billing, utilize MHS management principles in the design, development, production and delivery of report data from programs utilized in the delivery of Professional Services by MPN employed and contracted Physicians and Mid-Level providers to identify operational, financial, clinical effectiveness and delivery of Professional Services in the pursuit of Revenue Opportunities, Best Practice KPI and Quality Measures. Oversee and insure the integrity of transaction posting and reconciliation, production of reports design, development and quality for delivery to MHS and MPN Management Teams. Develop operational dashboards, and reports relative to annual HR, Practice Operations and Capital budgets. Report on variance to budgets.

Name: SAP Analyst

Name: Product Trial and Showcase Analyst Intern
Description: Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.Job Summary:The Comcast Technology Internship Program is an 11-week summer program designed to identify high-caliber talent to build our organization with the best and the brightest students.Over the course of the summer, your experience will include:- Engagement:Working on creative, innovative, and thought-provoking projects within various business units at Comcast during your internship experience.- Exposure:An inside look into the day-to-day operations of an organization at the cutting edge of media and technology.- Professional Development:You will be exposed to a variety of professional development topics facilitated through our partners at Comcast University and senior leaders within the organization. These sessions are inclusive of speaker series, skill-building workshops, and networking opportunities.- Mentorship:Mentoring from fellow colleagues through the Empowering Future Leaders Program (EFLP) to help you navigate your experience, provide coaching, and expand your professional network.- Fun:Continuously develop relationships with fellow interns through social activities, community building, and networking.Department and Position Overview:The intern will work with the Trial Support Services Team. This team provides product strategy and planning groups with strategic product evaluation services across the span of the product development lifecycle (Ideation, Development and Deployment) to facilitate faster and higher quality product / technology innovation, development and customer impact. It also provides Trial Portal support, participant recruitment, surveys, analysis, Trial management and communication, X1 Community Management and field relationship management.Employees at all levels are expected to:- Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job- Own the customer experience-think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services- Know your stuff-be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences- Win as a team-make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas- Be an active part of the Net Promoter System-a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company-by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers- Drive results and growth- Respect and promote inclusion and diversity- Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communitiesCore Responsibilities:-Verifying information for Community Management Jira tickets in XRAY, ADS, XRE and Community Manager- Approving Community Management Jira tickets- Assist with UAT of Trial Portal website new features- Assist with UAT of Trials Feedback app new features in iOS and Android devices- Monitor Trial Ops team mailbox for Trial Portal issues, i.e., reset password requests, access problemsJob Specification:- Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree from a United States-based college or university- Majors: Computer Science, Information Science & Technology, Marketing, Managementor a related field- 3.0 GPA or higher- Ability to learn quickly- Able to handle requests from multiple channels- Inventory management skills a plus- Demonstrates solid decision-making skills- Proven analytical, organizational, and problem-solving ability- Strong written and verbal communication skills- Ability to work independently and in group settings.- Strong interest in the technology, telecommunications and media industries- Current and future authorization to work in the United States of America  Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

Name: Business Intelligence Architect
Description: Pandera is Hiring! Join a fast paced, industry leader, and award winning organization that is growing!!! BI Analytics is a part of the delivery organization (AOC Practice) of Pandera. This organization’s mission is to provide technical expertise in the ever-growing field of business intelligence across various industries. Primarily utilizing the BI platform MicroStrategy, the BI Architect enables business units to trend, analyze and identify a problem and/or understand more about a business scenario. The BI Architect serves a key role in a project, with the ability to perform all MSTR functions, and provide new developers with assistance when needed. Responsibilities:Design BI application technical solution based on business requirement and designExecuting deliverables as assigned including but not limited to: Designing, Developing, Testing, and Deploying Dashboards and Report SolutionsApplication Object CreationSchema Object CreationMicroStrategy Administrative TasksQualifications:3 years’ experience with MicroStrategy3 years’ experience in a BI positionThis position requires experience with: Data ModelingMSTR Object ManagerMSTR I-ServerMSTR Integrity ManagerMSTR Command ManagerPandera Best Practices and StandardsExcellent analytical and problem solving skillsSQL, PL/SQL proficiencyCertified as MCD (MicroStrategy Certified Developer) or above, or have comparable experienceTeamwork is critical.Strong written and verbal communication skills are essential to interact with business analysts, peers, and management.Full working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, emphasis in ExcelMust be well organized, detail oriented and able to self-prioritize work.Some experience in a leadership capacity required.Must exhibit a high degree of professionalism.Education:Bachelor’s degree in business or Computer ScienceAbout Pandera Pandera is a global provider and singular source of expertise in the science and art of decision automation solutions and information delivery technologies. Pandera offers clients and their business partners a simple and repeatable method of automating and validating mission critical business decisions.  Pandera’s primary mission is to help organizations in the development of tools to manage and operate complex business units and functions, respond appropriately to challenging exceptions, and situational changes in real time with discrete role relevant analytical applications. Our solution advisors and delivery teams provide use of unmatched technology innovation and visualization technics in conjunction with proprietary industry decision frameworks to ensure knowledge workers make choices and take action in the best interests of their organization.  The goal of each client engagement is to architect a decision framework to gain competitive advantage, streamline operations, and create continuity by integrating customers, partners, and business users on a common platform for information delivery. For more about Pandera, visit us at www.panderasystems.com or http://www.linkedin.com/company/1697318

Name: Business Systems Analyst - Campus Recruiting
Description: Category:  Business Analysis (functional and technical) City:  Plymouth Meeting, Pennsylvania, United States Position ID:  J0918-0829 Employment Type:  Graduate Position Description:CGI is seeking students interested in careers in the Information Technology field. CGI is more than just an IT consulting company; we are a global organization offering a world of opportunities. Become part of a unique culture that gives you the freedom to innovate, to make decisions, to achieve your full potential and to chart your own career.  Our Business System Analysts typically have a demonstrated interest in technology and business, strong problem-solving abilities, and excellent interpersonal skills. Business System Analysts will be placed on one of our many projects and provide technical/functional expertise in identifying, evaluating, and developing basic systems. Your future duties and responsibilities:What you’ll do (assignments may include responsibilities in one or more of the following areas): Business Analysis: Developing knowledge of a client’s industry, customers, organization and business objectives in order to help the client in a problem-solving role. Assessing user requirements, procedures and problems to create or improve a system.User Support Analysis: Providing quality client support by answering client questions, researching possible solutions to problems, and fostering open communication between the client and the CGI project team. Tracking software and documentation defects, performing application maintenance, and providing onsite consulting and training as required.System Testing: Working with system developers and designers to identify, diagnose, and document problems and errors in specific components of a system. Assessing how well a product adheres to its design, standards, as well as its usability and ability to meet business needs.Decision Analysis: Applying quantitative methods to study and make recommendations regarding various business issues, including credit risk management, customer profitability, resource allocation and optimization, and customer segmentation.What you’ll gain:Involvement in a team oriented atmosphereExposure to business issues and challengesOpportunity to leverage your computer knowledge and analytical skills Required qualifications to be successful in this role:What you’ll need: Bachelors degree required in a relevant field (i.e.: Business Majors to include Finance, Accounting, Management Information Systems, IS/IT and other majors that include consulting and technology coursework)A great attitude and hunger for learningExcellent analytical, written and oral communication skillsFlexibility and ability to deal with ambiguityAbility to work within a team environment3.0 GPA strongly preferredAbility to work in the U.S. for an indefinite period of time with ability to obtain a US Government clearance What you can expect from us:Build your career with us.It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.  At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer.  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics.  CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S., please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at US_Employment_Compliance@cgi.com. You will need to reference the requisition number of the position in which you are interested. Your message will be routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do not include a requisition number will not be returned.  We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! Click here to be directed to our site that is dedicated to veterans and transitioning service members.  All CGI offers of employment in the U.S. are contingent upon the ability to successfully complete a background investigation. Background investigation components can vary dependent upon specific assignment and/or level of US government security clearance held.  CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI’s legal duty to furnish information.

Name: Digital Analyst
Description: Our Digital Analyst will be responsible for assisting with program development, optimization opportunities, and possible testing activities. Drives analysis of marketing campaigns and initiatives to identify tactics for optimizing marketing, marketing efficiency and marketing effectiveness. Supports integrated media and channel team members in the execution of the marketing strategy and analytics. Defines success metrics, makes assessments of marketing channels and operations and helps with marketing campaign optimization efforts. Provides reports, dashboards, and ad-hoc analyses with recommendations. While we'd prefer our candidate of choice to commute into one of our amazing offices, we are open to a full-time telecommute role for the right fit. Essential Functions:Collects data to measure & analyze return-on-investment across several key marketing and business initiativesPerform campaign data analysis to understand the lift & ROI associated with each program to aid in the development of future strategiesProvide recommendations on analytical methodologies and frameworks to be utilized for a various analytical projectsWork with cross-functional teams on the day-to-day execution of analytics projects & initiativesGenerate reports, documentation and insights as part of the analysis process. Produce expected performance measures including lifts, efficiencies, and other measuresExecute appropriate quality control procedures for analysis, reporting and data visualization for accuracySupport the building of analytical capabilities and solutions (segmentation, modeling, campaign evaluations, etc.) that enable analytics to support the strategic goals of the CompanyReview, analyze and present qualitative and quantitative analysis and data to internal and external stakeholdersEnsure quality and timeliness of deliverables that meet expectations while balancing business needs with the appropriate level of analytical rigorLeverage story-telling skills to deliver insights that are clear, concise and actionableCore Competencies:Customer Focus- Dedicated to meeting and exceeding expectations to customers, establishes and maintains effective relationships with customersPeer Relationships- Finds common ground/solves problems for the good of all, solves problems with peers, is a team player, collaborates and supports peers.Priority Setting - Spends his/her time and the time of others on what's important; quickly zeroes in on the critical few and puts the trivial many aside; can quickly sense what will help or hinder accomplishing a goal; eliminates roadblocks; creates focusDrives for Results - Can be counted on to exceed goals successfully; is constantly and consistently one of the top performers; very bottom-line oriented; steadfastly pushes self and others for resultsTime Management - Uses his/her time effectively and efficiently; values times; concentrates his/her efforts on the more important priorities; gets more done in less time than others; can attend to a broader range of activitiesRequirements:4+ years of marketing, web, or customer analytics experienceStrong knowledge of multiple digital channels and how they work together (SEM, SEO, CRO, Social, Shopping, Display, etc.)Experience across various verticals including e-commerce and lead generationStrong analytical skills, proficient with Microsoft Excel and data analysisProficient using Tableau SoftwareExperience working with and utilizing Google Analytics and attribution solutionsEffective time management and project management skillsElite SEM Analytics utilizes parts of the Digital Analytics Association's Competency Framework. The framework helps to define the skills, knowledge, and abilities necessary to succeed in the field of digital analytics. The Competency Framework also helps Elite SEM set a standard of capabilities in the digital analytics industry and evaluate prospective employees against those competencies. Elite SEM also uses the Competency Framework to help guide employees down the path of growth and opportunity, helping to identify and assess the knowledge and skills you currently have and/or need to possess as you progress in your career. About Elite SEM: Elite SEM is an award-winning digital marketing agency. Founded on search, focused on holistic performance-driven digital marketing, Elite expertise spans Paid Search, SEO, Shopping & Feed, Display Advertising, Paid Social, Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO), and Insight & Analytics. Elite brings a unique business model to the market that ties account performance to account managers, and rewards our teams for continuous performance and satisfied clients with a share of company profits. Elite SEM survives and thrives by the mantra "Great Lives for Great People" this includes employees, clients, partners, vendors, fans and everyone that crosses our paths. Our core values Love What You Do, Circle of Education, Attitude of Gratitude, and Strive for Greatness help foster this goal each and every day. The actual duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may vary based on assignment or group. Elite SEM is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected status. (NASDAQ: IEP), to invest in and operate businesses involved in aftermarket parts distribution and service. Our businesses have a singular focus: provide premium automotive parts and services at a great value. The businesses of Icahn Automotive today consist of Pep Boys® automotive aftermarket retail and service chain, Auto Plus® automotive aftermarket parts distributor, Precision Tune Auto Care® owned and franchised automotive service centers, and AAMCO Total Auto Care franchised service centers. The businesses of Icahn Automotive total over 22,000 employees, over 2,000 company-owned and franchise locations and 25 distribution centers throughout the US, Canada, and Puerto Rico. Working for this leading academic medical center means collaboration with top clinical, technical and business professionals across all disciplines.  Today at Penn Medicine, someone will make a breakthrough. Someone will heal a heart, deliver hopeful news, and give comfort and reassurance. Our employees shape our future each day. include:Responsibilities include creating and delivering technical resolutions to create workflow, process design and programming solutions to business problems.Must have strong analytical, programming and communication skills and be able to balance technical and business objectives to improve quality outcomes.Must be able to create and implement project plans and routinely communicate status of work.Assist in the education & training of new hires and other team members and be available as a resource for the team.Attends planning and status meetings with key client personnel to understand project requirements and communicate our implementation methodology to the clientEnsures information system functionality meets all clinical and business requirements of Integration and UPHS organization.Considers staffing change management when planning solutions.Follows established documentation and project status procedures and delivers same to client and received from client in the case of vendor specific implementationsAssists in the monitoring of projects and maintains open communication with managerAble to perform complex tasks with minimal supervisionConsistently delivers quality work and seeks assistance appropriatelyCommunicates with and facilitates involvement of other support groups within Information Services and with other departments as necessaryProvides Oncall and production support as necessaryAssists in the design and development of new InterfacesConsiders technical feasibility and optimal design of interfaces and offers recommendations to application groups on sameFollows established documentation and change control procedures related to user requests, system design and development, modifications, testing, and creating and maintain interfaces to/from Lawson, C-Cure, and third party applications.Experience with object oriented programming, SQL, and writing Crystal Reports.Minimum Requirements :Minimum Degree Requirements and Experience Required:Bachelor’s degree requiredCurrent Internal Penn Medicine Information Services division employees may be considered with proof of active and continued enrollment in an approved bachelor degree programMinimum of 3 years related experienceExperience in complex technical projectsExperience in health care IT preferredTechnical Skill Requirements: This role requires an overall understanding of device integration and vital signs data from the bedside monitors to the EMRs. Understanding of HL7 protocol, Capsule Technology, GE CPN Connect application, and other HealthCare related applications is desirable. Strong analytical ability, problem-solving, documentation, and communication skills are essential. In addition, the following requirements are a must: Strong background in Applications support including an understanding of databases and reporting needA strong understanding system/hardware setup and troubleshootingThis position sometimes require onsite support for systems/applications at the hospital, including the ORs, ICUs and other hospitals departments/unitsTeamwork and Collaboration is essential to succeed in this roleParticipate in 7 X 24 on-call rotation supporting diverse healthcare applicationsSkill Requirements:Provide Technical expertise to ensure that the design, implementation and end results meet the business requirements.Utilizes industry standard processes to generate specifications for implementation and for specification review process.Ensures project scope and design and pragmatic and results orientated technical decisions.Identify problem definitions and make recommendations regarding refinements and decisions, throughout the product life cycle.Contribute to, and/or own, the development process for the deployment strategy, plan and schedule.Strong analytical, problem identification and resolution skills.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbalKnowledge of healthcare operations, data structure and use of information system applications in the practicing healthcare and financial environment.Ability to both recognize project barriers or risks and address them in a timely fashionDemonstrated ability to function as part of a team providing a high level of quality serviceCorporate Applications:Skill Requirements:Experience with an ERP or business system such as Lawson, PeopleSoft, SAP, etc.Experience with creating and maintain interfaces to/from Lawson, C-Cure, and third party applications.Experience with object oriented programming, SQL, and writing Crystal Reports.Additional Information :Be a part of the exciting and ground-breaking upcoming years for the Penn Medicine Information Services department!  Because growth is essential to continuing to meet the current and future needs of patients, Penn Medicine continues to expand its capabilities.Penn Medicine's Information Services (IS) Department focuses its efforts on the clinical and financial systems that support the day-to-day operations of four hospitals, several satellite practices, and more than 2,000 physicians.  Learn more about Information ServicesWe believe that the best care for our patients starts with the best care for our employees. Our employee benefits programs help our employees get healthy and stay healthy. Name: Technical Solutions Analyst/Business Analyst
Description: A family of companies and experiences As the leading foodservice and support services company, Compass Group USA is known for our great people, great service and our great results. If you’ve been hungry and away from home, chances are you’ve tasted Compass Group’s delicious food and experienced our outstanding service. Our 225,000 associates work in award-winning restaurants, corporate cafes, hospitals, schools, arenas, museums, and more in all 50 states. Our reach is constantly expanding to shape the industry and create new opportunities for innovation. Join the Compass family today! great people. great services. great results. Each and every individual plays a key role in the growth and legacy of our company. We know the next big idea can come from anyone. We encourage developing and attracting expertise that differentiates us as a company as we continue to raise the bar. Job Summary  Under general direction, the Techincal Solutions Analyst/Business Analyst will work with North American field operations to coordinate and enhance information services and technological related needs fostering better communication and relationships. As the liaison between the field users and IS Department, the BA will be responsible for day to day interaction, administration, training, support, and project management in relation to Information Services, specifically in regards to our in-house field applications. The BA will also have direct interaction with our clients, and will be responsible for sales presentations and demonstrations of our software. The BA will be responsible for interpreting existing data, analyzing it for insights and trends, and providing a report out to our operations management and senior management teams. ResponsibilitiesAct as the liaison between the field operations and the Information Services Department to foster a relationship of open communication.Act as the liaison between our clients and the Information Services Department, specifically for sales demonstrations and support.Analyze existing data for operational insights and efficiencies.Develop analytical reports for field and senior management using SQL Server Reporting Services or Microsoft Power BI.Act as an advocate for our operators to use existing technological resources and solutions to improve the operational efficiencies and enhance daily activities within the corporation.Prepare accurate and detailed requirement specifications documents, user interface guides, and functional specification documents.Design and execute test scripts and test scenarios.Provide application level user support, end-user documentation, training materials, and operational instructions that clearly and accurately reflect each system's functionality.Performs instructor led training for end users via in person, classroom, or web based training.Responsible throughout the project life cycle; help determine priorities while balancing business needs against other development projectsAct as the Project Manager for the system roll out and implementation Hands on instruction and implementation on site.Knowledge of PC setup and basic wired/wireless networking skills.Ability to troubleshoot connectivity and setup issues.Ability to make effective decisions under pressure.Minimum RequirementsBA/BS degree required, preferably in Management Information Systems or Information Systems, or related field.Advanced skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint are required. Knowledge of Microsoft Projects and Visio. Knowledge of Microsoft Power BI a plus.Knowledge of Microsoft SQL, specifically the ability to write and run queries against large databases.Knowledge of database architecture and management related to Microsoft SQL server, a plus.Knowledge of web applications and servers a plus.Travel: 20-50%Abilities required:Must be customer service-oriented.Good knowledge of PC’s and general troubleshooting.Strong organizational skills.Ability to make effective decisions under pressure.Strong project management and problem solving skills required.Excellent verbal, written and telephone communication skills.Must be able to analyze and document complex business processes.Knowledge of healthcare industry, specifically hospital support service operations, is a plus.Apply to Compass Group today!Click here to Learn More about the Compass Story   Compass Group is an equal opportunity employer. At Compass, we are committed to treating all Applicants and Associates fairly based on their abilities, achievements, and experience without regard to race, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other classification protected by law.Req ID:  220173  Compass Corporate   JEFFERY F LANDIS   SALARIED EXEMPT

Name: Financial Analyst/Controller
Description: Position Title: CONTROLLERCrothall Healthcare is a Compass One Company that provides specialized, high-quality, innovative, and responsive support services exclusively to the healthcare industry. Crothall serves many of the Top 100 Hospitals among their 1200 healthcare clients and across the nation in 39 states. Crothall has earned a spot on the Top 100 Best Places to Work in Healthcare in 2013, 2014, and 2015, and a Becker’s Healthcare Top Places to Work in 2016. Our core services include: Environmental Services, Patient Transport, Laundry & Linen, Facilities Management, Healthcare Technology Solutions, and Ambulatory Services. For more information, go to www.crothall.com. Job Summary  Working as the Financial Analyst you will be responsible for assessing the financial performance of Crothall Healthcare. You will assist with all the accounting and control functions at the account including all revenue and expense reporting, accounts payable, accounts receivable and monthly financial reporting requirements. Key Responsibilities:Compiles new and rebid pro-forma and analyzes for accuracyPrepares and analyzes monthly management reporting; new, rebid and lost business reporting; weekly Business Owner ReportsProvides financial guidance to operating units within the region on matters involving client returns, revenue and profitability goalsImproves financial status by compiling and analyzing budgets and forecast, monitoring variances, identifying trends, and considering "what if” scenarios to bring forth suggestions to the Director of FinanceDocuments and maintains complete and accurate supporting information for all financial transaction.Provides accurate and timely reporting on the financial activity of individual projectCreates and designs reports and spreadsheets; creates and maintains a database to organize, collect and upload data into required reporting formatsPreferred Qualifications:Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year College or University in Accounting or FinanceAbility to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documentsAbility to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business communityAbility to write speeches and articles for publication that conform to prescribed style and formatAbility to effectively present information to top management, public groups, and/or boards of directorsAbility to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volumeAbility to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometryAbility to competently use Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel. Ability to competently use a personal computerAbility to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusionsAbility to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variablesExperience with SAP, Excel, Power Point, AccessStrong organization and time management skillsExcellent negotiation and communication skillsKnowledge of generally accepted accounting principles  About Compass Group: Achieving leadership in the foodservice industry    Compass Group is an equal opportunity employer. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the position posted, the Company reserves the right to modify or change the essential functions of the job based on business necessity. *Los Angeles applicants: Compass Group will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring (Ban the Box ordinance).

Name: Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Sr. Business Intelligence AnalystType: Full-time Location: Scottsdale, AZ General Overview: As a Senior Data Analytics/BI Consultant, you are expected to combine business consulting with data and analytics skills, and work with a variety of technologies, which may include BI and analytics platforms, data warehouse, ETL tools, and data quality and data governance. Flexibility on work assignments, and work location, are essential to our operations. Our west coast office is in Scottsdale, AZ, but flexibility to travel is required, based on business needs. There will likely be opportunities for training and growth into alternate technologies. Position Overview: Our team consists of staff members with the general data and business capabilities listed below, yet each individual often brings specific tools and technology experience required for our engagements. Currently, we are seeking a data management professional with experience in the implementation and development of data and BI solutions. Experience must include strong database development fundamentals and BI solution implementation experience in a client-facing setting. Successful candidates will have experience, in a formal or informal role, leading or mentoring others within in at least 1 or 2 projects. Past application development experience with .NET or Java is desirable, as is experience in public sector, healthcare or life sciences. Responsibilities:Lead and mentor Associate Consultants on project teams and develop and own design decisionsLead the design and build of data management solutions which provide data acquisition, data quality, data transformation, master data management and data integration of disparate sourcesLead the design and build of dashboards, visualizations and analyticsContribute towards data modelling, data warehouse build and ETL activityGenerate solution documentation for design, training and support purposesWork to a high standard of design and delivery within pre-determined timelinesProvide regular and accurate progress reporting and communication to B&D colleaguesWork within Agile frameworks such as SCRUMPartner with client stakeholders as appropriateQualifications6+ years of experience working with data in analysis and management context and 10+ years of overall professional work experienceStrong business skills, including stakeholder management, preparing and delivering presentations and workshops, and collecting (and challenging) requirementsCompetency with relational databases (SQL Server, Oracle, etc.) including experience with product specific SQL, such as PL/SQL or T-SQLCompetency with an ETL technology, such as Informatica, Data Stage, Talend, ODI, SSIS, etc.Familiarity with data modelling and integration methodologies or techniques including Star Schema, 3NF, Inmon/Kimball, Data Vault, etc.Expertise in solutions architecture for data management solutions, such as MDM, data quality, or data security is desirableThe ability to capture business requirements and lead workshopsAn awareness of test and QA proceduresAbility to travel – Travel schedules range from 0 – 75%, as business needs dictate Business & Decision, North America, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer M/F/D/V

Name: Programmer Analyst

Analyzes and evaluates user requirements characterized by more complex programming and analytical requirements. Develops customizations, interfaces and reports based on end user requirements. Has strong SQL programming skills. Writes complex queries that use data from PCOM’s integrated computer system (Banner). Assumes responsibility for providing secondary support of other applications. Analyzes hardware and software alternatives and works on special projects as required. Monitors all projects in development and provides weekly status report to supervisor.Maintains established department policies, procedures, objectives, quality assurance, safety, environmental and infection control (computer viruses).Maintains professional contacts with other companies, research bodies and equipment manufacturers concerning computer applications and equipment.Monitors all projects and provides periodic status reports.Plans user training for new systems and programs.Researches new developments in hardware and software. Keeps abreast of latest developments and studies regarding effective procedures and methods in software customization.Tests and debugs programs for accuracy and completeness.Prepares written documentation as required by the profession and the department.Evaluates requests for user assistance and provides timetables for completion.Enhances professional growth and development through participation in educational programs, current literature, in service meetings and workshops.Attends meetings as required.Performs other related duties as assigned or requested. Some experience with Web technologies and development. Name: IT Sr. Systems Analyst Quality Systems
Description: SUMMARY This position is a technically oriented role and will perform as hands-on technical analyst and IT systems owner to provide IT operational support for all IT systems, solutions, and applications in support of Quality operations. Key responsibilities include: Execute daily IT operations (e.g. configuration, administration, master data management, etc.) of all IT systems and services in scope. Follow IT GxP procedures.Collaborate with Business Systems Owners and IT colleaguesStrong Partnership with the Quality Organization As IT owner of established systems, accountable to ensure such systems are fit-for-purpose for our business processes, and serve as main point of contact for escalation of any system issues, data integrations and system enhancements. Own and create test plans, user acceptance tests, and coordinate training and roll-out.REQUIREMENTSBachelors Degree in Computer Science/Information Systems related or equivalent experience5+ years of Name: Hedis Analyst
Description: CAN WORK ANYWHERE REMOTE IN THE UNITED STATES.Responsibilities: Supports corporate, plan-level, and departmental strategies and goals for HEDIS process. Meets this standard by effectively applying both business knowledge and technical expertise to support business initiatives and solve business problems. Essential Functions include but not limited: Manage the HEDIS lifecycle process for multiple plans.  Responsible for assuring the accuracy and validity of both source data and results and interpreting results into recommendations.  In collaboration with the HEDIS manager to develop annual HEDIS project plans and monitor the HEDIS project plans for multiple LOBs.  Assist in preparation for the HEDIS audit.  Develop and maintain HEDIS based report to support Quality Initiatives.  Represent HEDIS team in collaboration with internal departments for HEDIS improvement.  Ensures all data sent to HEDIS software vendor are accurate and meet HEDIS reporting timeline.  Assists as necessary in the HEDIS Road Map and all other documents required by auditors.  Able to assimilate into team within minimum amount of assistance  Assures the ongoing high performance level of the overall department through continued knowledge acquisition and knowledge sharing with co-workers.  Experience and ability to utilize a certified HEDIS software. Education & Experience: Bachelors degree required with a concentration in health care related field; Masters degree is preferred  Minimum 1 year HEDIS experience required; 2+ years experience with HEDIS preferred.  Minimum 5 years of work experience in healthcare and/or managed care  Other skills:SQL and / or SAS experience required  Opportunity to work remotely commensurate to HEDIS experience

Name: Product Analyst
Description: Product Analyst – Office of General Counsel NAChubb is the world’s largest publicly traded property and casualty insurer. With operations in 54 countries, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. The company is distinguished by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength, underwriting excellence, superior claims handling expertise and local operations globally. Office of General Counsel - Philosophy and Culture Statement: The OGC is committed to providing best-in-class legal and compliance services to our CHUBB Insurance Group business partners. The OGC emphasizes teamwork, expertise and a “can-do” attitude. Operating as a best-in-class organization requires a commitment to constant improvement and an on-going commitment to adding value – every day, by every team member. The group takes pride in delivering consistent customer satisfaction, advancing self-development among team members, participating in company and team initiatives – all with a focus on superior execution.  Major Duties and Responsibilities: Work with the Product Manager and Business Units to develop information required for filings.Prepare filings for entry into SERFF; track and respond to product objections with Business Unit input.Submit filings on a timely basis striving for 100" accuracy.Respond to state filing objections in a timely manner and track progress on internal communication program (Pipeline) and communicate results to Business Unit.Work closely with the Product Managers and Business units to assist in maintaining forms, rules and rating plans so they are in compliance with regulatory requirements.Participate in and support regulatory compliance activities including audits of business units, Market Conduct Examinations, specialty lines endorsement processing and regulatory review of all forms.Work on special projects as needed. Education and Experience: Bachelor degree or equivalent industry experience in product management and regulatory issues.At least 3 – 5 years of experience in Property & Casualty products, preferably Property/Package, in underwriting, product management or regulatory compliance. General Skills: General knowledge of Property & Casualty insurance product policy language and coverages, with emphasis on Property/Package experience preferable.Strong organizational and project management skillsProjects a sense of urgencyAbility to work independently and as part of a teamComputer proficient in using Word, Excel, Adobe Pro, SERFFExcellent written and oral communication skillsDemonstrates strong attention to detail and commitment to project ownership, accuracy and completion on a timely basis Personal Qualities: Strong desire to be responsive to customer needsSelf-motivated with a strong work ethicEnergetic, enthusiastic and has a good attitudeAbility to manage a number of projects, different demands and competing customers simultaneously in a fast-paced environmentFlexible CHUBB offers a competitive salary plus cash bonus, equity opportunities and a comprehensive benefits package including life, health, dental, vision, a generous retirement savings plan with a generous company match, disability coverage, stock purchase plan, flexible spending accounts, tuition reimbursement, and business casual dress.  Sound like the right job for you? For consideration, please apply below. If you’d like additional information about CHUBB USA, please visit our website at www.CHUBB.com.

Name: Analyst Intern - Summer
Description: Duration: Ten- Twelve weeks over the course of Summer 2019  Location: Opportunities in Boston, Chicago, Stamford, New York City, Washington D.C., Philadelphia, Atlanta, Houston, Seattle, San Francisco and Los Angeles  Start Date: Flexible  Hours: 40 hours per week  Application Deadline: January 21, 2019 Organization Profile Spencer Stuart is the leading privately held, global executive search consultancy. We are the advisor of choice among top companies seeking guidance and counsel on senior leadership needs, including executive recruiting, succession planning, organizational design and corporate governance. Our clients range across industries, from the world's largest companies to medium-sized businesses, not-for-profits and entrepreneurial start-ups. We operate out of 57 offices in 30 countries. Last year alone, Spencer Stuart conducted over 4,000 assignments around the world placing top corporate executives and board members of leading Fortune 500 companies. The Spencer Stuart Internship Spencer Stuart offers analyst interns a fast-paced, intellectually engaging, entrepreneurial environment working with a diverse group of energetic professionals who are former business leaders and management consultants. Interns have a unique opportunity to gain broad exposure to a variety of industries and functions and to learn about the careers of leading executives around the world. Interns also participate in trainings designed to broaden their skill set and familiarity with executive search. Position Description Analyst interns will work on strategic projects in teams with associates and consultants. Responsibilities include: Coordinating and completing business analysis on multi-faceted business development projects;Bringing creative solutions to search assignments and new business issues.Providing research and analysis support to management and participating in special projects. Analyst interns will work simultaneously on a variety of projects that vary greatly in size and complexity. Some projects target a narrowly defined business problem, while other projects address much larger strategic needs which may result in the creation of a presentation, report, or intellectual capital piece (i.e. article). Interns will be asked to present an overview of their work to their office at the conclusion of their internship. Qualification ProfileRising seniors only.A solid academic record is required (all majors welcome)Broad extracurricular involvement and leadership experience.Strong analytical, communication and writing skills.Proficiency with MS Office applications such as Excel, PowerPoint, and Word is required.Previous experience in a research capacity (either through coursework or previous internships) is a plus. Spencer Stuart is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer F/M/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

Name: Product Operations Analyst
Description: Bring your drive for excellence, team orientation and customer commitment to IBC; help us renew and reimagine our business and shape the future of health care. Our organization is looking to diversify, grow, innovate and serve, and we are looking for committed, empowered learning-oriented people to join our team. If this describes you, we want to speak with you. Job Summary:The Product Operations Analyst will support important initiatives for the Dental and Vision lines of business from the perspective of:Implementing product launches, enhancements, and maintenance across all segments within the Independence Blue Cross Family of Companies (IBC FOC),Operational issue resolution,Operational process improvement, andAudit support.Communicate with our external vendor-partners, United Concordia Dental (UCD) and Davis Vision, and our platform vendor Highmark, for successful dental and vision product delivery.Collaborate with various departments across the IBC FOC including Client Setup, BTS, Customer Service, Medical Products, and others.Significant Job Duties:Manage operations and implementation of Dental and Vision products, including launches, enhancements and maintenance. This includes the annual Affordable Care Act (ACA) product offerings in the Consumer and Small Group segments. Duties include:Developing product grids describing plan benefits,Managing relationship with Legal and providing subject matter expertise for development of accurate filings, assess whether filings are accurate, approve and provide final sign-off from Specialty Product department of filings, andManaging relationship and communication with Highmark and vendor/partners to ensure accurate plan administration.Perform operational root cause analysis. Develops and recommends solutions. Manages solution implementation across the family of companies and with external vendors.Develops processes and works to improve existing processes to prevent future operational issues and to promote efficiency.Responsible for internal and external audit requests which includes working with corporate audit departments to understand requirements, coordinating with vendor/partners to obtain and QA needed data.Support ad-hoc and corporate projects, including but not limited to the current Product Configurator corporate initiative for a marketing system replacement.
