Name: Business Analyst - Sunrise
Description: Welcome to Allscripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.  The primary purpose of this role is to create the business and/or functional requirements necessary for technology solutions that meet customer needs, expected delivery dates, and exceptional quality standards. Work under the direction of the Manager to provide application solutions for assigned business areasPossess functional knowledge of assigned application technologyInteract with business users to understand new business requirements and enhancement requestsServe liaison role between application technology vendors, internal IS groups, and business usersTranslate business requirements into product-specific designs and configuration, detailed requirement specifications and use casesDeliver functional specifications, design documents, business process workflow and related documentation for new development projects and/or enhancement and modification requests to be used by Systems AnalystInteract with Systems Analysts during the software build and/or configuration process and testing processPerform functional application configuration and configure /run reports at user requestDesign and execute functional, integration, and regression test plans for new application functionality, product releases and enhancement and regulatory modifications using business scenarios and use casesEnsure programs meet business specificationsDemonstrate new functionality to business users seeking inputs on future directionReview vendor provided documentation and user manuals needed to support the productDirectly interface with business users by responding to support calls escalated by the Service DeskParticipate in user focus groups and requirements workshops, vendor training and demonstrationsAssist in supporting activations and rolloutsConsistent efforts to deliver quality solutions as per agreed scopeCustomer focus and close alignment with the customers’ business objectivesEnsure efforts to continually improve domain knowledgeEnsure the quality of the deliverables as per the defined defects standardsDocument issues with resolutions and share with team members to improve team productivityProvide data to generate team performance metricsKnowledge transfer with other team members to improve overall team education levelTake complete ownership for the assigned task and timely inform the progress of the project / task to all stakeholdersAdherence to the defined standardsTake initiative and drives to bring to logical conclusion; proactive approachProvide accurate and timely information and escalates when there are issuesActively participate in meetings and make valuable contribution Academic and professional qualifications: Bachelor's degree preferred and/or other relevant combination of training and experienceExperience:0-2 years Industry experience preferred2-5 years practical experience in providing technical support and maintenance in assigned product preferredClinical experience and/or software design expertise is required.Clinical software implementation background strongly desired.Experience with functional design of system solutions for presented business problemsExperience reviewing end-user documentation, training internal users (customer support, implementation, education services teams) on application features and working to set and meet project delivery dates.Strong communication and writing skillsAbility to work independently as well as in a collaborative team environment; self-motivation; excellent problem-solving skills and strong organization skills are required Travel requirements: May require local travelMay require other travel for business needs Working arrangements:May require after hours on call supportWork is performed in a standard office environment with minimal exposure to health or safety hazards At Allscripts, our greatest strength comes from bringing together talented people with diverse perspectives to support the technology needs of 180,000 physicians, 1,500 hospitals and 10,000 post-acute organizations across the globe. Allscripts offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package, including holidays, vacation, medical, dental, and vision insurance, company paid life insurance and retirement savings.  Allscripts’ policy is to provide equal employment opportunity and affirmative action in all of its employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category. Applicants for North American based positions with Allscripts must be legally authorized to work in the United States or Canada. Verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire.  From a "VEVRAA Federal Contractor" We request Priority Referral of Protected Veterans

Name: Lead Analyst, Supply Chain Analytics
Description: Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world’s best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast. SummaryThe Lead Analyst of Business Intelligence / Data Analytics is a key role within Comcast's Integrated Supply Chain Organization (ISCO). The role involves a combination of responsibilities collating business requirements from stakeholders, front end dashboard development, back end data cleansing and modeling, project management, and mentoring other junior developers in the team. The role also provides scope for participating in advanced analytics activities in the larger team. Core Responsibilities- Based on stakeholder change or enhancement request, assesses data availability, technique, and tool usage to best satisfy the need. - Interacts and collaborates with cross-functional group across supply chain, IT, finance, product development and others to design the best possible solution.- Showcases ability to extract, collate, and transform data from disparate systems for reporting and analytics use.- Design visually interactive and actionable dashboards using data visualization tools. Understand the needs of non-technical internal users to present the results that can be easily consumed and acted upon.- Manage multiple projects / workflows at the same time and ensuring visibility of the progress to stakeholders.- Solve analytical problems using quantitative approaches by developing predictive models.- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.Technical Skills:- Good at writing SQLs on different database flavors namely Oracle, Hive, Presto etc. Optimize and fine-tune SQL queries for performance.- Solid understanding of big data analytics and data warehouses / data marts (including data extraction techniques / ETL).- Experience in using a data analytics and visualization platforms (Tableau and / or open source).- Experience is using data mining tools and techniques for quantitative analysis. - Knowledge and experience in Scrum / Kanban SDLC.- Coding / programming (VBA, Python).- Project management.Preferred, but not required:- Working knowledge of supply chain management processes, systems, and best practices.- Practical application/ use of Hadoop (or other open-source software framework for big data- R programming language (or other related open source language that supports statistical computing)- Exposure to advanced optimization (operations research), simulationEducation Level: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Supply Chain / Operational Research, or other related field.Field of Study: Information Sciences, Technology, Computer Science.Years of Experience: Generally requires 4-6 years experience in the field of data analytics with focus on data modeling and dashboard development.  Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

Name: Supply Chain Analyst
Description: The Supply Chain Analyst will assist in development of innovative solutions and analytical support for transportation and distribution current and future client operations. This position is located in Cherry Hill, NJ.Essential Duties & Responsibilities: Collects data and performs statistical analysis.Maps and documents processes.Conducts distribution/transportation analysis and/or time studies to establish standards.Participates in continuous improvement projects.Works with other team members to develop alternative solutions.Uses Lean Six Sigma tools (5s and 5whys).Requirements:Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Industrial Engineering, Operations Research, Business, Supply Chain, Information Systems, or other quantitative field of studyMinimum 0-3 years of experience in any of the following areas; transportation management, dedicated fleet operations, distribution center management, materials handling, decision support systems and technology.Demonstrated data manipulation skillsExcellent communications skills.Basic knowledge of supply chain strategies and methodologiesWell organized with high attention to detail and accuracyDemonstrated ability to learn technical skills quicklyUnderstanding of optimization and/or simulation algorithmsDatabase skills, especially through SQL or Access, CADStrong computer proficiency in MS Office applicationsBilingual Spanish is preferred. Both verbal and written. *  Job Type: Full-time

If so, this could be the perfect job for you! The ideal candidate will be skilled in Excel and have strong organizational skills. Â Billing Analyst Responsibilities * Manage customer accounts * Review billing specifications for contracts * Communicate with operations management in order to ensure timely receipt of data and invoice submissions * Handle special billing requests * Research and respond to billing inquiries Â Billing Analyst Qualifications * 2-5 years of Billing/ Accounts Receivable experience * Bachelorâs Degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration * Microsoft Office with intermediate knowledge of MS Excel * Strong Organizational skills * Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Name: Senior Finance Analyst - Programs
Description: Sr. Program Finance AnalystWe are searching for a Sr. Program Finance Analyst for our Power Distribution- Philadelphia location.The Program Finance Analyst is responsible for executing timely, accurate and complete financial analysis. Analysts are intimately involved in the support of all phases of a contract, from proposal preparation through contract closeout. Analysts must understand the requirements of their customers and provide useful, timely data to assist management in the decision-making process. You will demonstrate success by:Providing in-depth financial analysis and reporting of program performance, including but not limited to; actuals to date, estimate to complete (ETC), estimate at complete (EAC), variance analysis and earned value (EV).Using standard EVMS techniques analyst tracks, analyzing and reporting cost and schedule performance against baseline. Ensuring programs are compliant to EAC policy and are operating according to the processes established by the division.Acting as the subject matter expert for financial performance of their programs, providing management with an early warning of potential performance issues, identifying risks and offering solutions. Updating weekly/monthly program reporting requirements, offering analytical insight and offering recommends.Ensuring that actual cost reported agree to the general ledger and that all estimates provided by other functional organizations are properly supported with reasonable basis of estimates.Responsible for pricing proposals ranging in size and complexity, adding insight beyond the numbers themselves.Responsible for generating FAR 15-2 compliant cost volumes when required.Converting cost proposals to contract budgets and performing financial budget tracking for contracts.Participating in the bid process, by assisting capture team with establishing the cost accounts and earned value criteria for the program.Participating in the ongoing implementation of common system level tools that help drive better program performance.Recommending and implementing process improvements with regard to program financial analysis and financial reporting.Adhering to L3 Technologies Sarbanes-Oxley Internal Controls over Financial Reporting (ICFRs) for applicable cycles (EAC, Revenue, etc) as well as L3 Technologies Corporate Accounting Policies.Our Values are an integral part of who we are. We seek candidates who share our values:IntegrityExcellenceAccountabilityRespectCompetencies:Possess a solid fundamental understanding of the outputs, specifically being able to communicate the logic to management as it applies to variances. Possess the ability to understand the requirements of their internal customers and provide useful, timely data to assist in the decision-making process.Ability to focus on details with regard to procedure and workflow.Ability to work under pressure and against tight deadlines.Ability to coordinate and communicate effectively (both writing and verbally) with other departments and customers, both internal and external.Ability to work in a team environment and develop strong working relationships with coworkers across all departments.Highly organized, able to prioritize workload, and meet strict deadlines.High level of attention to detail and accuracy.Requirements:5-9 years of relevant experience.Experience with earned value management systems (EVMS).Prior experience with integration system level tools such as ERP systems, Cobra earned value, Pro Pricer and resource planning tools.Advanced proficiency with MS Office Suite and must have expert level Excel skills.Must have good working knowledge of MS ProjectWorking knowledge of Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR & DFAR) and Cost Accounting Standards (CAS).Bachelor’s degree in business administration, finance or accounting required. Desired: Prior industry experience preferred.Previous experience using Deltek Cobra desirable. Experience with Pro Pricer tool and the proposal process desirable.SAVING LIVES AND MAKING THE WORLD A SAFER PLACE TO LIVEL3 Technologies, Inc. is proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. L3 provides equal employment opportunity for all persons, in all facets of employment. L3 maintains a drug-free workplace and performs pre-employment substance abuse testing and background checks. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply for any open position for which they feel they are qualified and all will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic.

Name: Senior Analyst - Business Continuity
Description: Responsible for supporting the global development and maintenance of the organization’s business continuity strategy, and implementation of pragmatic practices in support of management-approved response and recovery objectives. Collaborates with key business and technology leaders globally to develop business continuity standards and action plans. Directs all business continuity management activities and tasks to provide for the availability of business functionality, technology and communications capabilities and information. Ensures that VWR complies with existing laws and regulations (at the international, national/country, regional, and state level), as well as contractual obligations. Addresses customer inquiries regarding VWR’s business continuity capabilities. Responsible for ensuring that business practices and technologies are implemented to reduce the risk associated with known vulnerabilities.  Provides professional, specialized skills in support of business continuity management activities, including business continuity project management, as well as problem analysis and resolution. Participates in major project assignments to include:  Assisting management in resolving business issues related to response and recovery planning, including plan development / enhancement.  Capitalize on business opportunities to refine processes and technologies to mitigate exposure during disruptions of service.  Ensure core process business continuity strategies, plans and staff are in a constant state of readiness.  MAJOR JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (List in order of importance)  Defines and maintains the ongoing business continuity management program structure, planning tools, maintenance and milestone expectations, and the timelines and activities required to expand, enhance and maintain the business continuity program.  Ensures that appropriate business areas are considered for inclusion within in the business continuity program.  Ensures all business continuity management efforts are performed based on VWR policy and ISO 22301 requirements.  Develop and maintain Business Continuity policies, standards, guidelines and Standard Operating procedures.  Leads all business continuity management review efforts and presents program readiness information to executive management on a recurring basis based on sponsor-approved metrics.  Coordinates the corrective / preventative actions processes.  Facilitates the identification of response and recovery objectives in accordance with Business Impact Analysis, plan development and testing.  Validates that response and recovery objectives align with VWR’s business strategy and goals.  Facilitates the development, documentation and implementation of strategies to effectively recover critical business processes and technologies associated with key products and services; seeks approve for resources to implement and maintains essential risk management capabilities.  Conducts awareness training for key program stakeholders, including recurring exercises.  Identifies opportunities to refine day-to-day business processes and technologies to mitigate business continuity risk.  Supports business continuity and disaster recovery plan owners with issues related to implementation and maintenance of plan documents.  Manages the development and maintenance of the VWR crisis management and crisis communications plans globally.  Coordinates crisis management efforts from onset through resolution.  Manages business continuity technologies, including the both the plan repository and the emergency notification system; ensures timely situational updates to internal and external stakeholders.  Evaluates and assesses potential disruptive events and determines the need to escalate the event to a member of a crisis management team.  Participates in all after action review activities, and takes corrective action as warranted.  Coordinates with internal audit to ensure compliance with internal standards.  Performs other duties as assigned.  Domestic and international travel will be required up to 10 to 15%.  QUALIFICATIONS (Education/Training, Experience and Certifications)  Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or other related field.  Relevant work experience: A minimum five+ years of information technology, risk management, internal audit and/ or business continuity/disaster recovery/crisis management work experience, with at least two years of project management and other leadership experience in managing multiple, large, cross-functional teams or projects, and influencing senior level management and key stakeholders.  Certified Business Continuity Professional (CBCP), Master Business Continuity Professional (MBCP), or equivalent certification preferred.  KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES (Those necessary to perform the job competently)  Ability to translate business continuity concepts and processes to enable business needs and requirements; function as a consultant to business and technology management regarding business continuity matters.  Strong verbal and written communication skills and collaborative abilities.  Knowledge of governance processes and policy formation.  Experience working with international business entities.  Thorough understanding of compliance/regulatory requirements and initiatives.  Knowledge and experience working with distribution, logistics and call center processes.  Broad technology knowledge and understanding specific to infrastructure and operations.  Ability to adapt to a rapidly changing business and technology landscape.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.  Customer focus and ability to manage client expectations.  Proven leadership and personnel management and development abilities; ability to mentor and train staff in pursuit of their professional goals and objectives.  A working knowledge of management system concepts, with particular emphasis on ISO 22301 specification; strong working knowledge of business continuity best practices.

Name: Business Solutions Analyst
Description: Business Solutions AnalystFinancial LifecycleWayne, PA The business solutions analyst will manage production maintenance for the current payments platform. They will work with the end users to help identify opportunities for system enhancements that will improve process flows and efficiency. They will manage enhancements through the SDLC process to ensure programming meets the end user criteria and enhancements are successfully released into the production environment. The business solutions analyst will track recurring system issues and identify training needs. They will assist in knowledge sharing between the operations and payments teams. They will administer external admin access within the payments platform. Summary of Essential Job FunctionsHold meetings with the end user to understand their needs and identify areas for system improvement.Assist in managing system enhancement requests made by the payments team and help prioritize themEstablish user requirements for enhancements to the existing payments systemManage enhancements through the system development life cycleManage level 2 system cases to identify areas of training, system or process issuesConduct implementation training and produce documentation as neededManage and perform admin functionality within the payments systemEnsures system knowledge sharing by training key personal and providing supportProvide support and guidance to Payment Department when questions arise as it relates to systemsSupervisory Responsibilities There are no supervisory responsibilities with this role Minimum Experience RequirementsBachelor’s Degree in IT, Accounting, Finance or Business or related fieldPrior pharmaceutical clinical trial experience specifically grant payment or contract activities is preferredWorking knowledge of accounting applications for invoicing and accounts payableExperience using SAP-Business One, or other ERP systemDemonstrate ability to analyze, interpret and communicate end user system needs1+ years of experience working in the Payments applicationStrong knowledge of payments processes and controlsSkill RequirementsStrong PC skills (i.e. Microsoft Office)Organized and Detail OrientedExcellent problem-solving skills and creative solving of technical problemsExceptional collaboration and listening skills requiredAbility to think abstractly and outside of the normAbility to learn new concepts and software is necessaryStrong analytical skills and ability to document complex business processesStrong verbal and written communication skillsAbility to prioritize independently

Name: Technical Analyst 1-Tech Bar
Description: Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world’s best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast. Responsible for helping Comcast’s employees, contractors and interns get the most out of their technology by creating memorable client experiences and delivering outstanding customer service. With an established history of leadership in a technical support environment, provide administrative support and mentoring to both junior and senior teammates. More than just a ‘help desk,’ Comcast’s Tech Bars are the top destination for walk up IT support on our Philadelphia campus and offer a fast paced and fun environment, providing troubleshooting, IT/networking support and technology education to our diverse clientele. Our focus is on ‘fixing our client’s day,’ solving their problems and getting them back to work in a timely manner.??Core Responsibilities:- Evaluates, prioritizes and addresses service requests brought to us by our clients through many different avenues.- Documents all client interactions with an impeccable degree of accuracy and completeness.- Approaches issues with a solutions-oriented focus, identifying road blocks and innovating new support strategies to get around them, reflecting a ‘can-do’ attitude.- Consults with clients in addressing problems, collaborating with them (as well as teammates and other teams) to form solutions. Maintains an exceptional level of communication with clients from start to finish.- Serves as a technology consultant to our clients, providing needs-based recommendations for their hardware and software buying decisions. - Educates clients on the use of their technology- Assists other IT teams as needed with project implementation.- Communicates with clients in easy to understand terms, avoiding tech ‘jargon.’- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.Job Specification:- Generally requires 0 to 2 years related experience- Associate’s Degree or Equivalent- Minimum of two years of experience in a customer service related job  Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

Name: SharePoint Technical Analyst 123234
Description: A global law firm is seeking a SharePoint Technical Analyst to join their team in Philadelphia. Requirements: An expert level understanding of Enterprise Content Management  Thea ability to customize all SharePoint objects including Lists and Libraries  Familiar with creating and editing SharePoint pages, configuring SharePoint webparts, and building applications using SharePoint webparts  Demonstrated knowledge configuring SharePoint search and SharePoint Business Data Connectivity services  Comfortable migrating data to and from SharePoint  A proven track record building PowerShell scripts for SharePoint  Working knowledge with Microsoft PnP templates  Proficient in JavaScript/CSS  Experience with SharePoint server administration  An understanding of Metalogix SharePoint Migration Tools  A current MS Certification  Apply

Name: Spend Analyst Intern
Description: As a Spend Analysis Intern at Source One Management Services, you will get to work on client and internal excel-based deliverables with our Spend Analysis Team. The primary function of this internship is to categorize and analyze expenditures from disparate data sources such as general ledgers, p-cards, and purchase orders in order to glean insights for client work and help develop internal spend analysis tools built by our Data Science Team. An ideal candidate is comfortable working in Excel and is interested in understanding business purchasing operations, procurement strategy, spend data, contract negotiation, and business analytics. An ideal candidate will possess analytical and critical thinking skills, is able to work independently, as well as in a team setting, and is able to follow directions.What will I do?Key ResponsibilitiesSupport in data cleansing activities as required.Execute, analyze, and present client vendor analyses alongside members of the project management office (PMO) and spend analysis lead.Document data governance processes and rules.Assist the spend analysis lead in maintaining operational governance of vendor data by running, and interpreting ad-hoc reports as needed.Develop action plans and initiatives to drive the improvement of supplier master data.Who should apply?Required Qualifications:Currently pursuing an undergraduate or master degree in mathematics, statistics, predictive analytics, information systems, or an equivalent major.Intermediate Excel analytical skills.Strong analytical, problem solving, and diagnostic skill.Ability to work independently and in a team environment, meet individual/team deadlines, and deal with pressures associated with those deadlines.Desired Qualifications:Ability to perform ETL (Extract, Transform, and Load) processes by means of SQL.Proficient ability to automate Microsoft Office based tasks in VBA.Demonstrated ability to code in a scripting language. Experience performing analytics driven work with BI tools.Company Insights Since 1992, Source One has been and is a premier procurement services provider and strategic sourcing consulting firm. Our team of spend management and category experts support best-in-class organizations by ensuring their procurement and sourcing capabilities are optimized and that they are getting the most value at the best possible price from their suppliers. Simply put, we help our customers save money by renegotiating existing contracts, streamlining and optimizing processes, and acting as decision support for their procurement and sourcing needs operating under three main verticals: IT & Telecom, Marketing, and Supply Chain.  As a group of out-of-the-box thinkers and motivated individuals, we are always eager to have new members to the team to gain fresh ideas and insights for continuous process improvement and growth.  We take pride in recruiting, developing and retaining highly talented individuals. In addition to the competitive salaries offered to our full-time employees, we provide an attractive vacation policy and benefits which include access to a 401K plan and disability, life, and medical insurance. Please visit us on the web at www.sourceoneinc.com. Interested in a career at Source One? Heres how to apply: Please apply on our web portal: http://jobs.sourceoneinc.com/  We ask that you make sure to include your salary requirements. Please do not contact anyone at the company directly.

Name: Data Privacy Analyst
Description: FMC Corporation is a leading specialty company focused on agricultural technologies. FMC provides innovative and cost-effective solutions to enhance crop yield and quality by controlling a broad spectrum of insects, weeds and disease, as well as in non-agricultural markets for pest control.FMC is a globally diverse organization that offers its employees exciting opportunities to work on challenging projects that are important to the achievement of our strategic objectives. Your education and professional experience are valued and put to use from day one. Your success at completing key initiatives can result in a varied, progressive and fulfilling career with FMC.With a corporate culture of innovation, integrity, responsibility and customer intimacy, we foster “The Right Chemistry” in everything we do. We are looking for people to join us in creating, developing, and improving our products, our processes, and our markets. If you are ready to make a difference every day, FMC is ready to talk to you.This position reports to the Data Privacy Senior Manager and is a key position within the Privacy group which is responsible for helping to oversee the various Privacy initiatives within FMC. The position will interact with members of various departments throughout FMC including Legal, Compliance, HR, IT and Risk. The successful candidate must be able to collaborate with the business groups while achieving deadlines. Inform and advise the controller, processor and employees who process personal data of their obligations pursuant to the GDPR and other laws and regulations as it relates to personal dataAssist in the monitoring of compliance with the GDPR and with the policies of the controller or processor in relation to the protection of personal data including assignment of responsibilities, awareness-raising and train of staff involved in processing operations and the related auditsTake minutes of meetings, specifically action items and decisions made by the Privacy Group.Draft materials/presentations for Senior Leadership review.Update Privacy documents within FMC Data Privacy Tools and SharePoint.Maintain a working knowledge and understanding of relevant privacy laws and regulations related to FMC’s Privacy programMaintain the privacy training program for new and current employees -- and provides additional specific training to departments or roles/projects, as needed.Cooperate with the supervisory authority, as neededMonitor the Data Privacy email account, and act as a point of contact for data subjects with regards to questions or issues related to processing of personal data and to the exercise of their rights under the regulation, as needed, and in consultation with the Data Privacy Senior Manager.Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in Business or Computer Science, or Associates’ Degree and two years’ experience in Data Privacy or related area.Prior experience using MS Office products (Word, Excel, Project, PowerPoint, and Visio)Must have experience with risk management standards and frameworks.Must have experience performing compliance activities.Strong planning and project management skills and the ability to apply these skills in effective working partnerships across organizational linesWork independently, possess strong written and verbal communication skills and be capable of building rapport among stakeholdersKnowledge of privacy principles and practices, legislation and investigative processes would be an asset.Professional qualifications/certifications relating to data protection and/or information security (CIPM, CIPP/E, CIPP/A, security certifications) preferred or willingness to complete.Experience implementing data protection measures and/or frameworksExperience with risk management standards and frameworksExperience managing key systems and processes involved in security of personal dataAbility to work independently requiring minimal supervision.Organized and able to multitask.Portray professional demeanor.Professional level of written and oral communication and presentation skills.Demonstrate a self-directed approach to learning new technologies in the field; pursue professional development.Establish and nurture collaborative professional relationships.Flexibility and adaptability in approach to work.Capable of working in a fast paced environment with tight deadlines.Comfortable working with all levels within the organization, in a team environment and independently. FMC employees enjoy competitive compensation, a menu of work/life benefits and opportunities to continue developing their skills and building their career. FMC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, gender, disability or protected veteran status. FMC supports a drug-free workplace.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Business Systems Analyst Support our mission of advancing effective evidence-based healthcare worldwide.. Sleep well knowing you are helping achieve a world where safe, high-quality healthcare is accessible to everyone. Responsibilities:The Business Systems Analyst acts as the liaison between the business stakeholders and the development team.Supports the development of high-quality desktop, browser-based and native mobile applications.Participate on an agile team as a Sr Business Systems AnalystCreate and define User Stories and Acceptance Criteria that meet the business unit’s needs.Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developersDevelop and conduct peer reviews of the acceptance criteria to ensure that requirements are correctly interpreted.Partner with the development team to ensure defined User Stories are reflected in the technical design and development.Create, edit, prioritize and manage the backlog of User StoriesParticipate in planning, estimation, daily standup and retrospective meetingsResponsible for reviewing and accepting completed User StoriesCommunicate changes, enhancements, and modifications of the requirements to stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.Deliver internal training on new feature enhancements or products to the business unit.Accountability Metrics:Requirements which meet the needs of the market as defined by the businessOn time high quality delivery of projectsQualifications:7+ years’ experience as a Business Systems Analyst7+ years’ experience in Agile Methodologies (Scrum, Kanban)Healthcare business experience preferredProficient in all aspects of the Software Development Life CycleExperience using issue tracking tools to manage the release processHighly self-motivated and directed with a keen attention to detail.Excellent written, oral, interpersonal, and presentation skillsProven experience working with cross-functional and virtual teamsStrong team player with ability to multi-taskEducation:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field preferred, or equivalent experience

Name: Senior Retirement Consulting Actuarial Analyst
Description: If you like the idea of helping clients achieve financial security and youre a whiz at calculations and data analysis, an actuarial career at Mercer might be a great fit for you. Were an equal opportunity employer committed to embracing a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment, and were looking to attract and retain the best people. Join our Mercer Wealth team! WHAT YOULL DO: As part of Mercers Wealth business, youd support your client team in delivering actuarial consulting services to retirement plan sponsors of mid-size to large organizations. Heres a summary of some things youll need to do in this role: Develop liabilities for defined benefit pension plans and post-retirement medical and life plans using Mercer's valuation software Analyze data, review, and reconcile participant information used for valuation and administration Calculate plan sponsor contribution requirements and accounting results and produce client-facing reports Create individual statements that outline participant pension benefit information Complete annual regulatory requirements for retirement plans, including government filings and audit assistance Assist with special projects and client presentations, including retirement plan design & analysis, financial projections, and strategy Manage internal and external client deadlines and prioritize and address client requests as they arise WHAT WERE LOOKING FOR IN A CANDIDATE: Bachelors degree in math, finance, actuarial science or related field Experience working in teams and with large, complex amounts of data Excellent analytical skills Proficiency in Microsoft Excel Strong communication and project management skills A minimum of one SOA exam passed Commitment to achieving ASA/FSA and EA designations If this sounds like you, wed love to hear from you. Please send in your application. At Mercer, we make a difference in the lives of more than 110 million people every day by advancing their health, wealth, and careers. Were in the business of creating more secure and rewarding futures for our clients and their employees whether were designing affordable health plans, assuring income for retirement or aligning workers with workforce needs. Using analysis and insights as catalysts for change, we anticipate and understand the individual impact of business decisions, now and in the future. We see peoples current and future needs through a lens of innovation, and our holistic view, specialized expertise, and deep analytical rigor underpin each and every idea and solution we offer. For more than 70 years, weve turned our insights into actions, enabling people around the globe to live, work, and retire well. We embrace a culture that celebrates and promotes the many backgrounds, heritages and perspectives of our colleagues and clients. At Mercer, we say we Make Tomorrow, Today . Visit www.mercer.com for more information and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter @MercerMarsh & McLennan Companies offers competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits and programs including: health and welfare, tuition assistance, 401K, employee assistance program, domestic partnership benefits, career mobility, employee network groups, volunteer opportunities, and other programs. For more information about our company, please visit us at: http://www.mmc.com/. We embrace a culture that celebrates and promotes the many backgrounds, heritages and perspectives of our colleagues and clients. For more information, please visit us at: www.mmc.com/diversity .Mercer LLC and its separately incorporated operating entities around the world are part of Marsh & McLennan Companies, a publicly held company (ticker symbol: MMC).Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity employers. Name: Industry Strategy Analyst
Description: Auto req ID 1685BR Posting Title Industry Strategy Analyst Job Location Philadelphia Employment Type Full Time Job Description Morgan, Lewis & Bockius LLP, one of the world’s leading global law firms with almost 4,000 lawyers and staff in 30 offices is seeking to hire an experienced Industry Sector Specialist to reside in our New York, Philadelphia, Washington DC office. The Specialist will be responsible for leading the firm in pursuing revenue generating opportunities within the Banking, Investment Funds, and Insurance industries. This is an exciting opportunity to be directly involved in the strategic direction and planning for an AmLaw Top 10 firm. The position reports to the Director of Strategy & Development. The Industry Sector Specialist, in collaboration with the Firm’s broader Strategy & Development team, is tasked with identifying, implementing and analyzing opportunities to improve the firm’s industry knowledge, client capitalization on industry trends, competitive awareness and benchmarking, thought leadership and brand awareness across key industries that support firm priorities and ultimately drive revenue growth. Primary responsibilities include:Develop and implement, with leadership input, a comprehensive internal and external strategic plan to drive revenue generating opportunities in line with firm priorities and overall industry objectives.Identify and report on opportunities for thought leadership and trend analysis.Maintain and analyze internal data points (firm wide experience – both clients and matters), key contacts, referral work, key metric trends via revenue projections, office/practice group touchpoints, etc.Identify and analyze external data points (key decision makers we should know; potential regulations, technology, or innovation that presents an opportunity or challenge to clients; industry resources/subscription review).Prepare quarterly reports with industry leaders for firm management on key metrics, strategic priorities, hurdles/needs from firm management.Prepare annual partner meeting industry sessions with industry leaders and track follow up efforts/priorities that result from these discussions.Work with Strategy team on a regular basis to ensure consistency and collaboration across all industry efforts and alignment with firm priorities.Work with various functional teams, including most closely with colleagues in the Marketing department, to execute on deliverables including, but not limited to, RFPs/pitches, events, webpage content, any other external collateral creations, third party competitive research, editorial requests and technology needs.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree from a four-year college or university (MBA is highly desired)5+ years of experience in consulting, strategy development or business development (within responsible industry preferred – prior law firm experience is helpful but not required)Industry sector experience in any or all of the following; Banking, Investment Funds, and InsuranceVery strong Excel, Word, and PowerPoint knowledgePrior experience creating and presenting strategic plans to senior managementAbility to work across time zones with global team at all levelsSelf-starter and entrepreneurial spirit, yet highly collaborative in working with colleagues across departments, offices and skill levelsStrong written and verbal communication skills with senior leadership and partners Qualified candidates must apply online by visiting our website at www.morganlewis.com and selecting “Careers.”  Morgan Lewis is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Pursuant to applicable state and municipal Fair Chance Laws and Ordinances, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Gathers and analyzes healthcare data from multiple sources to accomplish goals (e.g. financial, clinical, operational, utilization, market). To succeed in this role you should be analytical and resourceful. Requires excellent communicator, who's able to tell the story behind raw data to non-technical audiences. Must have experience in the healthcare industry. The goal is to help the system grow profitably and measurably impact our clinical and business enterprise.DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES • Gather and integrate data from disparate sources. • Build models and analyze data to determine feasibilities and enterprise impacts. Complete new business pro formas with demand modeling. • Experience and success in working with data visualization tools. Presents and explains information in actionable and clear ways that are meaningful to the customer. • Create and validate record-keeping processes and/or implement other forms of QA. Very detailed and focused on data integrity of product. • Pull and integrate data from disparate sources (e.g. cost accounting, data warehouse,market data). Evaluate and process raw information and transform into a high quality analytical product. • Outstanding organizational and problem-solving aptitude. Ability to synthesize information and produce project deliverables quickly. • Build models that capture a wide range of health care inputs. • Collaborate with management and internal teams to successfully achieve CKHS business development and related growth objectivesQUALIFICATIONS  • MBA or Master's degree in finance or health information desired.  • BS degree in relevant field required (Finance, Health Information, Quantitative Economics, Statistics, Mathematics or related field.) • Proven experience as a Healthcare Data Analyst. • 3+ years of experience in healthcare acquisitions, strategy/business development, operations or financial management in a health care organization. • Must be highly analytical both at a broad strategic level as well as detailed operational level.
